Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Hi! üëãüèº

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Data & Analytics Specialist to take our Data team to the next level üöÄ




1. Team and Role

If you have experience working autonomously on technical data projects, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to enhance Shakers' analytics, with the chance to shape the next generation way of working. If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! ü§©




2. What you¬¥ll be doing

Your day-to-day in Data & Analytics

Writing efficient SQL queries for large-scale data warehouses.
Defining, building, and maintaining ETL models in our data warehouse using dbt and Airflow.
Building data integrations and ensuring data quality across pipeline layers.
Documenting and maintaining code and queries in GitLab.
Creating dashboards and reports in Looker/Looker Studio to communicate results and track KPIs.
Conducting exploratory analysis to shape projects and provide actionable recommendations.
Presenting insights to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Collaborating with PMs, designers, and engineers to define data needs, request app events, integrate third-party tools, and develop data models.
Supporting feature design with product managers and engineers through performance measurement and impact testing.
Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.




3. What we¬¥re looking for

You¬¥re a great fit if you have...

Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling).
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
Fluency in English and Spanish.

Bonus points:

A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
Experience in Startup or fast paced environment




4. What's in it for you?

Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 35.000‚Ç¨ and 46.000‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

Between 35.000‚Ç¨ & 40.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary
Up to 6.000‚Ç¨ quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)

Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö

Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... üìç

Organic fruit
Free caffeine and theine




5. Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this March, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!

The Road to Joining Our Team

Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check, CEO Chat: Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.




More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!




Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!




A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data Analyst




Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our Data Analyst team of Customer Interactions and Monetization Tribe.




Our mission is to enhance business performance through descriptive analytics and business diagnosis, providing insights and recommendations that facilitate better decision-making and lead to improved commercial outcomes.




We seek a dynamic and proactive individual who can engage with business areas, comprehend their needs, understand their services and products, and navigate the data ecosystem to produce precise and meaningful data-driven analyses.




We value a strong and honest team spirit, fostering an excellent and collaborative environment with business stakeholders and your fellow Data Analysts. This contributes to a robust and highly skilled data analyst community.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Engage proactively with business areas to understand their business goals, financial services and products, to generate accurate data-driven business analyses and recommendations.

Analyzing product trends to increase sales conversion, reduce product attrition, improve digital funnels, and support communication campaigns. This involves identifying key performance indicators, monitoring product performance, and suggesting actionable insights to optimize sales strategies and customer experience.

Conducting customer analyses to determine customer lifetime value, customer segmentation, and forecast customer development. This includes using analytical techniques to identify patterns and trends in customer data, enabling the business to tailor its marketing and retention strategies effectively.

Supporting and advising the business on reporting needs and other analytical requirements. This entails collaborating with stakeholders to define reporting metrics, coordinate the development of comprehensive dashboards to ensure data-driven business monitoring and decision-making.




Additionally, you will collaborate closely with your Data Analyst teammates to foster a robust and highly skilled data analyst community. This involves sharing best practices, participating in knowledge-sharing sessions, and contributing to a culture of continuous improvement and excellence.







What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!




Willing to assume challenges, take initiative and personal responsibility.

Desirable thinking in strategic terms. Able to recognize key information, identify business opportunities, establish connections and apply analytics for decision-making.

Willing to learn and improve your technical and your interpersonal skills.

Diven and customer-focused, always striving to understand and meet the needs of the business and its clients.

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, or other degree with strong analytical content.

Full proficiency in Excel, SAS and SQL

At least 5 years of experience in a comparable role, transforming data to extract key business insights. Experience in retail banking is highly recommended

Your communication skills enable you to work together with many different parties throughout our organization. Negotiation and stakeholder management

Fluent English will be appreciated.







What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but‚Ä¶ What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.

Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn‚Äôt take up your time or your cravings.

Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!

Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.

Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids‚Ä¶

Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.

Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!

More vitality and more belonging

360¬∫ care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Runners club with your own trainer.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+) & Leonas.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1600 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead‚Äîthat‚Äôs our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working‚Ä¶we are looking forward to meeting you!

¬†

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
TL;DR:

Data Analyst. Junior-Mid level. Product company, automotive industryüöò. An excellent moment¬† to join our company. Hybrid role based in Madrid. [‚Ç¨24k - ‚Ç¨28k].




Hi




We are REVEL! And we love two things: cars & technology.¬†




REVEL offers an online all-inclusive car subscription experience. Your car delivered to your door. We are currently operating in Spain.




Check our website here: https://driverevel.com




We are on our way to becoming a carbon-neutral company and we have a lot of cool projects ahead :)¬†




We are building a great team for that.




What are we looking for?




We are looking for an enthusiastic creative professional that wants to grow with us. You will be a key resource to provide insights to the Operations team, by merging your business acumen and analytical skills with our historical data.




What will you do at REVEL?




At REVEL we want all our decisions to be supported by data, and for that we have created a specialized team. As a Data Analyst, you will be developing data models in DBT, creating dashboards in Power BI, analyzing historical data, building reports and helping the Operations team grow and become more efficient and data-driven. The core responsibilities include:




Work closely with cross-functional teams (Sales, Fleet, Customer Experience) to understand their data requirements and provide tailored data solutions.
Develop analytical models in DBT and data marts in Power BI to prepare data for analysis
Develop dashboards in Power BI to regularly communicate results and monitor key metrics.
Provide guidance and support to business leaders and stakeholders on how best to harness available data in support of critical business needs and goals
Drive clarity and solve ambiguous, challenging business problems using data-driven approaches




How will your first semester look like at REVEL?

1st month: you will have understood our data stack, dashboards, working methodology, and company culture. You will start analyzing data and sharing insights with the Operations‚Äô teams.
In 3 months: you will be an expert in data analysis of our fleet data and will be able to propose improvements and optimisations based on the insights obtained. The teams will be able to act on your recommendations for improving their processes on a regular basis.¬†
In 6 months: you will be the absolute leader in data analysis for the Operations‚Äô teams¬† at REVEL! You will actively participate in strategic decision-making and contribute to the growth and success of the company.




Essential Requirements:




1-3 years of relevant work experience in a similar role.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Economics, Mathematics, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
Strong background in management and operations is highly valued
Ability to summarize and visualize data (i.e., descriptive statistics and charts).
Experience in creating stories and visualizations to communicate data insights.
Proficiency in PowerBI (preferably) or any other data visualization tool
Proficiency in SQL, writing and understanding complex SQL queries and working with multiple data sources
Help design and implement data pipelines for efficient data collection, transformation, and visualization
Basic knowledge and experience in Python
You are independent in solving problems within your capabilities and proactive in asking for support when the task is beyond your expertise.
You are rigorous, humble, curious and proactive.
English is a must.




Non-essential, but interesting:




Version control GIT
Experience working with DBT
Experience working with APIs¬†
Experience working with cloud data platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP)
You have previously worked in a startup environment.
You have previously worked in agile environments.




What we offer:




An agile environment where your opinions matter and materialize, in fact, we expect you to give your opinion and help us define projects together.
We work in a flexible hybrid approach - you will be able to choose to work from home the days that best suit your needs. We have a very cozy office available in central Madrid, Barcelona, and Sevilla , and¬† we may open other hubs soon.
We are a results-oriented company. You are free to organize your work to suit your daily life.
Annual gross salary in the following range: [‚Ç¨24k - ‚Ç¨28k]
Discount in the subscription of any car of our fleet
Wellhub (Gympass) Silver plan¬†
Cigna healthcare plan
Flexible remuneration through PayFlow
Budget for training: courses, events, etc.
23 days of holidays. If your birthday falls on a weekday, you can have it off too!
Periodic performance reviews.
We are in the middle of a scale-up process so it is a great time to join our company




How we work:




At REVEL we work with short sprints, with measurable objectives and clear requirements. This allows us to organize the work efficiently. We try to put love into everything we do, so attention to detail and accountability for our work are fundamental factors in the way we work.




You will be part of the Data team, but working hand in hand with the Operations team to help them achieve their objectives. Your data analytics skills will complement the Operations team's know-how.

We are on our way to becoming a carbon-neutral company and we have a lot of cool projects ahead :) 


We are building a great team for that.


What are we looking for?


We are looking for an enthusiastic creative professional that wants to grow with us. You will be a key resource to provide insights to the Operations team, by merging your business acumen and analytical skills with our historical data.


What will you do at REVEL?


At REVEL we want all our decisions to be supported by data, and for that we have created a specialized team. As a Data Analyst, you will be developing data models in DBT, creating dashboards in Power BI, analyzing historical data, building reports and helping the Operations team grow and become more efficient and data-driven. The core responsibilities include:


  • Work closely with cross-functional teams (Sales, Fleet, Customer Experience) to understand their data requirements and provide tailored data solutions.
  • Develop analytical models in DBT and data marts in Power BI to prepare data for analysis
  • Develop dashboards in Power BI to regularly communicate results and monitor key metrics.
  • Provide guidance and support to business leaders and stakeholders on how best to harness available data in support of critical business needs and goals
  • Drive clarity and solve ambiguous, challenging business problems using data-driven approaches


How will your first semester look like at REVEL?

  • 1st month: you will have understood our data stack, dashboards, working methodology, and company culture. You will start analyzing data and sharing insights with the Operations‚Äô teams.
  • In 3 months: you will be an expert in data analysis of our fleet data and will be able to propose improvements and optimisations based on the insights obtained. The teams will be able to act on your recommendations for improving their processes on a regular basis. 
  • In 6 months: you will be the absolute leader in data analysis for the Operations‚Äô teams  at REVEL! You will actively participate in strategic decision-making and contribute to the growth and success of the company.


Essential Requirements:


  • 1-3 years of relevant work experience in a similar role.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Economics, Mathematics, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
  • Strong background in management and operations is highly valued
  • Ability to summarize and visualize data (i.e., descriptive statistics and charts).
  • Experience in creating stories and visualizations to communicate data insights.
  • Proficiency in PowerBI (preferably) or any other data visualization tool
  • Proficiency in SQL, writing and understanding complex SQL queries and working with multiple data sources
  • Help design and implement data pipelines for efficient data collection, transformation, and visualization
  • Basic knowledge and experience in Python
  • You are independent in solving problems within your capabilities and proactive in asking for support when the task is beyond your expertise.
  • You are rigorous, humble, curious and proactive.
  • English is a must.


Non-essential, but interesting:


  • Version control GIT
  • Experience working with DBT
  • Experience working with APIs 
  • Experience working with cloud data platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP)
  • You have previously worked in a startup environment.
  • You have previously worked in agile environments.


What we offer:


  • An agile environment where your opinions matter and materialize, in fact, we expect you to give your opinion and help us define projects together.
  • We work in a flexible hybrid approach - you will be able to choose to work from home the days that best suit your needs. We have a very cozy office available in central Madrid, Barcelona, and Sevilla , and  we may open other hubs soon.
  • We are a results-oriented company. You are free to organize your work to suit your daily life.
  • Annual gross salary in the following range: [‚Ç¨24k - ‚Ç¨28k]
  • Discount in the subscription of any car of our fleet
  • Wellhub (Gympass) Silver plan 
  • Cigna healthcare plan
  • Flexible remuneration through PayFlow
  • Budget for training: courses, events, etc.
  • 23 days of holidays. If your birthday falls on a weekday, you can have it off too!
  • Periodic performance reviews.
  • We are in the middle of a scale-up process so it is a great time to join our company


How we work:


At REVEL we work with short sprints, with measurable objectives and clear requirements. This allows us to organize the work efficiently. We try to put love into everything we do, so attention to detail and accountability for our work are fundamental factors in the way we work.


You will be part of the Data team, but working hand in hand with the Operations team to help them achieve their objectives. Your data analytics skills will complement the Operations team's know-how.

Title: Data Analyst - Ignite
Description:
Job Description

About the role:

We are looking for a skilled and driven Data Analyst to support the EMEA Data Product Owner for Chubb‚Äôs e-trading market facing platform, Ignite. This role is instrumental in carrying out the execution of the data strategy alongside the Ignite vision. The Data Analyst will act as a vital resource in analysing data requirements, providing insights, and ensuring that data products meet the needs of business stakeholders. The successful candidate will possess strong analytical capabilities and an understanding of how data can drive decision-making within the organisation.

Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis & Insights:


Partner with business teams and the EMEA Data Product Owner to analyse requirements and identify data sources needed for analytics and reporting applications.
Conduct comprehensive data analyses to extract insights that inform product development and business strategies.
Develop, maintain, and update dashboards, reports, and other visualization tools that track key performance indicators and provide actionable insights to stakeholders.


Support For Product Management


Collaborate with the Data Product Owner to understand and document business needs, translating them into actionable specifications for data features.
Provide data-driven recommendations to improve existing products and contribute to new data product development.
Assist in managing the product backlog by prioritizing features, enhancements, and data pipelines based on business value, technical feasibility, and urgency.


Data Quality & Governance


Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data products by implementing quality checks and identifying opportunities for process improvements.
Document data sources within the enterprise data catalogue, including metadata, lineage, and classification information, adhering to open data standards and governance policies.
Recommend solutions to enhance data quality issues identified in source systems, collaborating with data governance teams as needed.


Collaboration & Communication


Maintain effective communication with the Data Product Owner, project teams, and business stakeholders to ensure alignment on project goals and deliverables.
Report on analysis progress and present findings in a clear, concise manner to non-technical stakeholders.
Work closely with the Data Product Owner to guide the direction of analysis work, ensuring insights align with overall product objectives and business needs.


Analytics Support


Conduct ad-hoc analyses as required to support specific business initiatives or projects.
Create analytical tools and methodologies to facilitate enhanced data insights for the analytics and data science teams.
Collaborate with data engineers to optimize data pipelines for improved scalability and timely data delivery.


Requirements

QUALIFICATIONS


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in data science, Business Administration, Information Systems, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in a data analysis role, preferably in product management or analytics settings within the insurance or financial services industry.
Proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Python, R) and data visualization software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Demonstrated understanding of data management principles and best practices.


Beneficial Skills


Familiarity with Agile methodologies and experience using project management tools (e.g., JIRA).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to turn complex data findings into actionable insights.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, capable of translating complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Knowledge of the insurance industry is a plus, particularly understanding underwriting, actuarial work, or operational processes.


Reporting Structure

The Data Analyst will report to EMEA Ignite Data Product Owner will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams including data engineers, business analysts, and operational teams.

What We Offer In Return


30+ days of vacation a year
2 days working from home option + additional flexible days
Working from home allowance
Entry time flexibility
Medical insurance
Life and accident insurance
Meal allowance
Pension plan
Stock Purchase plan
Flexible compensation scheme
Gympass
Employee assistance program
Comprehensive Learning & Development offer


Integrity. Client Focus. Respect. Excellence. Teamwork

Our core values dictate how we live and work. We‚Äôre an ethical and honest company that‚Äôs wholly committed to its clients. A business that‚Äôs engaged in mutual trust and respect for its employees and partners. A place where colleagues perform at the highest levels. And a working environment that‚Äôs collaborative and supportive.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Chubb, we consider our people our chief competitive advantage and as such we treat colleagues, candidates, clients, and business partners with equality, fairness and respect, regardless of their age, disability, race, religion or belief, gender, sexual orientation, marital status or family circumstances.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Equal Opportunity Statement

It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity in all of our employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category.

Applicants for positions with Chubb Spain must be legally authorized to work in Spain.

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Data Analyst (Full remote within Spain)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!¬†

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of working on multiple deliverables in parallel, and be comfortable receiving reporting requirements and translating these into solutions. In addition to, prioritizing and communicating progress and blockers effectively.¬†


Key Responsibilities:

Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies
Use Excels skills to accomplish tasks of more complex nature (vlookups, pivot tables, IF conditions..)
Ensure data accuracy
Improve operations/processes for the team by identifying trends
Implement consumer data acquisition, e-commerce analytics and trigger-based marketing
Implement consumer analytics, consumer segmentation and profiling
Respond to data analysis requests from stakeholders and staff members
Retrieving data, cleaning and preparing data for analysis, performing data analysis, and uploading the information to various sources
Help with Daily, Weekly, Monthly & Annual reporting
Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality.
Defining the data quality standards in the context of the specific initiatives.
Maintain functional expertise in database analytics best practices and the tools that support them.
Work with cross-functional teams such as engineering, product management, business intelligence to deploy data quality across critical pipelines and to set up processes to triage data issues
Create and optimise metrics and reporting functions to measure and monitor data quality for our most critical data assets
Effectively and timely communicate data quality insights and drive projects to improve data quality
Research data sources and make any corrections to existing data as needed to ensure accuracy of the information being recorded.
Real time data analyst, monitoring and identifying performance drops using analytics tools to ensure timely resolution and maintain optimal product functionality.¬†
Reviewing data control alerts, ensuring that processes operate effectively and efficiently, enabling proactive identification and resolution of data issues.



Requirements



What will make you stand out from the crowd:

BA/BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or analytical field.¬†
Excellent judgement, critical-thinking, and decision-making skills
Extremely detailed oriented
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical problem solving skill
Advanced Expertise in MS Excel and Google sheet required
Preferred knowledge/experience with Analytics Platform and SQL
Knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have., ideally with experience in international environments.
Good knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have.



Benefits



Perks of being one of us:

Top-notch private health insurance ‚Äî includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off¬†
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!¬†
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget¬†
Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
Budget for team-building activities¬†
We celebrate all company landmarks
And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean




Sounds good? Apply now!


We're looking forward to getting to know you :)



Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A Little Bit About Us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How you will make a difference:


Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards



Requirements


Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams
Proactive attitude and results-oriented



Benefits

Perks of being one of us


Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks


Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressi√≥n and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
My client in the financial services industry is looking for a Business Data Analyst on an autonomo contract (12 months) with it extending to a 2-3 years project.




The role is based 3 days a week from their Madrid office with 2 remote working days on Monday and Friday.

Strong understanding of stakeholder management.

Title: Early Collections Data Analyst
Description:
At ING we are looking for Early Collections Data Analyst







Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Early Collections Data Analyst to join our Collections Expert Unit, Team of Easy Financing Tribe.




The responsibility of this team is to make the difference by being customers‚Äô partner in times of financial difficulties, while protecting bank interest and our way of working is Agile.




Your key responsibilities:




As an Early Collections Data Analyst, you will:




Positively contribute to the team responsible for delivering a high-quality early collections service.

Co-create and lead




i) the strategy and the roadmap to achieve the best-in-class collections services,

ii) the precise and safe execution of the operational processes and automated collections workflow configuration in the Collections Tool,

iii) the external collections agencies coordination and monitoring, iv) the evolution towards a more data driven and digital service.




What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!




Expertise in managing collections services, amicable and legal collections services, for direct portfolios or third-party services, for more than 3 - 5 years.




Degree in Economics, Business, Math or Engineering (bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent in).

Proficient knowledge of Excel and SQL. Other programming languages such as SAS/MicroStrategy/Power BI would be welcome.

High Level of English.




Expertise in the banking industry, expertise or technical knowledge in collections software management or experience in digital collections will be valued.




What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but‚Ä¶ What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.

Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn‚Äôt take up your time or your cravings.




Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!




Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.




Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids‚Ä¶




Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.




Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!




More vitality and more belonging

360¬∫ care of the employee (physical, mental, financial, and social).

Health services in company (physiotherapy, phycological and medical services).

Orange sports (football, basket, running, golf, gympass ‚Ä¶).

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+) & Leonas.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1600 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clints decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead‚Äîthat‚Äôs our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working‚Ä¶we are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Data and Support Analyst
Place: San Sebasti√°n de los Reyes, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Would you like to join an international atmosphere and being involved in projects across Europe and with impact worldwide having the opportunity to consolidate your career? This is your opportunity!




We are looking for a Data and Support Analyst to join our team!




Description

Ensure IT Service Management processes quality in alignment with Mercedes-Benz standards and best practices for the different support levels.
Collaborate with the different support levels to streamline operations and enhance the reliability of retail systems.
Create and maintains reports and dashboards that visualize trends and performance metrics.
Analyse performance metrics to identify trends, anticipate potential issues, and initiate preventive measures.
Monitoring and analysing support tickets and incidents to improve service quality and efficiency.
Create and maintain Management reporting to inform about the support performance to made decision and prioritization of initiatives.
Ticket clearing: Receive and manage tickets where the responsible solving team is not clear or known.
Ensure continuous improvement by regularly reviewing and updating support and operations protocols.
Facilitate and maintain a comprehensive Contact and Escalation Matrix.
Centralize and coordinate demands related to support from the different stakeholders (support levels, products..)
Ensure knowledge management:
Ensure article quality through proper formatting, approvals, and deletion.
Knowledge base structure and access management




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Information Systems or a STEM related field.
Proven 3+ years experience working ITSM processes and principles (Certifications such as ITIL is recommended).
Proven experience with reporting tools like ServiceNow, PowerBI..
Understand how to define and measure SLO, SLA & SLI to meet goals for application availability and performance.
Analytical Skills: Ability to analyse incident and ticket data to identify trends and potential issues.
Problem-Solving abilities: Proactive approach to identifying and resolving issues.
Experience in dashboard creation and management monitoring and reporting purposes.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Attention to detail and a commitment to maintaining high standards of ticket and knowledge management quality.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment.




Languages

Proficient in English, both written and spoken.
Knowledge of the German language is a plus.




We offer you the opportunity to grow in an international and dynamic environment, taking part in new projects.




Within our benefits as employee, we provide:

Competitive salary + variable compensation
60% Mobile work
Flexible entering hours
30 working days of holidays
Annual Training Plan
Mercedes-Benz benefits (Renting plans, employee discount)

Title: Data Analyst (Python, GCP, Tableau)
Description:
Our client: they‚Äôre redefining the way brands capture attention in a fast-moving digital world. Their mission? To create outperforming online ads that shake the market and drive incredible results for our clients. They‚Äôre looking for a visionary and fully remote Performance Creative Strategist to join their dynamic team and make waves with groundbreaking ideas and strategies.







If you live and breathe creativity, have a knack for identifying winning opportunities, and thrive on delivering ads that outperform and outlast the competition‚Äîread on.







As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in driving marketing performance by managing data pipelines, transforming raw data into valuable insights, and building high-impact dashboards. You‚Äôll work closely with their UA team to ensure data is accurate, accessible, and actionable.










Requirements:

3+ years of experience in data analytics, preferably within marketing, digital advertising, or performance-driven environments.
Expertise in SQL (BigQuery) and/or Python/R for data manipulation and statistical analysis.
Hands-on experience with Improvado (UI-based data extraction).
Proficiency in Tableau or similar to create interactive dashboards and reports.
Strong knowledge of Google Cloud Platform (GCP) tools for data management and automation.
Ability to analyze large datasets, generate actionable insights, and communicate findings effectively.
Experience with Adjust, Appsflyer, GA4, Ad Networks
Fluent in English
Excellent problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.







Bonus Points:

Other languages are a plus.
Experience in marketing analytics, attribution modeling, or A/B testing.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques for predictive analytics.







They offer:

Opportunity to work on cutting-edge campaigns with ambitious clients.
A collaborative, forward-thinking team that celebrates big ideas and bold risks.
Fixed salary (25-35k gross/year) and performance-based incentives.
23 vacation days & 14 public holidays, all paid.
Flexibility: Fully remote and adaptable work schedules.
Endless opportunities for growth, learning, and creativity. We support your upskilling with courses & books of your choice.
Company events every now and then where we gather all the teams together.
Fully remote in a multicultural Environment.







Key Responsibilities:

Data Cleaning & Preparation ‚Äì Process and clean large datasets using Google BigQuery (SQL), Python, or other tools to ensure accuracy and usability.
Data Extraction ‚Äì Work with Improvado (UI-based extraction) to pull marketing performance data efficiently.
Data Transformation ‚Äì Leverage Google BigQuery (SQL) for advanced data modeling, transformations, and aggregations.
Data Visualization ‚Äì Design interactive dashboards in Tableau to communicate insights and drive decision-making.
Tooling & Infrastructure ‚Äì Utilize Google Cloud, Python, and R for advanced analytics, automation, and predictive modeling.
Data Analysis & Insights ‚Äì Conduct deep-dive analyses to uncover trends, optimize campaigns, and improve marketing performance.
Collaboration ‚Äì Work closely with performance marketers, clients and stakeholders to define KPIs and improve reporting frameworks.

Title: Senior Product Data Analyst
Description:
The Story so far: Who we are

Founded in August 2020, Huspy started as a digital mortgage platform and quickly evolved into the largest proptech company in the EMEA region. Backed by leading investors such as Sequoia, Balderton, Founders Fund, and Olayan, we have experienced rapid growth with offices in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Madrid, and Valencia. Our mission is to revolutionize the real estate industry by building an all-in-one super app designed to empower agents and mortgage brokers.




The Main Event: What you'll do

You‚Äôll join our Data team to provide insights that shape Huspy‚Äôs product strategy, directly impacting user experience and business growth. In this role, you‚Äôll use advanced analytics to support feature development, guide product direction, and ensure alignment with business objectives.




Track and Analyze Product Performance: Continuously monitor key metrics (user engagement, feature usage, product success) to identify trends and improvement areas.
Support Product Decision-Making: Design and conduct A/B tests and experiments, providing data-driven recommendations to influence product roadmaps.
Optimize Feature Rollouts: Deliver quick feedback loops on new features through user behavior analysis, enabling fast, iterative improvements.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work with product, engineering, and other business teams to translate analytics into actionable strategies and ensure alignment with business objectives.
Generate and Present Insights: Prepare reports, visualizations, and presentations to communicate insights and influence stakeholder decisions.




The Perfect Match: What you bring

Experience: Minimum of 5-8 years of experience in product analytics or a similar role.
Analytical Expertise: Advanced SQL and Python skills for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis, with experience in libraries like Pandas, NumPy, and Matplotlib. Experience with product analytics tools (e.g., Amplitude, Mixpanel, or Google Analytics).
Product Analytics Experience: Knowledge of Amplitude (preferred) or similar tools, with experience in A/B testing, feature flagging, and experimentation platforms.
Statistical and Analytical Skills: Solid understanding of statistical concepts (e.g., hypothesis testing, regression analysis) to validate experiments.
Data Visualization: Strong skills in creating dashboards and visualizations with tools like Tableau (preferred).
Data Architecture: Familiarity with Snowflake (preferred) or similar platforms for data warehousing and an understanding of data transformation processes.
Data Management: Knowledge of Airflow and dbt (preferred) or similar platforms for building data workflows and pipelines.
Communication Skills: Ability to convey complex analytical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborative Spirit: Comfortable working in cross-functional teams, particularly with product and engineering.
Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science). A Master‚Äôs degree is a plus.




What will set you apart:

Experience with Our Tool Stack: Hands-on experience with Amplitude, Snowflake, Tableau, Airflow, and dbt is a strong plus.
Advanced Statistical Knowledge: Familiarity with statistical modeling and machine learning basics for deeper analysis.
Experience in Data-Driven Organizations: Background in fast-paced environments where data directly informs product decisions.
Familiarity with Predictive Modeling: Exposure to libraries like Scikit-Learn for advanced analysis.

Estamos construyendo la pr√≥xima generaci√≥n de tecnolog√≠a en varios sectores, de la mano de los mejores players de cada mercado. Entre ellos se encuentran instituciones financieras de primer nivel, gigantes inmobiliarios o empresas multinacionales.

Por ello, estamos buscando un Data Analyst con ganas de colaborar en el an√°lisis de datos y en la generaci√≥n de insights que impulsen nuestras soluciones de IA, que pueda crecer personal y profesionalmente a la par que lo hace la compa√±√≠a.

Te enfrentar√°s a desaf√≠os interesantes y tendr√°s un profundo impacto en la toma de decisiones basadas en datos. Trabajar√°s en un entorno √°gil, con profesionales incre√≠bles que creen en nuestra misi√≥n. Buscamos un apasionado de los datos que disfrute analizando y descubriendo patrones significativos.

Tasks

üöÄ El trabajo:

  • Analizar√°s y transformar√°s datos complejos en informaci√≥n √∫til y accionable para la toma de decisiones estrat√©gicas.
  • Desarrollar√°s y mantendr√°s dashboards e informes que faciliten la visualizaci√≥n y comprensi√≥n de los datos.
  • Colaborar√°s estrechamente con equipos multifuncionales para identificar necesidades de an√°lisis de datos y proponer soluciones basadas en datos.
  • Participar√°s en proyectos de diversos sectores, proporcionando insights que impulsen el impacto econ√≥mico en nuestros clientes.


Requirements

üß† Requisitos:

  • +1 a√±o de experiencia como Data Analyst o en un rol similar.
  • Conocimiento avanzado en an√°lisis de datos y herramientas de visualizaci√≥n, especialmente Streamlit y PowerBI.
  • Fuerte habilidad en el uso de SQL para consulta y an√°lisis de datos, con experiencia en PostgreSQL.
  • Experiencia en el manejo de grandes conjuntos de datos y en el uso de herramientas estad√≠sticas con Python
  • Familiaridad con metodolog√≠as de an√°lisis predictivo y modelado de datos.
  • Conocimiento de herramientas de limpieza y transformaci√≥n de datos.
  • Habilidades de comunicaci√≥n para presentar hallazgos de manera clara y efectiva a diferentes audiencias.
  • Ingl√©s.
  • Disponibilidad para asistir a la oficina en Madrid.


Valoraremos:

  • Experiencia en cloud (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud Platform).
  • Conocimiento de Kubernetes y contenedores.
  • Haber trabajado en entornos de startups de ritmo r√°pido.
  • Otros idiomas.


Benefits

üìä Beneficios:

  • Sueldo competitivo
  • Stock options
  • Flexibilidad horaria: nos importa que puedas conciliar tu vida laboral con la personal
  • El modelo de trabajo es semipresencial, se combina teletrabajo y presencialidad
  • Seguro de salud cubierto en su totalidad por Menhir
  • Entorno joven


En Menhir somos un equipo de apasionados de los datos con una voluntad firme de mejorar lo establecido por medio de la IA. ¬øTe apuntas a formar parte del ecosistema Menhir?

Title: Junior Business Intelligence
Description:
Clikalia es la proptech espa√±ola que ha modernizado el mercado residencial aportando transparencia y convirtiendo procesos complejos y lentos en transacciones r√°pidas y sencillas gracias a la tecnolog√≠a. ¬°Hemos cambiado la forma de hacer las cosas!

Compramos viviendas en solo 7 d√≠as, inyectando liquidez en el mercado, y las devolvemos a √©l mediante venta o alquiler en tiempo r√©cord, renovadas y con su eficiencia energ√©tica mejorada. Para que se entienda mejor: ¬°Nuestras viviendas son lo m√°s cercano a obra nueva sin necesidad de usar nuevo suelo!

Nuestra misi√≥n es modernizar los lugares en los que vivimos, mejorando su eficiencia energ√©tica y aumentando la oferta de vivienda mediante la renovaci√≥n de inmuebles. De hecho, somos el principal regenerador de vivienda de segunda mano de Europa.

Clikalia fue fundada en 2018 y se ha expandido ya desde Espa√±a a M√©xico, Portugal y Francia. En 2021, logramos la mayor ronda de financiaci√≥n de una startup en la historia de Espa√±a: ¬°m√°s de 460 millones de euros! Entre nuestros inversores est√°n SoftBank, Fifth Wall, Luxor Capital y Mouro Capital, todos con gran conocimiento del sector y foco en la innovaci√≥n tecnol√≥gica.

Somos una de las scaleups m√°s importantes de Espa√±a, es decir, una de las principales empresas de r√°pido crecimiento con base tecnol√≥gica.

Si quieres unirte como Business Intelligence a una empresa innovadora, din√°mica y de alt√≠simo crecimiento, sigue leyendo...

¬øQu√© har√°s?


An√°lisis de datos para decisiones estrat√©gicas: Procesar y organizar grandes vol√∫menes de datos, empleando herramientas de an√°lisis para identificar tendencias y generar insights pr√°cticos que optimicen procesos internos y apoyen la toma de decisiones.
An√°lisis de tendencias del mercado inmobiliario: Realizar an√°lisis de datos estad√≠sticos para identificar tendencias clave del sector y descubrir nuevas oportunidades de crecimiento.
Dise√±o de dashboards y visualizaciones: Crear herramientas visuales y paneles interactivos que ayuden a monitorear indicadores clave del negocio (KPIs).
Participaci√≥n en proyectos de consultor√≠a externa: Colaborar en la elaboraci√≥n de an√°lisis de due diligence, desarrollo de planes de negocio y creaci√≥n de modelos de valoraci√≥n financiera.



¬øQui√©n eres?


Grado en Business Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science o similar (Preferiblemente formaci√≥n hibrida de business+data)
Dominio avanzado de Excel, conocimiento en programaci√≥n con Python u otros y experiencia en herramientas de visualizaci√≥n de datos como Power BI, Looker o Tableau.
Experiencia previa de 1 o 2 a√±os en roles relacionados con an√°lisis de datos, business intelligence o consultor√≠a.
Inter√©s por el sector inmobiliario, con ganas de aprender y crecer en un entorno din√°mico.
Habilidades anal√≠ticas y resoluci√≥n de problemas, con mucha atenci√≥n al detalle y un enfoque en la precisi√≥n y calidad del trabajo.
Autonom√≠a, pensamiento creativo, proactivo y habilidades de comunicaci√≥n s√≥lidas. Idiomas: ingl√©s y espa√±ol.
Excel/PowerPoint y alguna herramienta de visualizaci√≥n de datos como Power BI, Looker o Tableau.



¬øQu√© ofrecemos?


Desarrollo profesional en una de las proptech de mayor crecimiento en Europa y LATAM.
Formar parte de un equipo ambicioso orientado a la excelencia en los resultados.
Salario competitivo y acorde a tus competencias.
Ambiente meritocr√°tico.
Posibilidad de cobrar tu salario cuando quieras o marcarte planes de ahorro.
Alianza con Clicars: podr√°s beneficiarte de descuentos para la compra de coches.
Adem√°s, por ser empleado de Clikalia tambi√©n contamos con descuentos en la compra de viviendas y en el asesoramiento y gesti√≥n hipotecaria.



¬øTodav√≠a te lo est√°s pensando?

En Clikalia nos sentimos muy orgullosos de lo que estamos haciendo, tenemos un prop√≥sito y aqu√≠ todo el mundo cabe. Queremos integrar el mejor equipo para cambiar la forma en que se vende o se compra tu casa. Nos esforzamos cada d√≠a en ofrecer el mejor entorno de trabajo, que inspire e impulse el desarrollo profesional.

En cumplimiento de la normativa de protecci√≥n de datos Clipiso Desarrollo S.L.U. como responsable del tratamiento te informa que los datos ser√°n tratados con la finalidad de gestionar la oferta de empleo dentro del Grupo Clikalia. La base del tratamiento es el establecimiento de la relaci√≥n contractual. Los datos no ser√°n conservados una vez finalizada la selecci√≥n. En caso de contrataci√≥n, los datos formar√°n parte del expediente profesional. Los datos podr√°n ser cedidos a sociedades del Grupo para la gesti√≥n. No est√°n previstas transferencias internacionales. Puede ejercitar sus derechos de acceso, rectificaci√≥n, supresi√≥n, portabilidad y la limitaci√≥n u oposici√≥n dirigi√©ndose por escrito a dpo@clikalia.com

Title: Data Analyst - Brands Ads (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Glovo is looking for a talented and ambitious Brand Ads Data Analyst to help us grow our Brands. Are you up for a challenging experience in one of the fastest growing startups in Europe?

THE JOURNEY


Lead the optimization of data processes for the Brand Ads commercial team
Manage projects focused on building data reports, developing metrics and KPIs for brands campaign performance tracking and reporting.
Design, document, and implement processes and tools for efficiency and effectiveness. Continuously refining them to align with team‚Äôs goals and our brand's needs.
Help the commercial team build a smart strategy based on data by gathering insights and learnings with an actionable output.
Work closely with Strategy & Data team to strengthen analytical abilities and adapt them to Brand Ads team.
Use Looker to create dashboards, query and extract large volumes of data and develop optimal data infrastructure to identify business opportunities, spot trends and develop effective strategies for the Brand Ads Team.
Actively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Full time availability. 3 days a week at the office, 2 optional remote.
At least 2 years of previous working experience in data analytics, extracting complex data and transforming it into actionable insights.
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Economics, or a related technological or business field preferably.
Strong passion for analytics and reporting, demonstrated by your enthusiasm for problem-solving, driving data driven insights.
Advanced skills in Google Sheet/ Excel is a must and any other analytical tools will be appreciated.
SQL skills is a must to drive data-informed decision-making.
An ability for identifying opportunities for process improvement in various aspects.
Experience managing data for FMCG brands is a plus.
Great problem solver skills and capability to adapt fast to unexpected situations.
Comfortable working in a high-growth and high-performance start-up with a fast pace. Strong drive for continuous improvement. Creative and a self-starter. Proactivity is in your DNA.
An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We believe driven talent deserves:.


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Marketing Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote/Madrid

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 5,000,000 active users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

Over 30,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, H&M, Adidas, IKEA, SHEIN, noon, and Bloomingdale‚Äôs use Tabby‚Äôs technology to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering flexible payments online and in stores. Tabby is active in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt and Kuwait and backed by leading investors, including Sequoia Capital India, STV, PayPal Ventures, Mubadala Investment Capital, Arbor Ventures and others.

We are looking for a Marketing Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. Marketing Analyst will work with our marketing team and help us evaluate marketing efficiency and find the best way to acquire new and reactivate existing users, playing a pivotal role in launching and optimizing marketing strategies that drive meaningful impact. You'll collaborate closely with Analysts, Marketing, and Product teams.

You‚Äôll be working in a dynamic, rapidly evolving environment with the following responsibilities:


Provide analytical support to the Marketing and Product Marketing teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of customer. acquisition cost, customer spending forecast, and finding an optimal mix of marketing channels.
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly to highlight the importance of your insights.
Support and monitor existing performance marketing metrics, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise:


3+ years of experience as a data/marketing analyst.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
Proficiency in digital marketing platforms from Meta and Google.
Strong understanding of mobile attribution and MMPs (AppsFlyer, Adjust, etc.), including event tracking, postbacks, and troubleshooting.
Experience working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data ‚Äî extracting, decoding, and analyzing postbacks to optimize iOS campaigns.
Knowledge of privacy-first attribution frameworks like Apple‚Äôs ATT, Meta's AEM, and Google‚Äôs Privacy Sandbox.
Experience with marketing attribution platforms is a plus.
Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
Fluency in English.



Job Benefits:


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in company‚Äôs employee stock options program.
Health Insurance.



Relocation

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia/Georgia/Serbia/Portugal/Spain.

We will help you open a legal entity and a bank account. In Armenia and Georgia the taxes are compensated by Tabby. In other countries we provide partial compensation of taxes.

We employ according to B2B contracts (service agreements).

For our employees we cover the following:


Flight to one of the mentioned countries.
Accommodation during the paperwork completion period.
Opening a bank account and getting a residence permit in one of the mentioned countries.
Family relocation (dependants).



New employees can also choose an alternative method of relocation to another country of their choice. In this case, Tabby will reimburse up to $5,000 of verified costs upon opening a legal entity and a bank account.

We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!
