ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

As an Operations Analyst you will work on the Regional forecasting function (supply & demand balance). This role will require a mix of operations, stakeholder management, analytical skills, and creativity to tackle different challenges. We offer a challenging and dynamic environment with many opportunities for learning and development.

THE JOURNEY

  • Execute forecasts at a city level inAFRICA (Morocco, Tunisia, Kenya, Uganda, Ivory Coast, Nigeria) , being the owner of the process.
  • Coordinate with the different countries and cities in order to understand key insights about local markets.
  • Align with each Local Operations owner the strategy in the country, and enable it by managing the demand and supply balance (rider availability)
  • Perform country and city analysis to come up with insights to help to improve the forecast's accuracy.
  • You will combine advanced analytical data insights with business understanding and market knowledge.
  • Work very close with local teams, to ensure the best in class operations in the region.
  • Implement and standardize analytical processes, and playbooks to ensure quality in Operations.

What You Will Bring To The Ride

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Engineering, Mathematics/Statistics or in similar roles
  • 2+ years experience in a supply/demand planning position. Experience in Operations is a plus
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Data-driven decision-making is a must.
  • Ability to engage internal and external stakeholders through excellent communication skills
  • Proficiency in Excel
  • Knowledge of SQL
  • Ability to manage the big picture, and the smallest details. You're always on top of your deadlines and an organization freak.
  • Proactive, organized, and obsessed with details
  • Fluent English Level

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

  • üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
  • üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
  • üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
  • üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
  • üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
  • üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst with English
Description:
Are you passionate about helping others and creating memorable experiences? Do you thrive in dynamic, growing environments?

If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

Our client, a rapidly expanding international company, is establishing a new HUB in the vibrant city of Barcelona.

They are on the lookout for a dedicated and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join their team.

In this role, you are going to make complex data understandable and tackle challenging analysis questions. Also, you are going to create clear reports and share valuable insights with your marketing colleagues.

If Data is your playground, and analyzing it comes naturally to you, this position is for you!

Tasks


Turning marketing data into clear insights and creating valuable reports.
Making complex data understandable and tackling challenging analysis questions.
Creating clear reports and sharing valuable insights with your marketing colleagues, covering both on-site and off-site analyses.
With the Tech team, ensuring the marketing performance is clear and actionable.
Identifying growth opportunities and performing structured data analyses.
Developing and implementing powerful data tracking using different tools.



Requirements


Bachelor's or master's level of working and thinking, with a passion for data-driven marketing
Experience with Google Analytics (360) / GA4 and Google Tag Manager.
Mastered BigQuery / SQL and BI tools like Google Looker Studio and Qlik Sense.
Strong knowledge of Excel
Strong knowledge of Google Ads and Microsoft Ads
Basic understanding of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, with Python/R being a plus.
Up-to-date e-commerce marketing knowledge and can translate A/B test results into valuable insights for stakeholders
Full professional level of English



Benefits


Competitive Salary
25 vacation days (30 consecutive days)
Hybrid working modality
The flexibility to work from the most inspiring location for you ‚Äì always have a workspace available for you at the European offices of the client
After six months the possibility of additional private health insurance and you‚Äôll receive travel compensation when you need to travel to one of the client locations
Staff discounts
Unlimited learning and growth opportunities
Step 1: Interview with our Recruiter to get to know you better
Step 2: Interview with the Hiring Manager and HR member of the company
Step 3: Interview with the Marketing Leader of the company
Step 4: Business Case
Show more

Title: Healthcare Research & Data Analyst (MedTech)
Description:
We are looking for a Healthcare Researcher & Data Analyst to join our Medtech group in Barcelona.

In this role, you will build MedTech therapy expertise and translate market research data into high-quality syndicated and custom insights to our global MedTech customers. You will also actively develop and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

If you have passion for the dynamic MedTech landscape and are excited about the opportunity to work in our vibrant Life Sciences & Healthcare (LS&H) group, we would like to hear from you.

About You ‚Äì Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in relevant subject area (science or business)
2-5 years of industry experience relating to quantitative data analysis
Strong grasp of microeconomics and how businesses work
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions
Experience in building market forecast models and converting unstructured datasets into broadly usable data models


It would be great if you also had . . .


Relevant experience in the medical device, healthcare, market research or consulting sectors
Experience using SQL
You know how to deliver an effective presentation
Passionate about data and insights‚Äîyou have the intrinsic drive to push boundaries on how we leverage data.
You appreciate the freedom to make an impact that you can own.
You are solution-oriented‚Äîyou value ideas but understand the importance of execution.
Thrive in a rapidly changing business.
Respect deadlines and able to handle multiple projects at once.


What will you be doing in this role?


Author comprehensive market research reports that provide quantitative and qualitative insights on specific medical device markets around the world.
Build market models by leveraging Clarivate‚Äôs proprietary healthcare datasets, while incorporating public financial, regulatory, and government data.
Interview industry stakeholders and medical professionals to contextualize data and form insights.
Understand the worldview and pain points of Clarivate clients, working closely with them as a problem-solver. From Fortune 500 companies to smaller startups, you will converse with high-profile clients regularly and be expected to both present and defend conclusions to them.
Engage in cross-functional collaboration on initiatives and projects impacting multiple teams.
Contribute your vision; influence the evolution of our products, data models, and data usage strategy.


About The Team

Clarivate's Medtech Insights team harnesses real-world healthcare data, in-depth interviews, and our unique mix of in-house expertise to help medical device companies make some of their most important business decisions.

The Medtech Insights team, with members located in Canada, India, and Spain, is an essential part of the broader Medtech team's data-driven culture, and regularly contributes its subject matter expertise to other teams within the organization.

Hours of Work

This is a permanent full-time position at 40 hours a week (35 hours during July and August). The position is hybrid going to our office in Barcelona (next to Sagrada Familia) 2-3 times per week.

Benefits


Active volunteering community, with 40 annual paid hours of volunteering time.
Private Health and Life & Disability insurances.
Tax-free benefits (Ticket Restaurant scheme, kindergarten and transport cards).
Language classes (Catalan, Spanish and English).
Global and dynamic employee base (more than 20 nationalities).
30 working days of vacation.


At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

Title: Data Analyst Lead
Description:
Your mission

As a Data Analyst at Livo, you will work closely with product and business teams, your responsibilities will be:


Work closely with product, design, and engineering to identify opportunities for product improvement.
Analyze data sets to identify patterns, trends, and insights to inform product decisions.
Define metrics to measure the performance of new features.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance metrics (KPIs).
Work closely with product, design, and engineering to identify opportunities for product improvement.
Generate insights on customer behavior, product usage, and feature performance.
Monitor and report on user engagement, product rollouts, and business outcomes.
Build Livo data foundations,ranging from data modeling to tooling to consume data across the organisation.
Analyse data sets to identify patterns, trends, and insights to inform product decisions.
Implement the dashboards tracking key KPIs in order to support leadership.
Support & co-lead the setup of product tracking with product team.
Contribute to building a data-driven culture within Livo.


Your profile

What We're Looking For


At least 4+ years of experience in product analytics, data analysis, or a similar role.
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and a commitment to delivering high-quality insights.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL and Python.
Knowledge of modern data tools such as Airbyte, Fivetran, or equivanet.
Experience with data visualization tools like Metabase, Looker, or similar platforms.
Experience with A/B testing, experimentation, and statistical analysis.
Ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights for product teams.
Familiarity with cloud-based data storage and management services.


Why us?

At Livo Health, we offer a unique opportunity to make a tangible impact in the healthcare space. You will play a pivotal role in scaling our operations, all while working alongside passionate individuals who are driven to make a difference.


High Growth: Work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with countless opportunities for personal and professional development.
Competitive salary package: reflecting your experience and expertise, ensuring you are rewarded for your hard work and dedication
Meaningful equity package: We truly want team members to own a relevant part of the business as a key driver to fully buy into the equity story and the change we‚Äôre trying to promote in the world, with the corresponding economic upside that goes with it
Innovation: Be at the forefront of transforming healthcare staffing through technology and innovative operational processes.
Impact: Help solve one of healthcare‚Äôs most critical issues ‚Äî healthcare professional talent crisis/shortage ‚Äî and make a real-world impact on healthcare providers and patients alike.
Cool & vibrant Offices: Very well located offices at the heart of Barcelona in Paseo de Gracia with plenty of natural light, great views, spacious and cool vibes
Culture: Strong culture with an emphasis on ownership, impact, and ambition, coupled with the determination to build something meaningful whilst enjoying the journey
Benefits: We will soon rollout a benefits program in line with market standards


Interview Process

Our hiring process is designed to assess both your skills and cultural fit with our mission-driven team:


Call with HR: initial conversation to assess motivation, culture fit and salary expectations
45-minute interview with our CTO, Adnane
60-minute technical SQL & Programming call with Backend Engineer
30-minute Case Study with our CTO and Product Manager
45-minute culture fit call with CTO an CEO


About Us

Livo was born with the mission to improve healthcare globally through cutting edge technology and that has always been our North Star since we deeply believe health is the most important asset we all have as individuals. We launched last year in Spain our nursing shift marketplace whose aim is to support health care institutions with their nurse staffing needs, by matching institutions with healthcare professionals that are interested in extra work, adding transparency, flexibility and convenience to both stakeholders and its traction has been outstanding. Our vision is to radically transform the way healthcare institutions hire, retain and manage talent nowadays whilst empowering healthcare staff with more tools, flexibility, money, and recognition.

Title: Data Analyst Intern - Regional Operations (They/He/She)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.


We have an ‚Äò‚Äôoffice-first‚Äô‚Äô culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do!
We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don‚Äôt shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift!
We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!).
We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work.


üí™Our career development philosophy.


We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential.
We take ownership of our career development. We don‚Äôt believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams!
We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope.


ü§ùOur commitment to being a force for good.


Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact.
We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives.
We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.


We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Glovo is looking for a Data Operations Intern to join our regional team in Barcelona, supporting operations across the Africa Region, specifically in Morocco, Tunisia, Ivory Coast, Uganda, Nigeria, and Kenya. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven, and hands-on? Do you want to evolve into one of the fastest-growing startups in Europe, building a product that will change people's day-to-day lives and disrupt the on-demand market?

THE JOURNEY


Analyze data generated by our core operations across multiple African markets to improve the experience of our key stakeholders (Couriers, Users, and Partners).
Provide data-driven insights to enhance key performance indicators (KPIs) across supported countries, such as delivery times, cancellations, efficiency, and cross-departmental projects.
Proactively identify inefficiencies, analyze root causes, and propose actionable, data-driven solutions tailored to regional needs.
Standardize and optimize processes to drive operational efficiency in our African markets.
Track KPIs, manage scheduling, attendance, and general administration of Info-Sessions, while supporting daily operations through operational supervision and data analysis.
Collaborate closely with local Operations Managers in each supported country to streamline customer support processes and enhance overall operations.
Work cross-functionally with other departments to monitor and implement structural process optimizations within the Africa Region.
Bring your most innovative ideas to life and make an immediate impact by thinking outside the box!


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mathematics, or any technological field.
Passion for analytics: you enjoy deep-diving into problems to uncover root causes and drive improvements.
Strong problem-solving skills: no challenge is too big or small.
Proficiency in Excel.
Experience in SQL is a must.
Professional-level English (French is a plus given the regional scope).
An empathetic, inclusive, and curious attitude.

Individuals from diverse backgrounds, genders, and ethnicities may hesitate to apply if they don't meet 100% of the listed criteria. Don‚Äôt let that stop you! We are all about finding the best talent‚Äîskills can be learned, and diversity is a key strength.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst, EMEA Performance Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a Data Analyst in our Analytics Performance Media team, you will drive advertising strategies thanks to your oversight of business objectives and technical expertise of our products.


Client insights: you will analyse complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers‚Äô campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights
Business strategy: you will partner with account executives, account strategists, and campaign managers to help drive client strategy and direction
Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership.
Testing: you will design, monitor and analyse A/B tests to understand better how our products work for clients.
Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company



Your work environment:


Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!



Who You Are:


At least 2 years of experience in data analysis
A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Able to solve data problems using Python, SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
You are skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Experience in online advertising, marketing, or consulting will be a plus.
Fluent in English
Must be eligible to work in Spain full-time with no restrictions.



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analyst, Partner Operations (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

You will be directly responsible for improving the Partners‚Äô experience across their whole journey, making them grow and improve user UX, from the data perspective. The successful candidate must be a self-starter, results-oriented, analytical, and passionate about innovation and entrepreneurship. The role would mean not only providing data and insights to guide the team to make the right decisions but also owning full projects related to the Partners. Ownership and responsibilities will be given to you from day one.

THE JOURNEY


Create and manage core data products that are used to execute impact analysis to evaluate our project performance.
Improve current data sources & reporting to make faster decisions.
Ensure data pipelines and development processes are operationalprocesses operational and efficient.
Work on strategic analysis that will help to detect further opportunities
Understand, deep-dive and have a complete awareness of Glovo‚Äôs partner operations situation at all times. Develop analytical frameworks, analyses, dashboards and models for the whole organization.
Raise product requests to improve partners' UX and scalability. Identify tech feature improvements and give proactive feedback to the Product team.
Execute end-to-end projects at a global level


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1/2 years of experience providing business teams with data for decision-making
Analytical skills: breaking big problems into smaller ones and problem-solving skills, with adaptability to change, is a must
Experience developing in Python and writing complex SQL queries is a must
Experience with reporting tools such as Looker, Tableau, and Google Data Studio is a must
Experience with data engineering-related tools (Airflow, Github, etc) is a plus.
Good communication skills in English (plus Spanish as a bonus)
Great team player and organizational skills
Experience in managing projects is a plus
International studies or experience is a plus


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst, Tracking & Analytics
Description:
Are you eager to develop and implement tracking and analytics solutions that help large international companies make informed decisions?

Do you want to join our ambitious journey within data tracking & analytics?

Are you ready to make a real impact on how global brands use data?

At s360, we're not just collecting data ‚Äì we're turning it into actionable insights that drive business growth.

Join our new team in Barcelona and help shape the future of ad-tech in a dynamic, startup-like environment while being part of a leading North European agency.

Your key responsibilities You will play a crucial role in delivering and advising on tracking and analytics solutions for our clients.

Overall your responsibilities will encompass the development and implementation of durable measurement and tracking setups.

More Specifically, Your Responsibilities Will Include

Responsible for own portfolio of clients within tracking & analyticsDriving strategic roadmaps towards a durable measurement setupPlanning, project management and execution as primary or part of projects for clients on an ad hoc basisAdvising and configuring e.g.

Google Analytics 4, Consent Mode, Enhanced Conversions, Conversion API, and Consent Management Platform (Cookiebot and Cookie Information)Testing, auditing, and ensuring the quality of tracking setupsDeveloping documentation and implementing both smaller and larger tracking setupsImplementing and adjusting conversion tracking/pixel across various channels and platformsDebugging and resolving ad hoc tracking issues About your future team You will join our Measurement team who each day collaborate to make sure our clients succeed.

We strive to work closely on projects, complex cases, and troubleshooting while having fun and prioritizing the social aspects of working together.

Staying ahead with the latest technologies and products is part of our DNA, ensuring our clients gain a competitive advantage through future-proof tracking setups.

Moreover, as part of our new Barcelona team, you'll contribute to building a collaborative environment.

You will help shape the growth of our office and contribute to building a culture that thrives on innovation, teamwork, and the shared goal of delivering exceptional results for our clients.

Your profile You have 4-6 years of hands-on experience from e.g.

a digital agency or an in-house role in a digital company.

You possess high professionalism as well as personal integrity and thrive in a fast-paced environment, where we constantly strive to improve and create more value for our clients.

Furthermore, You

High-level user of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager for ecommerceHave a working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScriptHave experience in driving larger tracking & analytics projects for complex setups and client organizationsComfortable explaining complex and technical concepts both verbally and in writingAble to communicate in English with colleagues and external stakeholders from various locationsAre a problem-solver, unafraid of tackling challenging tasksAre detail-oriented and structured, taking pride in delivering thorough solutionsHave a direct and open communication style, and you are comfortable with giving and receiving constructive feedbackAppreciate collaborative sparring and knowledge-sharing within the team, coupled with the ability to work independently and manage tasks in a structured mannerNote: You must be eligible to work in Spain and the EU without requiring sponsorship.

What we offer You will be a part of a strong team with some of the industry's top specialists who all strive to ensure that our next delivery is always better than before.

You will join an international team working with clients across the s360 group.

Moreover, you will be a part of a company characterized by:

A culture that is down-to-earth and full of constructive feedback and sparring that drives your personal and professional developmentFreedom under responsibility and flexible working hoursAmbitious and professional colleagues - who also like to have fun!Continuous learning and development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.Social events like our MeetUp for all s360-employeesOur office in the popular Norrsken House Barcelona offers the city's best location with views of the beach and W-hotel, as well as many social and networking activities.

We'd love to hear from you! Is this the right fit for you?

Then don't hesitate to apply or reach out to Andrej Plancic, Managing Director, at ******.

We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible.

All inquiries are treated confidentially.

About s360 s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise.

With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain.

In recent years, s360 has been recognized with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
CUSTOMER SERVICE MASTER DATA ANALYST Location: Barcelona, Spain

The Customer Service Master Data Analyst is responsible for ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of master data processes within the market. This role plays a key part in maintaining high-quality master data execution and overseeing data execution from the Shared Service Center. The role is critical for driving efficiency in master data management and ensuring seamless customer service operations.

Your main focus:


Ensure Master Data Readiness & Quality: Deliver accurate and timely data setup KPIs for product activation, PIPO management, customer setup, logistics, and pricing conditions. Guarantee data readiness for new product launches and promotional activities. Train Sales and Marketing teams to follow global standards and ensure accurate input using standard templates.
Governance and Execution of Master Data Processes: Own and enforce master data execution processes, ensuring compliance with business standards. Develop protocols and workflows to maintain master data quality and implement continuous improvement practices.
Oversee Shared Service Center Operations: Monitor and validate the quality of master data execution by the Shared Service Center, ensuring SLA adherence.
Conduct quality control checks and provide feedback to improve processes and performance.
Data Insights and Analytics: Consolidate master data insights and share them with the Master Data Leader to support informed decision-making.


Working for Coty means constant opportunities and change. You will be managing a lot of things at the same time, but this is also what makes it exciting!

Key success measures for the Customer Services Master Data Analyst include the following:


Timeliness and Accuracy: Ensure master data updates are completed within SLA timeframes and accurately on the first attempt.
Process and Compliance: Adhere to SLAs, protocols, governance standards, and achieve high audit compliance rates.
Quality and Efficiency: Maintain high QC pass rates, resolve data issues quickly, and ensure data completeness in all entries.
Stakeholder Satisfaction and Reporting: Deliver timely analytics and reports while achieving strong feedback from internal stakeholders.


The Customer Services Master Data Analyst will liaise with various cross-functional and remote teams, such as:


Customer Service Operations
Shared Service Center
Master Data Global Teams
IT CoE


YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You have excellent problem solving skills and have the ability to think quickly & work under tight deadlines. As a CS Master Data Analyst, you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and challenging environment. You have strong attention to detail and organisation skills, and can communicate effectively and collaborate with various stakeholders.

Other than that, we are looking for candidates who:


Have a Bachelor‚Äôs degree, higher vocational training or vocational training in Data Management, or a related field.
2 to 4 years of experience in master data management, customer service, or related fields.
Proficiency in SAP and data governance tools.
Basic fluency/proficiency in English and proficient or native in any of the following languages: Spanish, French, Italian, Dutch, German
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools will be a plus (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with customer and product master data processes in SAP (customer set up, activation, PIPO, pricing conditions).


Our Benefits

As our Customer Service Master Data Analyst, some of the benefits you will receive are:


Competitive remuneration and perks will be matched with your experience and knowledge.
Ticket restaurant (daily diet for meals)
Company products / Access to the company shop
Life and accident insurance


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


A screening call with the recruiters
A first online/in-person interview with hiring managers
A second interview (optionally)
Feedback, verbal offer
Hiring


About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!

HTML:
CUSTOMER SERVICE MASTER DATA ANALYST Location: Barcelona, Spain

The Customer Service Master Data Analyst is responsible for ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of master data processes within the market. This role plays a key part in maintaining high-quality master data execution and overseeing data execution from the Shared Service Center. The role is critical for driving efficiency in master data management and ensuring seamless customer service operations.

Your main focus:

  • Ensure Master Data Readiness & Quality: Deliver accurate and timely data setup KPIs for product activation, PIPO management, customer setup, logistics, and pricing conditions. Guarantee data readiness for new product launches and promotional activities. Train Sales and Marketing teams to follow global standards and ensure accurate input using standard templates.
  • Governance and Execution of Master Data Processes: Own and enforce master data execution processes, ensuring compliance with business standards. Develop protocols and workflows to maintain master data quality and implement continuous improvement practices.
  • Oversee Shared Service Center Operations: Monitor and validate the quality of master data execution by the Shared Service Center, ensuring SLA adherence.
  • Conduct quality control checks and provide feedback to improve processes and performance.
  • Data Insights and Analytics: Consolidate master data insights and share them with the Master Data Leader to support informed decision-making.

Working for Coty means constant opportunities and change. You will be managing a lot of things at the same time, but this is also what makes it exciting!

Key success measures for the Customer Services Master Data Analyst include the following:

  • Timeliness and Accuracy: Ensure master data updates are completed within SLA timeframes and accurately on the first attempt.
  • Process and Compliance: Adhere to SLAs, protocols, governance standards, and achieve high audit compliance rates.
  • Quality and Efficiency: Maintain high QC pass rates, resolve data issues quickly, and ensure data completeness in all entries.
  • Stakeholder Satisfaction and Reporting: Deliver timely analytics and reports while achieving strong feedback from internal stakeholders.

The Customer Services Master Data Analyst will liaise with various cross-functional and remote teams, such as:

  • Customer Service Operations
  • Shared Service Center
  • Master Data Global Teams
  • IT CoE

YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You have excellent problem solving skills and have the ability to think quickly & work under tight deadlines. As a CS Master Data Analyst, you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and challenging environment. You have strong attention to detail and organisation skills, and can communicate effectively and collaborate with various stakeholders.

Other than that, we are looking for candidates who:

  • Have a Bachelor‚Äôs degree, higher vocational training or vocational training in Data Management, or a related field.
  • 2 to 4 years of experience in master data management, customer service, or related fields.
  • Proficiency in SAP and data governance tools.
  • Basic fluency/proficiency in English and proficient or native in any of the following languages: Spanish, French, Italian, Dutch, German
  • Strong proficiency in data analysis tools will be a plus (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau).
  • Familiarity with customer and product master data processes in SAP (customer set up, activation, PIPO, pricing conditions).

Our Benefits

As our Customer Service Master Data Analyst, some of the benefits you will receive are:

  • Competitive remuneration and perks will be matched with your experience and knowledge.
  • Ticket restaurant (daily diet for meals)
  • Company products / Access to the company shop
  • Life and accident insurance

RECRUITMENT PROCESS

  • A screening call with the recruiters
  • A first online/in-person interview with hiring managers
  • A second interview (optionally)
  • Feedback, verbal offer
  • Hiring

About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Marketing Data Analyst to join the Emburse Marketing team. This person will help the team to enhance their campaigns by using data to create actionable i nsights.

Using Salesforce CRM to track both online and offline campaigns, this role will create self-service tools and provide enablement to ensure the whole team knows and understands the data. A deep understanding of the digital marketing landscape and the full marketing funnel is essential to excel in this position.

An ideal candidate will possess exceptional stakeholder management skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex data in a clear and easy-to-understand manner and is fluent not only in Salesforce CRM, but also ideally has skills with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Lookr.

What You Will Do


Conduct data analysis and provide insights to enable Marketers to optimize their campaigns.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business requirements and translate them into data analysis solutions (from ad-hoc reports and self-service dashboards).
Use Tableau or Looker studio to design and build easy-to-use dashboards, often connecting multiple data sources.
Present complex data to a broad audience, with varying levels of data literacy, in a manner that is clear and actionable.
Develop and automate reports, dashboards, and visualizations to effectively communicate findings and trends.
Provide education and training to Marketers so they can self-service and understand our various marketing metrics.
Partner with the web experience team to design and measure digital experiments (AB tests) based on user behaviors and UX research.
Collaborate with stakeholders to create targets and provide forecasts for key performance indicators (KPIs).
Conduct ad-hoc analysis and provide actionable insights to support business initiatives and solve complex problems.
Develop and implement data models, algorithms, and statistical techniques to analyze complex datasets.


What We Are Looking For


Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and with Executives.
Proficiency with the Salesforce CRM suite for data analysis and visualizations such as Sales Cloud, Marketing Cloud and Data Cloud
Hand-on experience with data manipulation in Excel/Google Sheets and visualization tools such as Tableau and Looker Studio.
Commercial acumen, ideally around SaaS B2B Sales and Marketing data.
Data cleaning and preparation using tools such as Coefficient or Tableau Prep.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities.
Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Marketing Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote/Barcelona

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 5,000,000 active users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

Over 30,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, H&M, Adidas, IKEA, SHEIN, noon, and Bloomingdale‚Äôs use Tabby‚Äôs technology to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering flexible payments online and in stores. Tabby is active in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt and Kuwait and backed by leading investors, including Sequoia Capital India, STV, PayPal Ventures, Mubadala Investment Capital, Arbor Ventures and others.

We are looking for a Marketing Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. Marketing Analyst will work with our marketing team and help us evaluate marketing efficiency and find the best way to acquire new and reactivate existing users, playing a pivotal role in launching and optimizing marketing strategies that drive meaningful impact. You'll collaborate closely with Analysts, Marketing, and Product teams.

You‚Äôll be working in a dynamic, rapidly evolving environment with the following responsibilities:


Provide analytical support to the Marketing and Product Marketing teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of customer. acquisition cost, customer spending forecast, and finding an optimal mix of marketing channels.
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly to highlight the importance of your insights.
Support and monitor existing performance marketing metrics, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise:


3+ years of experience as a data/marketing analyst.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
Proficiency in digital marketing platforms from Meta and Google.
Strong understanding of mobile attribution and MMPs (AppsFlyer, Adjust, etc.), including event tracking, postbacks, and troubleshooting.
Experience working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data ‚Äî extracting, decoding, and analyzing postbacks to optimize iOS campaigns.
Knowledge of privacy-first attribution frameworks like Apple‚Äôs ATT, Meta's AEM, and Google‚Äôs Privacy Sandbox.
Experience with marketing attribution platforms is a plus.
Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
Fluency in English.



Job Benefits:


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in company‚Äôs employee stock options program.
Health Insurance.



Relocation

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia/Georgia/Serbia/Portugal/Spain.

We will help you open a legal entity and a bank account. In Armenia and Georgia the taxes are compensated by Tabby. In other countries we provide partial compensation of taxes.

We employ according to B2B contracts (service agreements).

For our employees we cover the following:


Flight to one of the mentioned countries.
Accommodation during the paperwork completion period.
Opening a bank account and getting a residence permit in one of the mentioned countries.
Family relocation (dependants).



New employees can also choose an alternative method of relocation to another country of their choice. In this case, Tabby will reimburse up to $5,000 of verified costs upon opening a legal entity and a bank account.

We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Retail Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Retail Media EMEA Analytics team, part of the rapidly expanding Criteo Retail Media business, leverages our grand set of shopper data to design and develop actionable insights for our Retailer and Brand clients. We bring the analytical perspective onto the business and provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry and products. We leverage our unique position to provide our commercial teams and clients with visibility into shopper behavior, market trends and product performance that can't be found anywhere else.

Criteo‚Äôs high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position requires working with large sets of data and a variety of stakeholders to solve complex business problems by thinking strategically and proposing innovative solutions. The ideal candidate functions with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Mine massive data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools of Criteo analytics stack (Hadoop, Vertica, PySpark‚Ä¶)
Develop innovative analytical approaches to measure Brands & Retailers‚Äô performance from design to presentation of results, leveraging all our expertise in Data Science (statistical thinking, A/B testing, bootstrapping, data visualization‚Ä¶)
Frequently interact with other teams (R&D, product, commercial teams‚Ä¶) and clients to share data-driven recommendations and insights
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products and technologies as they evolve



Who You Are:

You are passionate about data and want to work with leading edge technologies in online industry:


You have at least 2 years‚Äô experience in Data Science or Data Analytics
Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.)
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science/Data Analytics: SQL is required, Python is a real asset (master most common data libraries: pandas, numpy‚Ä¶)
Outstanding analytical skills: passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
A background in the digital industry or consulting is a plus
You have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
You are fluent in English



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data Analyst




Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our Data Analyst team of Customer Interactions and Monetization Tribe.




Our mission is to enhance business performance through descriptive analytics and business diagnosis, providing insights and recommendations that facilitate better decision-making and lead to improved commercial outcomes.




We seek a dynamic and proactive individual who can engage with business areas, comprehend their needs, understand their services and products, and navigate the data ecosystem to produce precise and meaningful data-driven analyses.




We value a strong and honest team spirit, fostering an excellent and collaborative environment with business stakeholders and your fellow Data Analysts. This contributes to a robust and highly skilled data analyst community.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Engage proactively with business areas to understand their business goals, financial services and products, to generate accurate data-driven business analyses and recommendations.

Analyzing product trends to increase sales conversion, reduce product attrition, improve digital funnels, and support communication campaigns. This involves identifying key performance indicators, monitoring product performance, and suggesting actionable insights to optimize sales strategies and customer experience.

Conducting customer analyses to determine customer lifetime value, customer segmentation, and forecast customer development. This includes using analytical techniques to identify patterns and trends in customer data, enabling the business to tailor its marketing and retention strategies effectively.

Supporting and advising the business on reporting needs and other analytical requirements. This entails collaborating with stakeholders to define reporting metrics, coordinate the development of comprehensive dashboards to ensure data-driven business monitoring and decision-making.




Additionally, you will collaborate closely with your Data Analyst teammates to foster a robust and highly skilled data analyst community. This involves sharing best practices, participating in knowledge-sharing sessions, and contributing to a culture of continuous improvement and excellence.







What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!




Willing to assume challenges, take initiative and personal responsibility.

Desirable thinking in strategic terms. Able to recognize key information, identify business opportunities, establish connections and apply analytics for decision-making.

Willing to learn and improve your technical and your interpersonal skills.

Diven and customer-focused, always striving to understand and meet the needs of the business and its clients.

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, or other degree with strong analytical content.

Full proficiency in Excel, SAS and SQL

At least 5 years of experience in a comparable role, transforming data to extract key business insights. Experience in retail banking is highly recommended

Your communication skills enable you to work together with many different parties throughout our organization. Negotiation and stakeholder management

Fluent English will be appreciated.







What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but‚Ä¶ What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.

Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn‚Äôt take up your time or your cravings.

Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!

Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.

Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids‚Ä¶

Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.

Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!

More vitality and more belonging

360¬∫ care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Runners club with your own trainer.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+) & Leonas.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1600 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead‚Äîthat‚Äôs our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working‚Ä¶we are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Hi! üëãüèº

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Data & Analytics Specialist to take our Data team to the next level üöÄ




1. Team and Role

If you have experience working autonomously on technical data projects, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to enhance Shakers' analytics, with the chance to shape the next generation way of working. If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! ü§©




2. What you¬¥ll be doing

Your day-to-day in Data & Analytics

Writing efficient SQL queries for large-scale data warehouses.
Defining, building, and maintaining ETL models in our data warehouse using dbt and Airflow.
Building data integrations and ensuring data quality across pipeline layers.
Documenting and maintaining code and queries in GitLab.
Creating dashboards and reports in Looker/Looker Studio to communicate results and track KPIs.
Conducting exploratory analysis to shape projects and provide actionable recommendations.
Presenting insights to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Collaborating with PMs, designers, and engineers to define data needs, request app events, integrate third-party tools, and develop data models.
Supporting feature design with product managers and engineers through performance measurement and impact testing.
Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.




3. What we¬¥re looking for

You¬¥re a great fit if you have...

Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling).
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
Fluency in English and Spanish.

Bonus points:

A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
Experience in Startup or fast paced environment




4. What's in it for you?

Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 35.000‚Ç¨ and 46.000‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

Between 35.000‚Ç¨ & 40.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary
Up to 6.000‚Ç¨ quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)

Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö

Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... üìç

Organic fruit
Free caffeine and theine




5. Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this March, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!

The Road to Joining Our Team

Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check, CEO Chat: Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.




More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!




Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!




A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
TL;DR:

Data Analyst. Junior-Mid level. Product company, automotive industryüöò. An excellent moment¬† to join our company. Hybrid role based in Madrid. [‚Ç¨24k - ‚Ç¨28k].




Hi




We are REVEL! And we love two things: cars & technology.¬†




REVEL offers an online all-inclusive car subscription experience. Your car delivered to your door. We are currently operating in Spain.




Check our website here: https://driverevel.com




We are on our way to becoming a carbon-neutral company and we have a lot of cool projects ahead :)¬†




We are building a great team for that.




What are we looking for?




We are looking for an enthusiastic creative professional that wants to grow with us. You will be a key resource to provide insights to the Operations team, by merging your business acumen and analytical skills with our historical data.




What will you do at REVEL?




At REVEL we want all our decisions to be supported by data, and for that we have created a specialized team. As a Data Analyst, you will be developing data models in DBT, creating dashboards in Power BI, analyzing historical data, building reports and helping the Operations team grow and become more efficient and data-driven. The core responsibilities include:




Work closely with cross-functional teams (Sales, Fleet, Customer Experience) to understand their data requirements and provide tailored data solutions.
Develop analytical models in DBT and data marts in Power BI to prepare data for analysis
Develop dashboards in Power BI to regularly communicate results and monitor key metrics.
Provide guidance and support to business leaders and stakeholders on how best to harness available data in support of critical business needs and goals
Drive clarity and solve ambiguous, challenging business problems using data-driven approaches




How will your first semester look like at REVEL?

1st month: you will have understood our data stack, dashboards, working methodology, and company culture. You will start analyzing data and sharing insights with the Operations‚Äô teams.
In 3 months: you will be an expert in data analysis of our fleet data and will be able to propose improvements and optimisations based on the insights obtained. The teams will be able to act on your recommendations for improving their processes on a regular basis.¬†
In 6 months: you will be the absolute leader in data analysis for the Operations‚Äô teams¬† at REVEL! You will actively participate in strategic decision-making and contribute to the growth and success of the company.




Essential Requirements:




1-3 years of relevant work experience in a similar role.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Economics, Mathematics, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
Strong background in management and operations is highly valued
Ability to summarize and visualize data (i.e., descriptive statistics and charts).
Experience in creating stories and visualizations to communicate data insights.
Proficiency in PowerBI (preferably) or any other data visualization tool
Proficiency in SQL, writing and understanding complex SQL queries and working with multiple data sources
Help design and implement data pipelines for efficient data collection, transformation, and visualization
Basic knowledge and experience in Python
You are independent in solving problems within your capabilities and proactive in asking for support when the task is beyond your expertise.
You are rigorous, humble, curious and proactive.
English is a must.




Non-essential, but interesting:




Version control GIT
Experience working with DBT
Experience working with APIs¬†
Experience working with cloud data platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP)
You have previously worked in a startup environment.
You have previously worked in agile environments.




What we offer:




An agile environment where your opinions matter and materialize, in fact, we expect you to give your opinion and help us define projects together.
We work in a flexible hybrid approach - you will be able to choose to work from home the days that best suit your needs. We have a very cozy office available in central Madrid, Barcelona, and Sevilla , and¬† we may open other hubs soon.
We are a results-oriented company. You are free to organize your work to suit your daily life.
Annual gross salary in the following range: [‚Ç¨24k - ‚Ç¨28k]
Discount in the subscription of any car of our fleet
Wellhub (Gympass) Silver plan¬†
Cigna healthcare plan
Flexible remuneration through PayFlow
Budget for training: courses, events, etc.
23 days of holidays. If your birthday falls on a weekday, you can have it off too!
Periodic performance reviews.
We are in the middle of a scale-up process so it is a great time to join our company




How we work:




At REVEL we work with short sprints, with measurable objectives and clear requirements. This allows us to organize the work efficiently. We try to put love into everything we do, so attention to detail and accountability for our work are fundamental factors in the way we work.




You will be part of the Data team, but working hand in hand with the Operations team to help them achieve their objectives. Your data analytics skills will complement the Operations team's know-how.

Title: Data Analyst - Fraude Audiovisual
Description:
Descripci√≥n del puesto:

¬°En LALIGA seguimos creciendo!

¬†

Buscamos un Data Analyst altamente anal√≠tico y orientado a resultados para unirse a nuestro equipo de Fraude Audiovisual en una organizaci√≥n deportiva l√≠der. Ser√°s responsable de procesar, analizar y presentar datos relacionados con la detecci√≥n y prevenci√≥n del uso no autorizado de contenido audiovisual, apoyando la toma de decisiones estrat√©gicas y operativas.

¬†

Responsabilidades Principales:

An√°lisis de Datos:
Recopilar, organizar y analizar grandes vol√∫menes de datos relacionados con actividades de fraude audiovisual, incluyendo accesos ilegales, streaming no autorizado y patrones de uso de VPN.
Identificar tendencias y patrones clave para informar sobre riesgos y amenazas.
Creaci√≥n de Dashboards:
Dise√±ar y mantener dashboards interactivos que presenten m√©tricas clave en tiempo real, como el volumen de infracciones detectadas, √°reas geogr√°ficas de mayor incidencia y efectividad de las medidas de mitigaci√≥n.
Asegurar que los dashboards sean accesibles y comprensibles para distintos niveles de la organizaci√≥n.
Soporte en la Toma de Decisiones:
Transformar los datos en informaci√≥n √∫til para apoyar decisiones estrat√©gicas relacionadas con la protecci√≥n de los derechos audiovisuales.
Proveer reportes detallados para stakeholders internos, resaltando insights y recomendaciones basadas en an√°lisis de datos.
Automatizaci√≥n y Modelos Predictivos:
Desarrollar modelos predictivos y algoritmos para anticipar posibles infracciones basadas en patrones hist√≥ricos.
Automatizar procesos de recopilaci√≥n y an√°lisis para optimizar la eficiencia operativa.
Colaboraci√≥n Interdepartamental:
Trabajar en estrecha colaboraci√≥n con los equipos legales, tecnol√≥gicos y de contenido para asegurar que las estrategias de prevenci√≥n sean consistentes y efectivas.
