Title: Data Analyst
Place: Vilanova i la Geltr√∫, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Everything you are looking for and more üì¶

This position focuses on analyzing and improving logistics network efficiency, particularly optimizing the first, middle, and last-mile processes. As a key contributor to operational insights and decision-making, you will leverage advanced analytics, build predictive models, and create dashboards to monitor and enhance network performance. Collaboration with cross-market teams is central to this role, as is the ability to design and implement KPIs aligned with business objectives.

What responsibilities and objectives will you have?




¬∑ Conduct an exploratory analysis of the effectiveness of the network, with a particular focus on first, middle and last mile optimization to improve overall network efficiency

¬∑ Develop and present insights and recommendations based on the analysis conducted

¬∑ Work with all our markets to develop advanced operational analytics with a focus on improving the efficiency of the network

¬∑ Build models to support management decision making

¬∑ Develop compelling dashboards to measure the impact of new initiatives

¬∑ Conduct weekly KPI reporting to help broader teams make insightful data-driven decisions

¬∑ Design and develop new KPIs in line with business objectives to track performance

¬∑ Create and maintain documentation of analysis, KPIs and business definitions







Well, what will the requirements be?




¬∑ Fluency in English for verbal and written communication

¬∑ Proven experience as a data analyst or similar role

¬∑ Ability to work with large data sets, optimize queries/calculations and visualize data

¬∑ Ability to identify relationships between different pieces of information, draw logical and reliable conclusions and communicate them in a business-friendly manner

¬∑ Ability to apply statistical and mathematical knowledge to analysis

¬∑ Strong knowledge of Python (numpy, pandas, matplotlib, seaborn)

¬∑ Strong knowledge of SQL to build database queries

¬∑ Experience of working with data from a variety of sources (e.g. DWH, DataLake, Databricks, SQL and noSQL databases)

¬∑ Proficient in Excel

¬∑ Experience with Power BI and Power Automate

¬∑ Strong analytical skills

¬∑ Excellent organizational skills, proactive attitude and ability to work effectively under time pressure

¬∑ Experience on the logistics sector would be a plus (related to data analysis)







What do we offer?

Excellent working enviroment

Professional growth within the company

Flexible working hours

Online platform for lifelong learning

Competitive salary

Flexible remuneration services can be contracted




Inclusive Culture

InPost has an Equal Opportunities Plan that promotes equality at all levels. We aim for equality in the company's workplaces, as it is focused on promotion, within and outside the company, as well as gender equality, diversity, equity and inclusion of people regardless of their abilities and conditions.

Title: Data Analyst (Python, GCP, Tableau)
Description:
Our client: they‚Äôre redefining the way brands capture attention in a fast-moving digital world. Their mission? To create outperforming online ads that shake the market and drive incredible results for our clients. They‚Äôre looking for a visionary and fully remote Performance Creative Strategist to join their dynamic team and make waves with groundbreaking ideas and strategies.







If you live and breathe creativity, have a knack for identifying winning opportunities, and thrive on delivering ads that outperform and outlast the competition‚Äîread on.







As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in driving marketing performance by managing data pipelines, transforming raw data into valuable insights, and building high-impact dashboards. You‚Äôll work closely with their UA team to ensure data is accurate, accessible, and actionable.










Requirements:

3+ years of experience in data analytics, preferably within marketing, digital advertising, or performance-driven environments.
Expertise in SQL (BigQuery) and/or Python/R for data manipulation and statistical analysis.
Hands-on experience with Improvado (UI-based data extraction).
Proficiency in Tableau or similar to create interactive dashboards and reports.
Strong knowledge of Google Cloud Platform (GCP) tools for data management and automation.
Ability to analyze large datasets, generate actionable insights, and communicate findings effectively.
Experience with Adjust, Appsflyer, GA4, Ad Networks
Fluent in English
Excellent problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.







Bonus Points:

Other languages are a plus.
Experience in marketing analytics, attribution modeling, or A/B testing.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques for predictive analytics.







They offer:

Opportunity to work on cutting-edge campaigns with ambitious clients.
A collaborative, forward-thinking team that celebrates big ideas and bold risks.
Fixed salary (25-35k gross/year) and performance-based incentives.
23 vacation days & 14 public holidays, all paid.
Flexibility: Fully remote and adaptable work schedules.
Endless opportunities for growth, learning, and creativity. We support your upskilling with courses & books of your choice.
Company events every now and then where we gather all the teams together.
Fully remote in a multicultural Environment.







Key Responsibilities:

Data Cleaning & Preparation ‚Äì Process and clean large datasets using Google BigQuery (SQL), Python, or other tools to ensure accuracy and usability.
Data Extraction ‚Äì Work with Improvado (UI-based extraction) to pull marketing performance data efficiently.
Data Transformation ‚Äì Leverage Google BigQuery (SQL) for advanced data modeling, transformations, and aggregations.
Data Visualization ‚Äì Design interactive dashboards in Tableau to communicate insights and drive decision-making.
Tooling & Infrastructure ‚Äì Utilize Google Cloud, Python, and R for advanced analytics, automation, and predictive modeling.
Data Analysis & Insights ‚Äì Conduct deep-dive analyses to uncover trends, optimize campaigns, and improve marketing performance.
Collaboration ‚Äì Work closely with performance marketers, clients and stakeholders to define KPIs and improve reporting frameworks.

Title: Data & Analytics Trainee
Description:
Job Summary

As a Data and Analytics Trainee, you will embark on a journey to dive deep into the world of data science and analytics. This role is designed for individuals who are passionate about leveraging data to drive insights and make informed decisions. You will be part of a dynamic team of data professionals, working closely with experienced data analysts, BI analysts and data engineers to hone your skills and contribute to real-world projects.




Key Accountabilities

Among others, you will:

Analytical Support

‚Ä¢Assist in data collection, cleaning, and preprocessing tasks under the guidance of senior team members.

‚Ä¢Learn to navigate and manipulate data using programming languages such as Python or SQL.

‚Ä¢Follow established protocols to ensure data quality and integrity throughout the process.

‚Ä¢Contribute to basic data analysis tasks, such as descriptive statistics, exploratory data analysis, and hypothesis testing.




Visualization and Reporting:

‚Ä¢Assist in creating visualizations and dashboards to communicate data findings effectively.

‚Ä¢Learn to use data visualization tools and libraries to create clear and compelling presentations of analytical results.




Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:

We expect that you have experience with:

Knowledge of programming languages commonly used in data analysis, such as Python or SQL.
Ability to write and understand basic scripts or queries for data manipulation and analysis.
Familiarity with data visualization principles and techniques.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Power BI or QlikSense.
Clear and effective communication skills, both verbal and written in English (as a multinational company, English will be the primary language of communication in the meetings).

Title: Growth - Data & Visualization Analyst
Description:
Hi, we‚Äôre Fever

We‚Äôre excited you are checking out this job offer.

We are the leading global live-entertainment discovery tech platform with a clear mission: to democratize access to culture and entertainment.

How do we achieve our mission? Fever has developed a proprietary technology that inspires a global community of over 125M people through personalized and curated experiences in their local city whilst empowering entertainment and event creators to reach new audiences and enhance their experience.

Sounds amazing, right?

About the Team

Growth is the team responsible for promoting the Fever business plan across all Markets and ensuring that our Partners perform as expected, helping them grow within Fever.

Our decisions are data-driven from the highest to the lowest strategy level, allowing us to fully understand the Fever business model and how we can leverage this to interact with every single team within the company to grow the business in the expected direction

About the Role

We are seeking a Growth Data & Visualization Analyst with a structured mindset who is passionate about enhancing efficiency and consistently drives tasks to completion. As a key member of the W&A team, you will:


Assist in establishing new communication channels, workflows, and tools across departments under the guidance of senior analysts
Support the complete development lifecycle of these processes, ensuring timely and accurate execution
Conduct detailed audits to streamline team requirements, enhancing overall operational efficiency
Help align the organization's business needs with technological and operational solutions by managing critical tools and procedures
Engage with departments worldwide, spanning 40+ countries and diverse nationalities, to support key processes from day one


About you


You hold a bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or Data Analytics (STEM degree)
At least 1 - 3 years experience in an analytics/strategy role
Proactive problem-solver and an opportunities-seeker with a strong willingness to learn
Strong analytical and quantitative skills as well as a strong bias towards data-based decision
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work successfully across many disciplines departments and business cases
Familiarity with SQL or other query languages is a plus, as is proficiency in Python, JavaScript, or other programming languages
Proficiency in both written and spoken English and Spanish is a must, while knowledge of additional languages is a valuable asset


Benefits & Perks


Attractive compensation package
Have a real impact on the company's growth and evolution
Excellent working conditions with a location in the heart of the Madrid scene
Home-office friendly
Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with
40% Discount on all events on Fever
Health insurance and other benefits such as Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee
English and Spanish Lessons
We have free food, drink and fruit at the office!
Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow
Gympass Membership


Thank you for considering joining Fever. We cannot wait to learn more about you!

If you want to learn more about us: Fever's Blog | Tech.Eu |TechCrunch

Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!

If you require any kind of accommodation during the selection process please contact our Talent team so we can help you by providing a welcoming and seamless journey.

If you want to know more about how Fever processes your personal data, click here Fever - Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Vilanova i la Geltr√∫, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Everything you are looking for and more üì¶

This position focuses on analyzing and improving logistics network efficiency, particularly optimizing the first, middle, and last-mile processes. As a key contributor to operational insights and decision-making, you will leverage advanced analytics, build predictive models, and create dashboards to monitor and enhance network performance. Collaboration with cross-market teams is central to this role, as is the ability to design and implement KPIs aligned with business objectives.

What responsibilities and objectives will you have?




¬∑ Conduct an exploratory analysis of the effectiveness of the network, with a particular focus on first, middle and last mile optimization to improve overall network efficiency

¬∑ Develop and present insights and recommendations based on the analysis conducted

¬∑ Work with all our markets to develop advanced operational analytics with a focus on improving the efficiency of the network

¬∑ Build models to support management decision making

¬∑ Develop compelling dashboards to measure the impact of new initiatives

¬∑ Conduct weekly KPI reporting to help broader teams make insightful data-driven decisions

¬∑ Design and develop new KPIs in line with business objectives to track performance

¬∑ Create and maintain documentation of analysis, KPIs and business definitions







Well, what will the requirements be?




¬∑ Fluency in English for verbal and written communication

¬∑ Proven experience as a data analyst or similar role

¬∑ Ability to work with large data sets, optimize queries/calculations and visualize data

¬∑ Ability to identify relationships between different pieces of information, draw logical and reliable conclusions and communicate them in a business-friendly manner

¬∑ Ability to apply statistical and mathematical knowledge to analysis

¬∑ Strong knowledge of Python (numpy, pandas, matplotlib, seaborn)

¬∑ Strong knowledge of SQL to build database queries

¬∑ Experience of working with data from a variety of sources (e.g. DWH, DataLake, Databricks, SQL and noSQL databases)

¬∑ Proficient in Excel

¬∑ Experience with Power BI and Power Automate

¬∑ Strong analytical skills

¬∑ Excellent organizational skills, proactive attitude and ability to work effectively under time pressure

¬∑ Experience on the logistics sector would be a plus (related to data analysis)







What do we offer?

Excellent working enviroment

Professional growth within the company

Flexible working hours

Online platform for lifelong learning

Competitive salary

Flexible remuneration services can be contracted




Inclusive Culture

InPost has an Equal Opportunities Plan that promotes equality at all levels. We aim for equality in the company's workplaces, as it is focused on promotion, within and outside the company, as well as gender equality, diversity, equity and inclusion of people regardless of their abilities and conditions.

Title: Data Analyst (Python, GCP, Tableau)
Description:
Our client: they‚Äôre redefining the way brands capture attention in a fast-moving digital world. Their mission? To create outperforming online ads that shake the market and drive incredible results for our clients. They‚Äôre looking for a visionary and fully remote Performance Creative Strategist to join their dynamic team and make waves with groundbreaking ideas and strategies.







If you live and breathe creativity, have a knack for identifying winning opportunities, and thrive on delivering ads that outperform and outlast the competition‚Äîread on.







As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in driving marketing performance by managing data pipelines, transforming raw data into valuable insights, and building high-impact dashboards. You‚Äôll work closely with their UA team to ensure data is accurate, accessible, and actionable.










Requirements:

3+ years of experience in data analytics, preferably within marketing, digital advertising, or performance-driven environments.
Expertise in SQL (BigQuery) and/or Python/R for data manipulation and statistical analysis.
Hands-on experience with Improvado (UI-based data extraction).
Proficiency in Tableau or similar to create interactive dashboards and reports.
Strong knowledge of Google Cloud Platform (GCP) tools for data management and automation.
Ability to analyze large datasets, generate actionable insights, and communicate findings effectively.
Experience with Adjust, Appsflyer, GA4, Ad Networks
Fluent in English
Excellent problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.







Bonus Points:

Other languages are a plus.
Experience in marketing analytics, attribution modeling, or A/B testing.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques for predictive analytics.







They offer:

Opportunity to work on cutting-edge campaigns with ambitious clients.
A collaborative, forward-thinking team that celebrates big ideas and bold risks.
Fixed salary (25-35k gross/year) and performance-based incentives.
23 vacation days & 14 public holidays, all paid.
Flexibility: Fully remote and adaptable work schedules.
Endless opportunities for growth, learning, and creativity. We support your upskilling with courses & books of your choice.
Company events every now and then where we gather all the teams together.
Fully remote in a multicultural Environment.







Key Responsibilities:

Data Cleaning & Preparation ‚Äì Process and clean large datasets using Google BigQuery (SQL), Python, or other tools to ensure accuracy and usability.
Data Extraction ‚Äì Work with Improvado (UI-based extraction) to pull marketing performance data efficiently.
Data Transformation ‚Äì Leverage Google BigQuery (SQL) for advanced data modeling, transformations, and aggregations.
Data Visualization ‚Äì Design interactive dashboards in Tableau to communicate insights and drive decision-making.
Tooling & Infrastructure ‚Äì Utilize Google Cloud, Python, and R for advanced analytics, automation, and predictive modeling.
Data Analysis & Insights ‚Äì Conduct deep-dive analyses to uncover trends, optimize campaigns, and improve marketing performance.
Collaboration ‚Äì Work closely with performance marketers, clients and stakeholders to define KPIs and improve reporting frameworks.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst seeking a new interesting challenge? üîç

If your answer is yes, it‚Äôs your lucky day so keep reading, it can be just what you're looking for! üëÄ




‚úçÔ∏èWHAT WILL YOU DO?

We are looking for a dynamic, proactive and talented person to join our team and perform the following tasks:

‚Ä¢ Connect and analyze large datasets from multiple sources to identify trends, patterns, and key insights.

‚Ä¢ Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand the data, detect anomalies, and uncover hidden patterns.

‚Ä¢ Design and create dynamic reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate insights.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with data engineering teams and business stakeholders to understand their data needs and define key performance indicators (KPIs).

Design and maintain dashboards and report datasets.




üßê WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

‚Ä¢ Years' experience: minimum 3 years in a similar role

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, Power BI, Tableau.

‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of SQL, Power Query and DAX for querying and extracting data from databases.

‚Ä¢ Experience with statistical tools or languages such as R, Python, or SAS or MDX is a plus.

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with data manipulation and transformation processes, including ETL (Extract, Transform, Load).

‚Ä¢ Upper-Intermediate level of English




üìÖ WHERE AND WHEN?

Workplace: Remote (Candidate should live in Spain)
Work Schedule: Business Hours




ü§ù WHAT CAN WE OFFER YOU?

Permanent contract üìã - We offer indefinite contracts from the first day.Pay and benefits üí∏ - Competitive salary and a flexible compensation plan adapted to your needs (Ticket restaurant plan, Childcare Ticket, Transport Ticket and Health Insurance).Work from home üèöÔ∏è - We offer you a financial support every month for your working from home expenses. In addition, in the first month we will give you a bonus to help you to set up your workplaceüë®‚ÄçüíªOpportunity knocks üëçüèª - Being a part of a growing company, we want to support your path with a career development plan and annual performance-based compensation reviews. Learn as you grow üìö - Starting with a fantastic onboarding program, TCS has robust learning platforms that will allow you to learn and grow personal as professionally.Bring your buddy üë´ - If you have referred a friend for an open position under the BYB Scheme and she/he is hired you‚Äôll receive a very attractive cash award.Connect globally üåè - Work with people from all over the world. You can feel the multicultural workforce.Benefit from being a TCSer üéüÔ∏è ‚Äì By being part of the TCS Spain family you can enjoy benefits, offers and corporate discounts on the best brands.And so on üéâ - Appreciations, incentives, Team Building activities, diversity and inclusion programs, sustainability activities, corporative events... This has only just begun!

üí°WHO ARE WE?

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an Information Technology (IT) company founded in 1968 as part of the Indian Tata Group and is one of the top 3 technology companies globally üöÄ




With a presence in 55 countries and more than 600,000 employees, TCS is considered one of the 10 best companies to work for worldwide in 2024 according to the Top Employers Institute ü•á




TCS Spain started operations in 2001 and currently has a diverse workforce that collaborates with the main Spanish and multinational companies üåè




TCS Spain has been certified as a Top Employer 2024 and has also been chosen as one of the 100 Best Companies to Work for in Spain in 2024 according to ForbesüèÜ




Among the portfolio of services, TCS has information technology services, asset-based solutions, global consulting, engineering and industrial services, digital solutions and services, application maintenance and development, quality assurance and testing services, IT infrastructure and BPS üéØ




Responsible for development, TCS Spain is committed to inclusion, diversity and sustainability, and promotes flexibility policies that support wellbeing and work-life balance üíØ




WELCOME, WE ARE WAITING FOR YOU! üöÄ

Title: Growth - Data & Visualization Analyst
Description:
Hi, we‚Äôre Fever

We‚Äôre excited you are checking out this job offer.

We are the leading global live-entertainment discovery tech platform with a clear mission: to democratize access to culture and entertainment.

How do we achieve our mission? Fever has developed a proprietary technology that inspires a global community of over 125M people through personalized and curated experiences in their local city whilst empowering entertainment and event creators to reach new audiences and enhance their experience.

Sounds amazing, right?

About the Team

Growth is the team responsible for promoting the Fever business plan across all Markets and ensuring that our Partners perform as expected, helping them grow within Fever.

Our decisions are data-driven from the highest to the lowest strategy level, allowing us to fully understand the Fever business model and how we can leverage this to interact with every single team within the company to grow the business in the expected direction

About the Role

We are seeking a Growth Data & Visualization Analyst with a structured mindset who is passionate about enhancing efficiency and consistently drives tasks to completion. As a key member of the W&A team, you will:


Assist in establishing new communication channels, workflows, and tools across departments under the guidance of senior analysts
Support the complete development lifecycle of these processes, ensuring timely and accurate execution
Conduct detailed audits to streamline team requirements, enhancing overall operational efficiency
Help align the organization's business needs with technological and operational solutions by managing critical tools and procedures
Engage with departments worldwide, spanning 40+ countries and diverse nationalities, to support key processes from day one


About you


You hold a bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or Data Analytics (STEM degree)
At least 1 - 3 years experience in an analytics/strategy role
Proactive problem-solver and an opportunities-seeker with a strong willingness to learn
Strong analytical and quantitative skills as well as a strong bias towards data-based decision
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work successfully across many disciplines departments and business cases
Familiarity with SQL or other query languages is a plus, as is proficiency in Python, JavaScript, or other programming languages
Proficiency in both written and spoken English and Spanish is a must, while knowledge of additional languages is a valuable asset


Benefits & Perks


Attractive compensation package
Have a real impact on the company's growth and evolution
Excellent working conditions with a location in the heart of the Madrid scene
Home-office friendly
Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with
40% Discount on all events on Fever
Health insurance and other benefits such as Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee
English and Spanish Lessons
We have free food, drink and fruit at the office!
Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow
Gympass Membership


Thank you for considering joining Fever. We cannot wait to learn more about you!

If you want to learn more about us: Fever's Blog | Tech.Eu |TechCrunch

Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!

If you require any kind of accommodation during the selection process please contact our Talent team so we can help you by providing a welcoming and seamless journey.

If you want to know more about how Fever processes your personal data, click here Fever - Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Keywords: Capital Markets, Global Client Analytics, Quantitative Data Intelligence, Python, SQL, GIT, Optimization

Your Main Activities Are


To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends throught what data can tell
As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team. Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understading their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation). You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving skills
You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analysing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic solutions
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stekeholders‚Äô needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis to our stakeholders
You must be prepared for routine changes, each day will be filled with new and excited challenges


Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Availability to work in the hybrid model or in person in the Lisbon or Porto office
Professional experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI
Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Proficiency in SQL
Fluency in written and spoken English
Ability to analyze, synthetize and simplify.
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus


About The Team


The Quantitative Data Intelligence (QDI) team is responsible for providing data, insights, and analysis to Global Markets front office.
The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner.
Our team is responsible for multiple steps regarding data processing: Data Feeds industrialization, ETL, Data Warehousing and Data Visualization. We are in direct contact with business sponsors, sales, and traders.
We seek to shape the technologies available to the client‚Äôs needs - we plan in processing the data using Python and SQL, while delivering the final product in Tableau, Power BI, APIs, and Chat bots.


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
N√∫mero da Solicita√ß√£o de Emprego: 88937

Hor√°rio: Full Time

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Data analysis ‚Äì understand and document the usage of data in the values of the received data formats.
Technical analysis of different data formats received from different data sources.
Use documentation and examples related to data interfaces to understand data structure and provide translation specifications (mappings) from one data format to another.
Identify and document gaps between producing and consuming applications and the Enterprise Data Models based on translation specifications (mappings)
Development and maintenance of documentation
Technical and non-technical stakeholder management (incl. information architects, business change managers, data product owners, data engineers, product owners and tech leads)
Ensure version control and governance around workflow management is followed.
Continuously seek and suggest improvements/optimisations to the process



Our requirements:



Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant subject
At least 3 years‚Äô experience working in similar role.
Knowledge of TMS systems and data attribute analysis and mapping is advantages
Excellent analytical skills and an informed, evidence-based approach
Being detail-oriented and capable of delivering a high level of accuracy
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to talk and present to a range of audiences, facilitating interactions to gain insight into open questions
The ability to work under pressure delivering on agreed deadlines
A good understanding of information technology
Excellent level of written and spoken English



What we offer:



Challenges in an international environment
Career development opportunities
Internal training catalogue
Permanent contract
Private medical care
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Scandinavian work culture
Work-life balance
Culture of feedback
Work schedule 35h/week

Title: Product Analyst (Data team)
Description:
About us:

Planner 5D is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). Our platform simplifies the home renovation process from concept to execution, and this process has never been more straightforward with our cutting-edge software. You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.

Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. Planner 5D is more than just software; it's a vibrant community of enthusiastic and product-oriented professionals. From diverse backgrounds, our team collaborates across time zones, fueled by a shared passion to revolutionize the home design market.

We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.

The Senior Product Analyst will play a critical role in driving data-informed decision-making and product optimization.

Key responsibilities include:


Tracking Events Design and Specification: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and specify tracking events that capture user behavior and product interactions
Tracking Events Delivery and Quality Management: Ensure accurate and timely delivery of tracking events and maintain high data quality standards
Definitions of Features and Connected Tracking Events: Clearly define product features and their associated tracking events to enable comprehensive analysis
Product and Feature Usage Metrics and KPIs: Develop and monitor key metrics and KPIs to measure product and feature performance
Framework for Feature Usage Analysis and Insights: Create a framework for analyzing feature usage and generating actionable insights
Overall Product Growth Metrics and Analysis: Track and analyze overall product growth metrics to identify trends and opportunities
A/B Test Framework for Continuous Improvements: Implement and manage an A/B testing framework to facilitate data-driven experimentation and optimization
Hypothesis and Experiments Documentation, Delivery, and Analysis: Document hypotheses, design and execute experiments, and analyze results to validate assumptions and inform product decisions
Conduct Quantitative and Qualitative Product Research: Utilize both quantitative and qualitative research methods to gain a deep understanding of user needs and behaviors
Use AI Tools and Approaches for Product Analysis: Leverage AI tools and techniques to enhance product analysis and uncover valuable insights



Qualifications:


Strong Analytical Skills: Proven ability to collect, analyze, and interpret complex data sets
Product Development Knowledge: Familiarity with product development processes and methodologies
Technical Proficiency: Experience with data analysis tools such as BigQuery, Looker Data Studio, and product analytics platforms like Amplitude, Devtodev, Mixpanel, or other modern tools and frameworks
AI and Machine Learning Experience: Knowledge of AI and machine learning techniques and their application in product analysis
Communication and Collaboration: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams
Problem-Solving and Critical Thinking: Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making
Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering) or equivalent experience



Key Skills:


Data Analysis
Product Analytics
SQL
BigQuery
Looker Data Studio
A/B Testing
Experimentation
AI and Machine Learning
Communication
Collaboration
Problem-Solving



Additional Skills:


Knowledge of data visualization tools
Statistical modeling expertise



What we offer:


Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
Company computer equipment by request
Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses
English classes on our corporate platform
Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building
Unlimited free Planner5D subscriptions

Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Marketing Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 5,000,000 active users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

Over 30,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, H&M, Adidas, IKEA, SHEIN, noon, and Bloomingdale‚Äôs use Tabby‚Äôs technology to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering flexible payments online and in stores. Tabby is active in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt and Kuwait and backed by leading investors, including Sequoia Capital India, STV, PayPal Ventures, Mubadala Investment Capital, Arbor Ventures and others.

We are looking for a Marketing Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. Marketing Analyst will work with our marketing team and help us evaluate marketing efficiency and find the best way to acquire new and reactivate existing users, playing a pivotal role in launching and optimizing marketing strategies that drive meaningful impact. You'll collaborate closely with Analysts, Marketing, and Product teams.

You‚Äôll be working in a dynamic, rapidly evolving environment with the following responsibilities:


Provide analytical support to the Marketing and Product Marketing teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of customer. acquisition cost, customer spending forecast, and finding an optimal mix of marketing channels.
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly to highlight the importance of your insights.
Support and monitor existing performance marketing metrics, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise:


3+ years of experience as a data/marketing analyst.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
Proficiency in digital marketing platforms from Meta and Google.
Strong understanding of mobile attribution and MMPs (AppsFlyer, Adjust, etc.), including event tracking, postbacks, and troubleshooting.
Experience working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data ‚Äî extracting, decoding, and analyzing postbacks to optimize iOS campaigns.
Knowledge of privacy-first attribution frameworks like Apple‚Äôs ATT, Meta's AEM, and Google‚Äôs Privacy Sandbox.
Experience with marketing attribution platforms is a plus.
Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
Fluency in English.



Job Benefits:


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in company‚Äôs employee stock options program.
Health Insurance.



Relocation

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia/Georgia/Serbia/Portugal/Spain.

We will help you open a legal entity and a bank account. In Armenia and Georgia the taxes are compensated by Tabby. In other countries we provide partial compensation of taxes.

We employ according to B2B contracts (service agreements).

For our employees we cover the following:


Flight to one of the mentioned countries.
Accommodation during the paperwork completion period.
Opening a bank account and getting a residence permit in one of the mentioned countries.
Family relocation (dependants).



New employees can also choose an alternative method of relocation to another country of their choice. In this case, Tabby will reimburse up to $5,000 of verified costs upon opening a legal entity and a bank account.

We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Provide analytical support to the Marketing and Product Marketing teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of customer. acquisition cost, customer spending forecast, and finding an optimal mix of marketing channels.
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly to highlight the importance of your insights.
Support and monitor existing performance marketing metrics, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise:


3+ years of experience as a data/marketing analyst.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
Proficiency in digital marketing platforms from Meta and Google.
Strong understanding of mobile attribution and MMPs (AppsFlyer, Adjust, etc.), including event tracking, postbacks, and troubleshooting.
Experience working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data ‚Äî extracting, decoding, and analyzing postbacks to optimize iOS campaigns.
Knowledge of privacy-first attribution frameworks like Apple‚Äôs ATT, Meta's AEM, and Google‚Äôs Privacy Sandbox.
Experience with marketing attribution platforms is a plus.
Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
Fluency in English.



Job Benefits:


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in company‚Äôs employee stock options program.
Health Insurance.



Relocation

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia/Georgia/Serbia/Portugal/Spain.

We will help you open a legal entity and a bank account. In Armenia and Georgia the taxes are compensated by Tabby. In other countries we provide partial compensation of taxes.

We employ according to B2B contracts (service agreements).

For our employees we cover the following:


Flight to one of the mentioned countries.
Accommodation during the paperwork completion period.
Opening a bank account and getting a residence permit in one of the mentioned countries.
Family relocation (dependants).



New employees can also choose an alternative method of relocation to another country of their choice. In this case, Tabby will reimburse up to $5,000 of verified costs upon opening a legal entity and a bank account.

We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!
Show more
HTML:
Department: Marketing Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote/Lisbon

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 5,000,000 active users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

Over 30,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, H&M, Adidas, IKEA, SHEIN, noon, and Bloomingdale‚Äôs use Tabby‚Äôs technology to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering flexible payments online and in stores. Tabby is active in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt and Kuwait and backed by leading investors, including Sequoia Capital India, STV, PayPal Ventures, Mubadala Investment Capital, Arbor Ventures and others.

We are looking for a Marketing Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. Marketing Analyst will work with our marketing team and help us evaluate marketing efficiency and find the best way to acquire new and reactivate existing users, playing a pivotal role in launching and optimizing marketing strategies that drive meaningful impact. You'll collaborate closely with Analysts, Marketing, and Product teams.

  • Provide analytical support to the Marketing and Product Marketing teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of customer. acquisition cost, customer spending forecast, and finding an optimal mix of marketing channels.
  • Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly to highlight the importance of your insights.

  • Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
  • Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.


Skills, Knowledge & Expertise:

  • 3+ years of experience as a data/marketing analyst.
  • Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
  • Proficiency in digital marketing platforms from Meta and Google.

  • Experience working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data ‚Äî extracting, decoding, and analyzing postbacks to optimize iOS campaigns.
  • Knowledge of privacy-first attribution frameworks like Apple‚Äôs ATT, Meta's AEM, and Google‚Äôs Privacy Sandbox.
  • Experience with marketing attribution platforms is a plus.
  • Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
  • Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests is a plus.
  • Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
  • Fluency in English.


Job Benefits:

  • We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
  • A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
  • You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
  • Participation in company‚Äôs employee stock options program.
  • Health Insurance.


Relocation

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia/Georgia/Serbia/Portugal/Spain.

We will help you open a legal entity and a bank account. In Armenia and Georgia the taxes are compensated by Tabby. In other countries we provide partial compensation of taxes.

We employ according to B2B contracts (service agreements).

For our employees we cover the following:

  • Flight to one of the mentioned countries.
  • Accommodation during the paperwork completion period.
  • Opening a bank account and getting a residence permit in one of the mentioned countries.
  • Family relocation (dependants).


New employees can also choose an alternative method of relocation to another country of their choice. In this case, Tabby will reimburse up to $5,000 of verified costs upon opening a legal entity and a bank account.

We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

Title: Data Analyst (COO)
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. It is also part of our culture to care about the environment and to carry out actions of social and environmental corporate responsibility.

This could be your opportunity to join a project of international scope, with a client that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

üíª THE JOB

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Analyst for an national project in the banks sector.

üí° What We Are Looking For


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI
Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Proficiency in SQL
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus
Fluency in English


‚≠ê What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Reconciliation of professional and family life

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians customers, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with subject DA.RM.DB

Learn more about Axians

Title: Product Data Analyst ‚Äì Digital Channels
Description:
Country: Portugal

Localiza√ß√£o: Lisboa

Descri√ß√£o Geral da Fun√ß√£o

We are looking for an experienced and data-driven Product Data Analyst to join our Digital Channels team. This role focuses on leveraging data to inform and optimize product decisions, ensuring our web and app platforms deliver outstanding customer experiences. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and a strong analytical background, helping the team with product discovery, business case development, A/B testing, and the continuous monitoring of key features through dashboards and reporting tools.

Principais Responsabilidades


User interaction Analysis: Analyze web and app usage data to uncover trends, user behavior, and opportunities for product improvement.
Product Discovery Support: Collaborate with Product Managers during the discovery phase by providing insights from data to identify customer needs and validate opportunities.
Business Case Development: Contribute to the development of business cases by providing data-driven insights and projections to evaluate potential product initiatives.
Success Metrics Definition: Partner with stakeholders to define and track key success metrics for new features and initiatives, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
A/B Testing: Design, execute, and analyze A/B tests to validate hypotheses, measure impact, and optimize product performance.
Dashboard Creation: Develop and maintain dashboards for continuous monitoring of key features, ensuring stakeholders have real-time insights into performance.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and Marketing teams to ensure data-driven decision-making throughout the product lifecycle.
Tool Optimization: Act as a subject matter expert in Google Analytics 4, ensuring best practices are followed and providing training or guidance to team members as needed.


Requisitos


Experience: 2-5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a fintech, digital product, or SaaS environment.
Analytics Expertise: Strong hands-on experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and familiarity with other analytics tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Power BI).
Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with Python or R for data analysis is a plus.
Data Storytelling: Ability to transform complex data into clear, actionable insights and present findings effectively to stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: Strong analytical mindset with a focus on solving complex problems using data.
A/B Testing: Experience designing and interpreting A/B tests to evaluate product hypotheses and feature performance.
Collaboration Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience working in cross-functional teams.
Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics), Economics, Marketing, Business or a related discipline.

Title: Business, Data Analytics and Insights Associate
Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP), number 1 company in Best Workplaces - https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/ - ranking in Portugal (category 201-500 employees) by the Great Place to Work Institute. is home to over 300 talented people and more than 35 different nationalities, diverse areas of expertise and professional experience that are shaping the future of healthcare. This is your chance to explore a world of opportunities in different areas such as Cybersecurity, Data & Analytics, Digital, Technology and Innovation, Finance, General & Admin, Human Resources, Regulatory Affairs and many more. In Lisbon's city center, our AMGEN office fosters innovation, excellence, and inspiration. Come thrive with us at AMGEN, supporting our mission To Serve Patients. What we do at AMGEN matters in people‚Äôs lives.

Business, Data Analytics and Insights Senior Associate

LIVE

What You Will Do

You, as our Business, Data Analytics and Insights Associate, supports the delivery of day to day D&A activities. You are responsible for producing budgeting and planning reports, data analysis and supporting wider business Units within the ACCP.

Other responsibilities will include:


Supporting business planning and decision making through financial analysis.
Support long-term and short-term planning support activities.
Calculating scenarios based of expectations.
Collecting feedback and preparing communication plans to share outputs.
Taking ownership of complex calculations through understanding inputs and their relationships to the problem.
Upload, manage and store complex data.
Communicate competently with regional hubs.
Supporting ACCP continuous improvement activities.
Supporting wider business units on an ad hoc basis (Finance/FP&A/Business Enablement).


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


University Degree in commerce, finance, economics, mathematics, healthcare or related field.
1+ years working in a finance/data related field ideally Data and Analytics.
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication.
Strong Excel knowledge .


Preferred Requirements:


Working knowledge of IS systems (including demonstrated capability of other MS Office applications, SQL, Hyperion Pillar, Tableau, Anaplan).
Demonstrates a service-minded attitude.
Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry.
Clearly explains processes and procedures.
Fluency in multiple European languages.


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we‚Äôre able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities

  • Main responsible for Business requirement gathering, User Story writing, and leading User Story refinement / Solution design efforts within the team. Able to build small prototypes and mock-ups as part of refinement efforts.
  • Work together with Stakeholders during the Acceptance stage of solutions to guarantee successful delivery.
  • Proactively capture and understand Business processes and suggest improvements to the Data Platform that benefit the organization.

Essential Skills

  • At least 5 years' experience in a similar role;
  • Proven experience with data projects related to accounting, planning and financial analysis domains;
  • Solid knowledge of data analysis and programming with SQL and Python;
  • Good knowledge of understanding REST/API SOAP APIs;
  • Good ability to create prototypes to support requirements in Power BI;
  • Good knowledge of English.

The responsibilities include development and maintenance of data model and reporting in Tableau, resource planning and business analysis, performance tracking and monitoring, territory management and data quality and support for the wider business Units within ACCP and Amgen.

Maintaining internal databases (master data, data validation, etc.)

Support on capacity calculation and territories

Field force sizing, targeting and efficacy/effectiveness
Supporting ACCP continuous improvement activities.

WIN

University Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Business, Healthcare or Data
1+ years‚Äô experience with reporting / data analyst / data integration role with increasing responsibilities and scope
Providing support on the internal CRM system
Strong knowledge of MS Office tools ( Excel and PPT)
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication
Consistent track record of achieving desired results
Persuasive, resilient and problem solver
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Some knowledge of SQL

Title: Financial Data Analyst
Description:
What do we do?

Paddle offers digital product companies a completely different approach to their payment infrastructure. Instead of assembling and maintaining a complex stack of payments-related apps and services, we‚Äôre a Merchant of Record for our customers. That means we take away 100% of the pain of payment fragmentation. It‚Äôs faster, safer, cheaper, and, above all, way better.

We‚Äôre backed by investors including KKR, FTV Capital, Kindred, Notion, and 83North and serve over 5000 software sellers in 245 territories globally.

The Role:

Working closely with Paddle‚Äôs finance team, the core of the role will be supporting the Finance Operations Manager in making sure all financial data is accurate and available in real time.

As Paddle is scaling we‚Äôre constantly developing and delivering new products for our customers, as well rapidly growing the number of transactions through our platform each month globally. In order to maintain high standards in financial reporting, these changes in products and increase in transactions must be monitored closely, and the reporting accurately reflected.

The Analyst will be responsible for creating, maintaining, and improving a series of reports across accounting, tax and treasury, as well as supporting the team through annual audits, and providing data analysis and insight for key stakeholders within the company. They will be able to utilise our data stack and work with our Data Engineering team to ensure the Finance team‚Äôs needs are met and the quality of, and access to, our reporting is high.

The role will be fast paced and can include changing priorities due to the team‚Äôs needs.

What you'll do:


Work closely with the Finance teams to produce and maintain a series of key reports needed for Paddle‚Äôs financial reporting
Work on scoped briefs under the guidance of the Finance Operations Manager and other Finance Managers
Be able to build, and work with Data Engineering to build out the reporting infrastructure across our BI tools and data stack
Become a subject matter expert on Paddle financial data, and the tools we use.
Contribute to strategic planning by recognising areas of weakness or upcoming change, and efficiency improvements in our reporting across:
Global tax filings
Month end reporting across sales and revenue
Continually evolve our data collection, processing and reporting structures through scoping new tools and methods to help the Finance team support the wider business


We'd love to hear from you:


You have strong commercial experience in relational database structures, SQL, and Excel.
Experience with Pigment is a plus.
Working knowledge of Dbt and Snowflake is a plus.
You have experience working within a financial organisation or with finance teams
You have experience working with large data sets
You‚Äôre a great problem solver
You have strong data visualisation and presentation techniques.
You have exposure to BI and ETL tools, such as Sisense, Looker, Tableau and PowerBI.
Have experience in working for start ups / scale ups, or financial organisations, and can work in an unstructured environment


Everyone is welcome at Paddle

At Paddle, we‚Äôre committed to removing invisible barriers, both for our customers and within our own teams. We recognise and celebrate that every Paddler is unique and we welcome every individual perspective. As an inclusive employer, we don‚Äôt care if, or where, you studied, what you look like or where you‚Äôre from. We‚Äôre more interested in your craft, curiosity, passion for learning and what you‚Äôll add to our culture. We encourage you to apply even if you don‚Äôt match every part of the job ad, especially if you‚Äôre part of an underrepresented group.

Please let us know if there‚Äôs anything we can do to better support you through the application process and in the workplace. We will do everything we can to support any accommodations needed. We‚Äôre committed to building a diverse team where everyone feels safe to be their authentic self. Let‚Äôs grow together.

Why you‚Äôll love working at Paddle

We are a diverse, growing group of Paddlers across the globe who pride ourselves on our transparent, collaborative and respectful culture.

We live and breathe our values, which are:

Paddle For Others

Paddle together

Paddle simply

We offer a full suite of benefits, including attractive salaries, stock options, retirement plans, private healthcare and well-being initiatives.

We are a ‚Äòdigital-first‚Äô company, which means you can work remotely, from one of our stylish hubs, or even a bit of both! We offer all team members unlimited holidays and enhanced parental leave. We invest in learning and will help you with your personal development via constant exposure to new challenges, an annual learning fund, and regular internal and external training.

Title: BDO Static Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The BDO Static Data Analyst‚Äôs mission is to be responsible for the setup and maintenance of client database and ISIN database, in order to allow the integration of order received by the client. It is also a 1st level control for the trades monitoring and correcting any trade with errors

Your Main Activities Are


Ensure Integration and maintenance of clients‚Äô database (either manually or through support to the upload function)
Monitor error queues and trade recycling on a real time basis
Manage the Securities shared database
Mitigate risk exposure through a proper follow-up of procedures and alert/escalation mechanisms
Keep the Team Leader informed about the clients‚Äô activity and escalate issues whenever appropriate
Keep the procedures update
Ensure execution of tasks and complete checklist

Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree in Economics / Finance / Accounting or related
Up to 2 years of experience in Banking and Financial Operations or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in MS Office Pack (Excel, PowerPoint)
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Ability to share / pass on knowledge
Communication skills, both written and oral
Client focused

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Product Analyst
Description:
üè∑Ô∏èTitle: Product Analyst

üë´Department: RevOps

üìçLocation: UK or Europe, Remote

About Block Labs

Block Labs is a leading force in the Web3 space, incubating, investing in, and accelerating top-tier fintech, crypto and iGaming projects. With a mission to shape the future of decentralized technology, we partner with visionary startups to raise funding, refine product-market fit, and grow their audiences. Our diverse team drives innovation, using deep industry expertise and an extensive network to empower the next wave of blockchain-driven companies. At Block Labs, we‚Äôre passionate about turning bold ideas into breakthrough success.

We‚Äôre looking for a Product Analyst to join our growing team!

About The Role

As a Product Analyst, you'll play a critical role in leveraging data to drive insights, optimise user experience, and identify growth opportunities within our fintech and crypto projects. By delivering clear, data-backed recommendations, you will empower stakeholders to make impactful product decisions. In this role, you will analyse extensive datasets, map user journeys, and build actionable insights that inform key business strategies. You'll collaborate closely with product owners, developers, and other data teams to drive our product analytics efforts, from optimising data storage and retrieval processes to managing UAT testing to unearth issues not captured by data.

Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis:


Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights
Map out user experience patterns and conversion funnels
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to support business decision-making
Provide actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis


Product Analysis And Reporting


Identify growth opportunities by analysing user behaviour data
Define, calculate, and validate product metrics to measure the success of new features
Generate hypotheses and conduct A/B test to achieve improvements in user experience and conversion funnels
Collaborate closely with product managers and developers, overseeing A/B tests from experiment design to result interpretation
Conduct competitive analysis to benchmark against industry standards and identify growth opportunities
Presenting findings to stakeholders and consult with insights regularly


User Acceptance Testing (UAT)


Define acceptance criteria: Clearly outline what constitutes "acceptance" of the system.
Prepare test scenarios: Based on real-world use cases to validate critical workflows.
Plan the test: Set up timelines, resources, and tools for UAT.
Execute testing: End-users test the system and provide feedback.
Report issues: Document bugs, gaps, or usability concerns


Data Management


Ensure data integrity and accuracy by implementing best practices in data collection and analysis
Work with Product and data teams to optimise data storage and retrieval processes


Communication


Present findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Translate complex data into understandable and actionable business terms
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support initiatives with data-driven insights


About You


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field. Advanced degree (Master‚Äôs or Ph.D.) is a plus
Proven experience as a Product Analyst or similar role
Proficiency in SQL (window functions, data joins from various databases, CTEs, data marts experience)
Experience in conducting A/B tests with conversion, quantitative, and ratio metrics
Experience with onboarding processes and activation conversion metrics
Sharp presentation skills, fact based and data driven in house consultancy
Experience with BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, Amplitude, Singular, Looker, or similar
Experience in the crypto or FinTech industry is highly desirable
Optional: Proficiency in Python (pandas, seaborn, sklearn, scipy)
