About Block Labs

Block Labs is a leading force in the Web3 space, incubating, investing in, and accelerating top-tier fintech, crypto and iGaming projects. With a mission to shape the future of decentralized technology, we partner with visionary startups to raise funding, refine product-market fit, and grow their audiences. Our diverse team drives innovation, using deep industry expertise and an extensive network to empower the next wave of blockchain-driven companies. At Block Labs, we‚Äôre passionate about turning bold ideas into breakthrough success.

We‚Äôre looking for a Product Analyst to join our growing team!

About The Role

As a Product Analyst, you'll play a critical role in leveraging data to drive insights, optimise user experience, and identify growth opportunities within our fintech and crypto projects. By delivering clear, data-backed recommendations, you will empower stakeholders to make impactful product decisions. In this role, you will analyse extensive datasets, map user journeys, and build actionable insights that inform key business strategies. You'll collaborate closely with product owners, developers, and other data teams to drive our product analytics efforts, from optimising data storage and retrieval processes to managing UAT testing to unearth issues not captured by data.

Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis:

  • Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights
  • Map out user experience patterns and conversion funnels
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to support business decision-making
  • Provide actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis

Product Analysis And Reporting

  • Identify growth opportunities by analysing user behaviour data
  • Define, calculate, and validate product metrics to measure the success of new features
  • Generate hypotheses and conduct A/B test to achieve improvements in user experience and conversion funnels
  • Collaborate closely with product managers and developers, overseeing A/B tests from experiment design to result interpretation
  • Conduct competitive analysis to benchmark against industry standards and identify growth opportunities
  • Presenting findings to stakeholders and consult with insights regularly

User Acceptance Testing (UAT)

  • Define acceptance criteria: Clearly outline what constitutes "acceptance" of the system.
  • Prepare test scenarios: Based on real-world use cases to validate critical workflows.
  • Plan the test: Set up timelines, resources, and tools for UAT.
  • Execute testing: End-users test the system and provide feedback.
  • Report issues: Document bugs, gaps, or usability concerns

Data Management

  • Ensure data integrity and accuracy by implementing best practices in data collection and analysis
  • Work with Product and data teams to optimise data storage and retrieval processes

Communication

  • Present findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
  • Translate complex data into understandable and actionable business terms
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support initiatives with data-driven insights

About You

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field. Advanced degree (Master‚Äôs or Ph.D.) is a plus
  • Proven experience as a Product Analyst or similar role
  • Proficiency in SQL (window functions, data joins from various databases, CTEs, data marts experience)
  • Experience in conducting A/B tests with conversion, quantitative, and ratio metrics
  • Experience with onboarding processes and activation conversion metrics
  • Sharp presentation skills, fact based and data driven in house consultancy
  • Experience with BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, Amplitude, Singular, Looker, or similar
  • Experience in the crypto or FinTech industry is highly desirable
  • Optional: Proficiency in Python (pandas, seaborn, sklearn, scipy)

Title: Business, Data Analytics and Insights Senior Associate
Description:
Join our team at AMGEN Capability Center Portugal, number 1 company in Best Workplaces - https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/ - ranking in

Portugal (category 201-500 employees) by the Great Place to Work Institute. We have a team of over 300 talented people and more than 35

different nationalities, diverse areas of expertise and professional experience that are shaping the future of healthcare. This is your chance to

explore a world of opportunities in different areas such as Cybersecurity, Data & Analytics, Digital, Technology and Innovation, Finance,

General & Admin, Human Resources, Regulatory Affairs and many more. In Lisbon's city center, our AMGEN office fosters innovation,

excellence, and inspiration. Come thrive with us at AMGEN, supporting our mission To Serve Patients. What we do at AMGEN matters in

people‚Äôs lives.

Senior Associate Field Excellence

LIVE

What You Will Do

You, as our Senior Associate Field Excellence will support the delivery of day to day D&A activities and delivery of sales and activities data to the country teams. The responsibilities include development and maintenance of data model and reporting in Tableau, resource planning and business analysis, performance tracking and monitoring, territory management and data quality and support for the wider business Units within ACCP and Amgen.

Some of the tasks related to that are:


Maintaining internal databases (master data, data validation, etc.)
Developing new and existing data models that are tailored to create insights about the sales of Amgen‚Äôs products.
Using reporting and data visualization tools (Tableau) to develop new and maintain existing reporting dashboards and to deliver insight and drive action for the affiliate teams
Build data governance with scalable processes, refresh scheduling, security, and monitoring of report quality
Providing training and support on the internal CRM system.
Providing support on Plan of Action (POA) and SIP (Sales Incentive Plan) processes.
Support on capacity calculation and territories
Write Technical documentation of data models and applications
Field force sizing, targeting and efficacy/effectiveness
Supporting ACCP continuous improvement activities.
Supporting wider business units on an ad hoc basis (Finance/FP&A/Business Enablement).


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


University Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Business, Healthcare or Data
3+ years‚Äô experience with reporting / data analyst / data integration role with increasing responsibilities and scope
Providing support on the internal CRM system
Strong knowledge of MS Office tools (Excel and PPT)
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication
Consistent track record of achieving desired results
Persuasive, resilient and problem solver
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Some knowledge of Tableau or other similar BI tool
Medium knowledge of SQL


Preferred Requirements:


Working knowledge of IS systems (including demonstrated capability of Excel and other MS Office applications, VBA).
Demonstrates a service-minded attitude.
Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry.


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
A diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth, and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

CAREERS.AMGEN.COM

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Financial Resources Data Analyst
Description:
Keywords: Capital Markets, Risk Management, Trading Risk, Equities, Fixed Income, Currencies and Commodities, Data Analytics

About The Job

The Financial Resources Analytics is accountable for delivering excellence in all trading risk strategy activities we lead or oversee. This includes ensuring that these activities align with the Bank's objectives, client goals, approved risk appetites, and strategic priorities.

Your Main Activities Are


Assess and challenge the allocation and management of Risk and Resources (R&R) by the Business Lines (FICC) to ensure a strategic optimization of returns
Analyse Risk measures linked to capital consumption of Bank activities and ensure that return is optimised for capital allocation
Comply with all legal and regulatory requirements, and anticipate/ plan future regulatory changes, in relation to R&R management and capital allocation
Propose and implement solutions to facilitate new trades when BNPP‚Äôs risk appetite is reached
Identify and suggest innovative ideas to improve the Bank‚Äôs risk processes and reduce inaccuracies
Understand and monitor the main characteristics and concentrations of the risk portfolio managed by the team
Prepare periodic and ad-hoc reports on individual counterparties, sectors and/ or country crisis
Contribute to the reporting of the main risks and stress-tests across Global Markets
Maintain, improve and develop a toolbox for efficient risk management


Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Financial Mathematics or Engineering
Interest in Financial Markets
Expertise with data analysis‚Äì Python, VBA and SQL (Strongly referred)
Ability to provide clear and concise analysis
Process oriented with a problem-solving mindset
Curiosity, Attention to detail and Autonomy
Ability to communicate clearly ‚Äì both oral and written forms
Fluency in English
Structured, methodical and organized approach to work


About The Team

The Global Equities and Fixed Income Currencies and Commodities (FICC) Trading Risk Strategy (TRS) Team is responsible for managing trading positions' risk and returns. To achieve this, we oversee the daily production of key position reports and stress tests for trading desks, as well as a weekly in-depth review of positions and Profit/ Loss (P&L) performance. Additionally, we participate in ad-hoc studies and deep dives to assess specific portfolio risks and expected returns, upon request.

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Quality - Analyst
Description:
iCapital is powering the world‚Äôs alternative investment marketplace. Our financial technology platform has transformed how advisors, wealth management firms, asset managers, and banks evaluate and recommend bespoke public and private market strategies for their high-net-worth clients. iCapital services approximately $191billion in global client assets invested in 1,504 funds, as of May 2024.

iCapital has been named to the Forbes Fintech 50 for six consecutive years (2018 ‚Äì 2023); a three-time selection by Forbes to its list of Best Startup Employers (2021-2023); and a three-time winner of MMI/Barron‚Äôs Solutions Provider award (See link below).

iCapital is seeking a Data Quality Analyst to support the Firm‚Äôs growing day to day needs around data management as well as expanding initiatives to enhance the customer experience of our data systems. You will be responsible for providing legal data extraction support in the context of reviewing and analysing Limited Partnership Agreements (LPAs), Fact Sheets, Fund Prospectus, Private Placement Memorandum (PPM other documents related fund documents.

The ideal candidate should be excited and invested in ensuring business and client expectations are met and even exceeded, be willing to share innovative ideas on how to improve existing processes/procedures and embrace a collaborative, multi-disciplinary team in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities


Work alongside colleagues across a variety of functional teams to ensure accuracy and completeness of critical data elements within the Fund‚Äôs Global Data Master (‚ÄúGDM‚Äù)
Liaise with key stakeholders and extract key legal and economic terms from funds documents (PPMs, Fund Prospectus, LPAs, Fact Sheets) for relevant data points to be entered into GDM
Assist in the creation of business rules to monitor quality of the master data
Work with the manager to obtain necessary documents to support data extraction
Identify data cleansing opportunities
Collaboration with team members to achieve the teams‚Äô goals


Qualifications


Ability to manage workload independently within a predetermined timeline and communicate quickly when extension may be required.
Great interpersonal skills (both verbally and in writing)
Able to understand and summarize key terms in complex and lengthy fund documents
Critical attention to detail when extracting key terms from fund documents
2+ years of relevant experience in the financial industry or related role
Degree in law or finance is preferred
Previous experience master data management professional is a plus
Experience with SQL is a plus
Knowledge and skill with Microsoft Office Suite.


Benefits

iCapital offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes a total compensation program consisting of competitive salary, annual performance bonus, and equity for all full-time employees; healthcare with 100% employer-paid health and dental insurance; and generous paid time off (PTO).

For additional information on iCapital Network, please visit https://www.icapitalnetwork.com/about-us Twitter: @icapitalnetwork | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/icapital-network-inc

Title: Head of Business Intelligence, Poker
Description:
Title: Head of Business Intelligence

Department: Data

Location: Europe, Remote

About Block Labs

Block Labs is a leading force in the Web3 space, incubating, investing in, and accelerating top-tier fintech, crypto and iGaming projects. With a mission to shape the future of decentralized technology, we partner with visionary startups to raise funding, refine product-market fit, and grow their audiences.

As we continue to grow we are now looking for an ambitious and self-driven Head of Business Intelligence to join our rapidly growing team!

About The Role

We are seeking an experienced and strategic leader to shape the way we see crypto poker. As the Head of Business Intelligence, you will drive the organization‚Äôs data strategy, transforming data into actionable insights to support key business decisions. This role involves optimizing data processes, and leveraging advanced analytics to identify growth opportunities, improve operational efficiency, and enhance overall performance. If you thrive in a data-driven environment and are passionate about influencing business success through analytics, this is the role for you.

Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis and Reporting:


Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights
Develop and maintain BI dashboards and reports to support business decision-making
Provide actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis


Poker-Specific Insights


Utilise your poker experience to analyse game performance and player behaviour
Assess the impact of game features, promotions, and marketing campaigns on player engagement and revenue
Identify opportunities for optimising game mechanics and user experience and revenue
Conduct competitive analysis to benchmark against industry standards and identify growth opportunities


Data Management


Ensure data integrity and accuracy by implementing best practices in data collection and analysis
Work with Product and data teams to optimise data storage and retrieval processes


Communication


Present findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Translate complex data into understandable and actionable business terms
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support initiatives with data-driven insights


Highly Desired Knowledge And Experience


Experience in Poker: Experience in the gaming industry is highly desirable, preferably poker


About You


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.Advanced degree (Master‚Äôs or Ph.D.) is a plus
Proven experience as a BI Analyst or similar role
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, Node JS , or similar
Experience with BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, Amplitude, SingularLooker, or similar

About Block Labs

Block Labs is a leading force in the Web3 space, incubating, investing in, and accelerating top-tier fintech, crypto and iGaming projects. With a mission to shape the future of decentralized technology, we partner with visionary startups to raise funding, refine product-market fit, and grow their audiences.

As we continue to grow we are now looking for an ambitious and self-driven Head of Business Intelligence to join our rapidly growing team!

About The Role

We are seeking an experienced and strategic leader to shape the way we see crypto poker. As the Head of Business Intelligence, you will drive the organization‚Äôs data strategy, transforming data into actionable insights to support key business decisions. This role involves optimizing data processes, and leveraging advanced analytics to identify growth opportunities, improve operational efficiency, and enhance overall performance. Data Analysis and Reporting:

Communication

Highly Desired Knowledge And Experience

  • Experience in Poker: Experience in the gaming industry is highly desirable, preferably poker

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.Advanced degree (Master‚Äôs or Ph.D.) is a plus

  • Experience in the gaming industry is highly desirable; Poker and Casino

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to revolutionise the world with TEKEVER? üöÄüåç

Join us, the European leader in unmanned technology, where cutting-edge advancements meet unparalleled innovation. We offer a unique surveillance-as-a-service solution that provides real-time intelligence, enhancing maritime safety and saving lives. TEKEVER is setting new standards in intelligence services, data and AI technologies.

Become part of a dynamic team transforming maritime surveillance and making a significant impact on global safety. üåê

At TEKEVER, our mission is to provide limitless support through mission-oriented game-changers, delivering the right information at the right time to facilitate critical decisions.

If you‚Äôre passionate about technology and eager to shape the future, TEKEVER is the place for you! üëáüèªüéØ

Job Overview

As a Data Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing, building and maintaining the data pipelines and systems that support our data-driven initiatives, as well as supporting the evolution of our Data & Analytics Platform. You will work closely with data scientists, analysts and other stakeholders to ensure that our data & AI infrastructure is robust, scalable and efficient. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, with experience in data integration, ETL processes, database management and Data & Analytics Platform development.

What Will Be Your Responsibilities


Data Pipeline Development: Design, develop and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines to collect, process and store large volumes of data from various sources.
ETL Processes: Implement ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data is accurately and efficiently transformed and loaded into data storage systems.
Database Management: Manage and optimize databases and data warehouses to ensure data integrity, performance and availability.
Data Integration: Integrate data from multiple sources, including APIs, databases and external data providers, to create unified datasets for analysis.
Data & Analytics Platform development & expansion: support the expansion of our Data & Analytics Platform.
Data Quality Assurance: Implement data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure the accuracy and consistency of data.
Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide the necessary data infrastructure and support.
Performance Optimization: Monitor and optimize the performance of data pipelines and databases to ensure efficient data processing and retrieval.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data pipelines, ETL processes and database schemas.


Profile And Requirements


Education: Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field.
Experience: 3+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar role.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Experience with SQL and database management systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server).
Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data warehousing solutions (e.g., Redshift, Snowflake).
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their data services, with a focus on Google Cloud. Google Cloud certification is preferred.
Knowledge of data integration tools and frameworks (e.g., Apache Nifi, Talend, Informatica).
Experience with data modeling and schema design.
Experience with Iaac (e.g. Ansible, Terraform), data pipeline orchestration (e.g. Airflow), log exploration tools (e.g. Streamlit, Dash), data extraction (e.g. PostGIS, Kafka, Airflow, FastAPI), pandas, scikit-learn, Docker.
Basic understanding of DevOps best practices and tools: GIT, CI/CD, telemetry and monitoring, etc.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering scalable and efficient data solutions.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Attention to Detail: High attention to detail and a commitment to ensuring data quality and accuracy.
Adaptability: Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.

What We Have To Offer You


An excellent work environment and an opportunity to create a real impact in the world;
A truly high-tech, state-of-the-art engineering company with flat structure and no politics;
Working with the very latest technologies in Data & AI, including Edge AI, Swarming - both within our software platforms and within our embedded on-board systems;
Flexible work arrangements;
Professional development opportunities;
Collaborative and inclusive work environment;
Salary compatible with the level of proven experience.


Do you want to know more about us ?

Visit our LinkedIn page at https://www.linkedin.com/company/tekever/

Title: Capital Portfolio Management Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Resource & Portfolio Management (RPM) Team is part of the Securitised Product Group (SPG), which combines all securitisation and other risk distribution activities within Global Banking EMEA ‚Äì Capital Markets
The Securitisation Trade Manager is responsible for the booking of transactions and the management of their cash flows (calculation, monitoring of payments, etc.) and for their correct regulatory Capital calculation in the systems, to achieve optimum Capital savings for the bank
Acting as a point of contact with investors during the life of the transaction, as well as for regulatory reporting, the Securitisation Trade Manager will develop expertise in transaction management (Securitisation, SRT, Credit Default Swap, Credit Insurance) and most importantly in regulatory Capital of the Bank
The Candidate will work with data to assess the Capital savings on the transactions under management and should have an interest in learning Python/SQL languages. The Candidate will also be key to ensure that all the contractual commitments related to Resources & Portfolio Management transactions are fulfilled


Your Main Activities Are


Advisory role in pre-trade phase by actively liaising with the Origination and Structuring team, to assess the feasibility of a transaction
Booking of transactions in Front-Office systems
Perform monitoring and payment of invoices to Third Parties (Investors, Brokers and Insurers)
Calculate the correct Capital savings by ensuring the right Risk-Weighted Assets (RWA) are calculated during the quarterly Capital process
Perform quarterly updates of the capital structure of existing programs and quarterly coupon computation and validation, following instructions of underlying flow of funds
Identify claims based on rating triggers in underlying portfolios
Perform reporting to Validation Agent, Investors, Regulators, and internal stakeholders, acting as a point of contact for questions related to existing portfolios


Profile And Skills To Success


Master's degree in Engineering, Finance, Maths or Economics
Up to 3 years of relevant experience
Interest in VBA, Python, or data analytics tools such as SQL
Fluency in English both oral and written (mandatory)
Advanced knowledge of Office package (Excel)


#Hybrid

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Production Support Data Analyst
HTML:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we‚Äôre able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Essential Skills

  • At least 3 years experience in a similar role;
  • 2 years' experience in the field of insurance policies and claims;
  • Advanced SQL skills;
  • Strong knowledge of data storage concepts and structures, ETL and BI architecture;
  • Proven experience in RDBMS platforms for creating DDL;
  • Good knowledge of English.

Title: Reporting Specialist - Lisbon, Portugal
Description:
Come and work with us.

We are looking for a talented and accomplished Reporting Specialist to join our team. The purpose of this role is to directly assist the reporting team by collecting and reporting all KPIs data from Foundever Operations, Supporting Departments and Leadership.

As a Reporting Specialist, Your Daily Responsibilities Will Include


Under limited supervision, prepare and maintain databases & statistical reports used in financial/quality/performance management decision-making.
Investigate and analyze data and decide upon alternatives to complete assignments.
Assemble and assess statistical information from system databases and other sources.
Independently plan, prepare and maintain business unit reports critical to organizational success/profitability and meeting client expectations.
Investigate, analyze and assess trends and campaign/brand activity.
Monitor, evaluate and assess unit productivity on a daily basis.
Communicate with the manager on a daily basis to resolve problems/issues, assess scores/trends and maximize efficiency.
Additional operations support duties as assigned.
Creation of ‚Äúad hoc‚Äù reports under short timelines
Takes personal responsibility to understand and comply with all company and client security requirements and policies.


To succeed in the role, you will need to have:


English advanced level (mandatory)
Proficiency in Italian, French, Spanish, German, or others (preferred)
Strong computer, communication and analytical skills.
Strong knowledge Microsoft Excel
Microsoft Access/Database skills appreciated
Power BI experience is highly valued
VBA knowledge/experience is highly valued
SQL knowledge/experience is highly valued
SAP Business Objects knowledge/experience highly valued
Data Architecture knowledge/experience is highly valued
Ability to collect and assess large sets of data, dashboard creation and KPI evaluation.
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Ability to work with minimal supervision, make independent decisions and solve complex problems
Strong understanding of the call center industry and operations,
Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment,
Demonstrated ability to develop professional relationships and interact with all levels of internal and external clients.
Solution driven mindset
Availability to work from our site in Santos (mandatory)
Must hold EU citizenship or valid work permit for Portugal
Be a local candidate or willing to relocate to Lisbon, Portugal


Education And Experience.


Minimum 1 year experience in a Reporting/WFM role or experience in leadership in a contact center environment


Benefits.


Competitive wages
Paid professional training
Employee discounts
Private healthcare & dental insurance (after six months of employment)
Growth opportunities through various development programs
Fun and engaging company-wide initiatives, including our EverBetter wellness program
Job stability
Life-long skills and experience
Excellent work culture


Go further with Foundever‚Ñ¢

We believe in memorable associate experiences. Here, you can improve your quality of life and grow your career.‚ÄØ

Apply today!

Title: Technology New Joiners
Description:
At PwC, a career in our Technology practices will provide you with the opportunity to help clients seize essential advantages by working alongside business leaders to solve their toughest problems and capture their greatest opportunities. We work with some of the world‚Äôs largest and most complex companies to understand their unique business issues and opportunities in an ever-changing environment.

The role

Skills

As a Technology New Joiner, you‚Äôll immerse yourself in a dynamic and supportive environment where learning and growth are key. You‚Äôll have the chance to develop your skills, broaden your knowledge, and gain valuable insights into how technology shapes businesses. You will collaborate with experienced professionals and contribute to impactful initiatives that drive innovation and transformation. Our main practices include, but are not limited to:


Cloud Infrastructure
Software Engineering
Data Analytics
Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
ERP‚Äôs and CRM‚Äôs


Your profile


You completed your degree in informatics, engineering, data science or a related field
You are curious, adaptable, and eager to learn
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills
You communicate effectively and work well in a team environment
You have full working proficiency in English (additional languages are a plus)


We believe you have what it takes. Are you ready to join our ‚Äúcommunity of solvers‚Äù?

Be a part of The New Equation

Title: CRM Executive - Budget & Performance
Description:
We are Kaizen Gaming

Kaizen Gaming, the team powering Betano, is one of the biggest GameTech companies in the world, operating in 17 markets.

We always aim to leverage cutting-edge technology, providing the best experience to our millions of customers who trust us for their entertainment.

We are a diverse team of more than 2.700 Kaizeners, from 40+ nationalities spreading across 3 continents. Our #oneteam is proud to be among the Best Workplaces in Europe and certified Great Place to Work across our offices. Here, there‚Äôll be no average day for you. Ready to Press Play on Potential?

Let‚Äôs start with the role

Join Kaizen as a CRM Executive, Budget and Performance and leverage your data analysis expertise to drive impactful customer engagement strategies. In this role, you‚Äôll support senior leaders in optimizing CRM initiatives, tracking campaign performance, and delivering actionable insights to enhance customer acquisition and retention. If you‚Äôre passionate about turning data into results and thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, this is the perfect opportunity to make a meaningful impact.

As a CRM Executive, Budget and Performance you will:


Take ownership on reporting datasets of all CRM KPIs and promotional campaigns, ensuring alignment with company objectives and delivering actionable insights to empower Senior Management in decision-making and performance optimization.
Partner with Senior Managers and all other relevant CRM stakeholders to uncover customer insights and recommend strategies to boost campaign effectiveness and customer satisfaction.


What you'll bring:


Proficient in analyzing complex datasets using tools like Excel and other analytic platforms to drive data-driven decision-making.
AnvEffective communicator who translates data insights into clear, stakeholder-friendly messages.
Strong organizational skills with a keen eye for detail, capable of managing multiple tasks and ensuring accuracy in reporting.


What Success Looks Like:


Consistently deliver accurate, data-driven reports and collaborate seamlessly with CRM and Commercial teams to ensure up-to-date performance tracking, driving cost-effective CRM actions that prioritize customer satisfaction and align with customer preferences.


Kaizen Gaming Perks

Title: Client Development Data Analyst (Fixed term)
Description:
Your Main Activities Are


To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends throught what data can tell
As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team. Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understading their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation). You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving skills
You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analysing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic solutions
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholders‚Äô needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis to our stakeholders.
You must be prepared for routine changes, each day will be filled with new and excited challenges


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Availability to work in the hybrid model or in person in the Lisbon or Porto office
Experience with SQL
Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Fluency in written and spoken English
Ability to analyse, synthetize and simplify.
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
Knowledge in Tableau, Power BI, Power Query and DAX is a plus


About The Team

The Client Development team supports Global & Regional Sales, and Trading and M360 Heads in driving steady increases of wallet shares and client profitability with target clients, through client forums, client prioritization, client planning and survey intelligence.

The Client Development Team Ensures


Analysis of internal and external data to identify business growth opportunities
Ensure we are delivering on our KPIs to support the client strategy and roadmap
Support to team specialists in London, New York and Hong Kong to be more rigorous on the sales process globally, providing all the necessary information and tools to drive accurate business decisions
Promotion and contribution to report automation for a greater level of client intelligence and information-sharing
Data accuracy and integrity across multiple data streams and dashboards


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Machine Learning Researcher | IS Team (Job Ref.: AICOS_Jobs_2025_03) | Lisboa, Portugal
HTML:
Job Title: ML Researcher

Job Ref: AICOS_Jobs_2025_03

Job Type: Full-time contract.

Job Location: Lisbon, Portugal.

Job Description And Responsibilities

Fraunhofer Portugal AICOS is seeking a talented entry-level Machine Learning Researcher to join our dynamic and multidisciplinary team within the Intelligent Systems group. In this role, you will be at the forefront of technological innovation, working on applied research projects that bridge the gap between cutting-edge research and real-world impact. You will contribute to initiatives that enhance industries, promote social well-being, and improve quality of life. Specifically, you will contribute to the research and development of methodologies to improve the privacy and robustness of ML models.

Your Role

  • Synthetic Data Generation:

> Research and develop methods for generating synthetic data across one or multiple modalities;

> Explore the use of synthetic data for various applications, including healthcare and general-purpose domains;

> Investigate how synthetic data can enhance privacy and improve model robustness in different scenarios;

> Design and implement evaluation frameworks to assess the quality of synthetic data and its suitability for real-world use cases.

  • Data & Model Auditing:

> Evaluate data quality (including real-world and synthetic data) and model performance, identifying potential gaps or vulnerabilities;

> Integrate synthetic data into auditing workflows, determining where it can (and cannot) be an asset;

> Develop transparent reporting mechanisms, such as data and model cards, to communicate findings effectively and guide decision-making.

  • Collaboration and Maintenance:

> Work closely with multidisciplinary teams to integrate synthetic data strategies into existing pipelines and platforms;

> Maintain and refine current codebases, adhering to best practices in software development and reproducible research;

> Contribute to strategic discussions on advancing research directions, staying updated on cutting-edge ML methods related to synthetic data and model auditing methodologies.

Your Profile

  • Academic Qualifications: Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent qualifications in Biomedical Engineering.
  • Technical Skills:

> Programming proficiency in Python and experience with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow;

> Generative Models: Experience with GANs, VAEs, diffusion models, or other generative architectures;

> Evaluation of Synthetic Data: Understanding of metrics and methods to measure fidelity, privacy, and robustness of synthetic datasets.

  • Other skills:

> Excellent English communication skills (technical and general audiences);

> Capacity to translate research findings into actionable insights for real-world applications.

We Value

  • Familiarity with biosignals, time series is a plus;
  • Experience or interest in advancing robust ML solutions that maintain performance under diverse and challenging conditions;
  • Commitment to clear and honest communication of data and model limitations using established reporting standards and tools;
  • A track record (or strong desire) for academic or industrial research, with publications or demonstrable project experience in ML;
  • Ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary and cross-functional teams;
  • Autonomous, dependable, proactive, and a critical-thinking team player.

Why Should You Join Fraunhofer Portugal

  • Innovative Environment: Be part of a people-centric workplace that fosters creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. We encourage the development of new ideas and ensure that every voice is heard;
  • Research with Impact: Engage in projects that sit at the intersection of research and real-world applications, contributing to technology that makes a tangible difference in society;
  • Multidisciplinary Teams: Collaborate with professionals from diverse backgrounds, enhancing your learning and professional growth;
  • Professional Excellence: Work within a culture that upholds professional standards and best practices, promoting continuous improvement and excellence in research;
  • Flexible Work Arrangements: Benefit from flexible working hours and opportunities to work from home, supporting a healthy work-life balance;
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Benefit from a partially funded health insurance plan, and a variety of additional perks;
  • Supportive Culture: Join a team with an excellent spirit, where collaboration, mutual support, and team achievements are celebrated.

Application Process

Applications are permanently open until the ideal candidate is selected. The first evaluation of applications will occur on 10th of February 2025.

The selected candidate is expected to start working in March 2025.

Applications must be made to the email jobs@fraunhofer.pt and contain:

  • CV ‚Äì mandatory;
  • Motivation Letter;
  • Recommendation Letters are optional but also welcome.

Observation

The research activities in the scope of this job opportunity are planned to be developed within the framework of projects:

  • ACHILLES ‚Äì Human-centred Machine Learning: Lighter, Clearer, Safer, with Notice No. HORIZON-CL4-2024-DATA-01-01 and Project Reference No. 101189689;
  • AISym4Med ‚Äì Synthetic and Scalable Data Platform for Medical Empowered AI, with Notice No. HORIZON-HLTH-2022-IND-13-02 and Project Reference No.101095387;
  • MARTA ‚Äì Machine-learning Auditing for Robust and Transparent Administration, with Notice No. 04/C05-i08/2024;
  • NextGenAI ‚Äì Center for Responsible AI, with Notice No. 01/C05-i01/2021 and Project Reference No. 62 - C645008882-00000055.

Title: Data Understanding Specialist - (Third Party Associate) - Arabic Market- Portugal
Description:
Responsibilities

Important Note: Please be advised that this job posting is for informational purposes only. This is a 6 month temporary assignment managed by HYLegal. All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.

Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.

At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.

Join us.

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities


SOP Clarification and Training:
Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
Quality Improvement and Assurance:
Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
Project Management:
Ensure timely delivery of projects
Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data


Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience
Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment


Preferred Qualifications


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus

Title: Senior Data Analyst for Risk Anticipation
Description:
Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets we are leaders, and we bet on innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast growing business. In all markets, we value relationships, knowledge sharing and responsible action.

We are committed to promoting access to more responsible and sustainable consumption to support our customers and partners. To achieve this, we implement concrete actions, not only in the way we develop our business and enhance our sustainable growth, with the ambition to reduce our environmental footprint, but also in the way we support those who need it most.

BNPP Personal Finance is, by nature, exposed to Fraud, and relies heavily on quantitative models and strong analytics to manage it. Each day, millions of credit granting decisions are made, using hundreds of decision rules and models. The importance and complexity of these ecosystems at use within BNPP-PF keep on rising as the digital transformation accelerates.

In practice, your day-to-day


Risk Anticipation team is in charge of the IFRS9 provisioning calculation methodology and must ensure that the method is properly applied throughout the BNP Paribas Personal Finance perimeter.
The main role of the Risk Anticipation analyst is to ensure the correct level of provisioning for BNPP PF outstandings, and to ensure the correct application of the IFRS9 provisioning methodology throughout the scope of Personal Finance.
He is the direct international contact point for the local Risk teams.
The Risk Anticipation team is mainly located in Paris, and we are opening a new position in Lisbon.
The main activities will be:
Simulation of application of provisioning method on BNPP PF portfolios.
Developing mathematical language program models in SAS and Python.
Analyze the level of Risk of BNPP Portfolios through data at customer level.
Daily exchange with your colleagues in Paris.

The Mission is important, but so is the Team and the workplace!


Within BNP Paribas Personal Finance, Central Risk Department is responsible for the relevance of risk rating models used within all local entities and for maintaining a high level of expertise with integrating new statistical techniques in new modelling environments.
You will operate in a friendly and international work environment, designed to make the collaborating experience as pleasant as possible!
You will have regular exchanges with the Central (this will help to build up competence based on different cultures and levels of responsibility).
You will participate to projects and strategics activities, part of the Strategic Plan of BNPP PF.
The Risk Anticipation team is mainly located in Paris, you will be located in Lisbon and you will join the Credit Risk Optimization team in Lisbon and working on Risk Anticipation topics.


What do we have to offer you?


This is a very important topic that we will address together, taking into account your training and experience.


Are you the one we are looking for?


Have you a few experiences in Credit Risk Management, with mathematical/statistical background and a few years of successful experience, preference in a Bank, a financial environment, or a digital business?
Do you know Python or other database language (SAS, SQL)?
Do you have knowledge about IFRS9 norms standards? Or about IRB models (PD, EaD, LGD)?
Are you able to work on several projects at the same time and are known for your rigor?
Are you comfortable communicating orally and in writing with different interlocutors and sharing information?
Are you doing everything you can to achieve your goals?
Do you have a good knowledge in Excel and Power point?
Do you have important analytics & business skills as:
Applied Math and Algorithms
Data Processing, Data Knowledge
Descriptive Modelling and Predictive Modelling
Ability to understand, explain and support change
Analytical Ability
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
Ability to Synthetise/Simplify
Do you speak English? French is a plus.
If you have all this, a lot of desire, energy, and good mood, then you are the one we are looking for‚Ä¶
We look forward to your application!


Our commitments


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices
To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization


What makes us proud as reference employer?


Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year
92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)"
93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available
71% of our customers are promoters of our brand
Show more

Title: Data Engineer - Lisbon (Internal Team)
Description:
At Efficio, we're not just a consulting firm; we're a team of dedicated experts committed to transforming procurement and supply chain functions. Our mission is to drive sustainable, measurable value for our clients through innovative solutions and deep industry insights. Join us and be part of a dynamic environment where your skills and ideas make a real impact.

Efficio is the world‚Äôs largest specialist procurement and supply chain consultancy, with offices across Europe, North America, and the Middle East. We‚Äôre a diverse team of over 1,000 individuals, representing more than 60 different nationalities and speaking 40+ languages ‚Äì and we‚Äôre continuing to grow rapidly!

We believe we can make the world a better place by helping businesses buy better. Buying better isn't just about saving money; it's also helping businesses to make the world around them better by buying products and services that that are from green, ethical, sustainable, diverse and inclusive suppliers. At Efficio, we do that by being the world's largest procurement and supply chain consultancy firm. We also do that by combining our procurement expertise with our powerful technology and data to help our customers make better purchasing decisions. Data is a fundamental ingredient to that decision making process and we're now investing heavily in building our in-house data skills, expertise and infrastructure to rival the best in the world. So, if you'd like to make the world a better place by helping businesses buy better, apply here. Please note this role is a non-consulting position.

In this job you will develop and implement data pipelines on AWS, maintain and develop them further under guidance of business owners. You will work alongside Data Scientists, Data Engineers and others; integrated in our Product and Digital team. This role offers the chance to join Efficio at a pivotal point in our data journey, and to shape and influence our data landscape.

This role gives you the opportunity to:


Collect business requirements and translate them into robust and scalable solutions
Demonstrate an understanding of DataOps and develop use case agnostic ETL pipelines
Take a proactive approach to work and become a go-to expert for data cloud migration
Work with state-of-the-art tooling on AWS including Redshift, S3 and ECS
Collaborate with our infrastructure engineers to provision the next generation of tools
Develop a sense of ownership to deliver high quality outcomes for the business
Make complex data more accessible, understandable, and usable by the organisation


We'd love to hear about any additional skills or experiences you bring to the table. We're particularly interested in:


An advanced degree in software engineering, computer science, a related technical field, or relevant work experience
Proven experience in building robust and reliable data pipelines, dealing with a wide variety of data sources
Strong experience in Python, knowledge of data wrangling methodologies and common packages
Proficiency with AWS Tools (e.g., S3, Athena, Glue, Lamba, Kinesis) as well as AWS CI/CD and readiness to learn/work with them
Experience with Docker, Airflow, and SQLs (ideally Postgres)
Fundamental understanding of programming landscape (e.g., APIs, SQL, database management)
Great communication skills, comfortable working collaboratively in cross-functional teams
Ability to manage own workload with a customer focus and solution orientated can-do attitude
Show more

Title: Trainee Academy - Gen AI
HTML:
We are hiring recent graduates in Computer Enginnering!

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you‚Äôd like, where you‚Äôll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you‚Äôll be able to reimagine what‚Äôs possible. Join us and help the world‚Äôs leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

At this moment we are reinforcing our teams with IT Junior Profiles for our GenAI Academy in March 2025.

YOUR PROFILE

  • Recent bachelor's or master's graduate in Computer Engineering, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Artificial Intelligence or similar areas (mandatory);
  • Knowledge of Basic Programming (preferably python);
  • Understanding programming logic, algorithms and data structures:
  • Familiarity with Machine Learning or Data Science Concepts;
  • Ability to work with tools such as Jupyter Notebook, Git and libraries such as NumPy, Pandas Scikit-Learn (Valued but not required)
  • Fluent English proficiency (mandatory);
  • Strong analytical skills and Agile mindset.

What You'll Love About Working Here

  • An internship prepared to make you develop your skills;
  • The chance to work on interesting challenging projects for national and international clients, with senior guidance;
  • Great work environment aligned with our culture and organizational values;
  • Hybrid Work;
  • Training and certifications programs;
  • Upskill and reskill opportunities;
  • Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations;
  • Mentoring Program and Personal Development Plan;
  • Discounts on gym, restaurants, education, stores, travel agencies, health, beauty and well being and other partnerships;
  • Others.

About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of ‚Ç¨22.5 billion.

Title: ML/AI Intern
Description:
About TensorOps:



At TensorOps, we're at the forefront of AI innovation, transforming industries with groundbreaking solutions in traditional machine learning, Gen AI, AI agents, Ad Tech, Search, and Recommendation Systems. We empower both startups and established enterprises‚Äîfrom large public companies to digital-native early-movers‚Äîwith strategies that drive success. With a clientele that includes industry leaders like JFrog, Notion, MinuteMedia, and Clever Advertising, and trusted partnerships with Google Cloud and AWS, we are redefining what's possible in AI.

Your Role: AI/ML Engineer

As an AI/ML Engineer at TensorOps, you'll work on exciting, real-world projects that leverage the power of AI to solve complex problems. You'll join a team of forward-thinking experts, contributing to projects from ideation to deployment, and expanding your skills in a collaborative and innovative environment.

What You'll Do:


Develop & Implement Models: Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models and AI solutions that drive business impact.
Collaborative Engineering: Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and product teams to translate business requirements into technical specifications and innovative solutions.
Research & Innovation: Stay updated with the latest trends and research in AI/ML, applying new techniques to enhance our solutions.
Data Analysis: Analyze and process large datasets to extract valuable insights and drive data-driven decision-making.
Model Optimization: Continuously monitor, evaluate, and optimize model performance to ensure robust and scalable solutions.
Documentation: Maintain clear and concise documentation for models, methodologies, and processes.


Who We're Looking For:


Passionate Engineer: Up to 2 years of experience in AI/ML engineering, eager to learn and grow in a fast-paced tech environment.
Technical Proficiency: Solid foundation in programming languages such as Python, and familiarity with ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Problem Solver: Strong analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot issues and optimize algorithms.
Collaborative Mindset: Excellent communication skills and a team-oriented attitude to work effectively with diverse stakeholders.
Educational Background: A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field.


Why TensorOps?


Innovative Environment: Join a forward-thinking team that is pushing the boundaries of AI technology.
Remote Flexibility: Enjoy the benefits of remote work while collaborating with a dynamic team across Europe.
Competitive Benefits: Enjoy a range of employee-centric perks, including health and wellness programs (like a gym membership via Urban Sports Club), a monthly stipend in Bolt credits, and access to co-working spaces.
Growth & Learning: Thrive in a culture that values continuous learning, offering ample opportunities for professional development and innovation.


If you're ready to jump-start your career in AI/ML engineering and work on projects that make a real impact, we'd love to hear from you. Join us at TensorOps and help shape the future of AI innovation.

Apply Now!

HTML:
About TensorOps:



At TensorOps, we're at the forefront of AI innovation, transforming industries with groundbreaking solutions in traditional machine learning, Gen AI, AI agents, Ad Tech, Search, and Recommendation Systems. We empower both startups and established enterprises‚Äîfrom large public companies to digital-native early-movers‚Äîwith strategies that drive success. With a clientele that includes industry leaders like JFrog, Notion, MinuteMedia, and Clever Advertising, and trusted partnerships with Google Cloud and AWS, we are redefining what's possible in AI.

Your Role: AI/ML Engineer

As an AI/ML Engineer at TensorOps, you'll work on exciting, real-world projects that leverage the power of AI to solve complex problems. You'll join a team of forward-thinking experts, contributing to projects from ideation to deployment, and expanding your skills in a collaborative and innovative environment.

What You'll Do:

  • Develop & Implement Models: Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models and AI solutions that drive business impact.
  • Collaborative Engineering: Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and product teams to translate business requirements into technical specifications and innovative solutions.
  • Research & Innovation: Stay updated with the latest trends and research in AI/ML, applying new techniques to enhance our solutions.
  • Data Analysis: Analyze and process large datasets to extract valuable insights and drive data-driven decision-making.
  • Model Optimization: Continuously monitor, evaluate, and optimize model performance to ensure robust and scalable solutions.
  • Documentation: Maintain clear and concise documentation for models, methodologies, and processes.

Who We're Looking For:

  • Passionate Engineer: Up to 2 years of experience in AI/ML engineering, eager to learn and grow in a fast-paced tech environment.
  • Technical Proficiency: Solid foundation in programming languages such as Python, and familiarity with ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
  • Problem Solver: Strong analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot issues and optimize algorithms.
  • Collaborative Mindset: Excellent communication skills and a team-oriented attitude to work effectively with diverse stakeholders.
  • Educational Background: A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field.

Why TensorOps?

  • Innovative Environment: Join a forward-thinking team that is pushing the boundaries of AI technology.
  • Remote Flexibility: Enjoy the benefits of remote work while collaborating with a dynamic team across Europe.
  • Competitive Benefits: Enjoy a range of employee-centric perks, including health and wellness programs (like a gym membership via Urban Sports Club), a monthly stipend in Bolt credits, and access to co-working spaces.
  • Growth & Learning: Thrive in a culture that values continuous learning, offering ample opportunities for professional development and innovation.

If you're ready to jump-start your career in AI/ML engineering and work on projects that make a real impact, we'd love to hear from you. Join us at TensorOps and help shape the future of AI innovation.

Apply Now!

Title: Data Documentalist / Data Governance
Description:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we‚Äôre able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities


Support the build-up of Data Catalog, enhancing the completeness and accuracy of Data Dictionary, Business Glossary, Data Lineage, Data Classification and Governance.


Essential Skills


At least 5 years' experience in a similar role;
Experience of reading technical documentation for systems;
Experience of creating data dictionaries, business glossaries and data governance models;
Good knowledge of English.
