Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Semasio (a Samba TV Company) is a dynamic global company with access to the world's most progressive audiences and the most comprehensive contextual platform available. Our industry-leading advertising solutions are trusted by Fortune 500 companies and emerging brands to increase reach, boost efficiency, and maximize ROI.¬†Our team is global, located in the US, UK, Portugal, Germany and Denmark. We remain tight-knit across time zones through open communication and consistent collaboration. We care about cultivating an inclusive, approachable and ambitious culture while having fun along the way. We believe diversity fosters creativity, innovation and a sense of community.¬†Join us in our mission to lead the privacy-first performance revolution. If this sparks curiosity, then read on!

Semasio is a Unified Targeting provider that enables digital marketers to reach their target audience by seamlessly combining Audience and Contextual targeting. Our clients are leading global media agencies, brands and publishers, and we operate globally within the NAM, EMEA and APAC regions.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst- Solutions to join our dynamic team. This role will play a pivotal role in ensuring the successful implementation, optimization, and ongoing support of our ad tech solutions for clients across the EMEA, APAC, and NAM regions. This position requires a strong understanding of advertising technology, exceptional data analytics skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.




Day to Day:
Taxonomy Development and Optimization: Create accurate, scalable taxonomies and optimize Always-On offerings across markets for performance and reach.
Client Support and Relationship Management: Serve as the primary technical support contact for EMEA clients, including media agencies, trading desks, publishers, and advertisers. Build strong client relationships and provide training on the Semantic Targeting Platform.
Partner Collaboration and Platform Optimization: Collaborate with partners to clean up, deprecate, or enhance taxonomies. Maintain and optimize internal SaaS platforms and advise on external platforms like DSPs, SSPs, and Curate.
Data and Marketing Alignment: Act as a bridge between Data and Marketing teams to promote best-in-class segments and support seasonal and Always-On targets.
Market Analysis and Strategy: Conduct competitive and trend analyses, ensuring CPM competitiveness and proposing new strategies with partners, agencies, and sales.
Technical Assurance and Custom Solutions: Maintain technical stability, troubleshoot issues with Product and Engineering teams, and develop white-labeled partner solutions.
Innovation and Differentiation: Ensure data discoverability, understand data interactions with partner algorithms, and recommend tailored solutions to optimize advertising campaigns.
Reporting and Continuous Improvement: Collaborate on reporting and analysis to drive global optimization and platform enhancements.




Preferred Exerience:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Marketing, or related field
3-5 years of Technical Account, Data Analysis experience preferably in consulting and managing complex software solutions
Strong technical background with expertise in ad-serving platforms, programmatic advertising, data management platforms (DMPs), and related technologies
Experience or interest in the online marketing industry
Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills and¬† ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences effectively
Team player with a hands-on mentality and drive to learn and understand new topics
Sales and relationship-building skills¬†
Have an affinity for complex technical processes and tools
Offer a hands-on mentality and have the eagerness to understand new topics
Ideally, have gained first experiences in data-driven marketing or programmatic advertising
Speak and write English fluently







Semasio (a Samba TV company) is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.¬†¬†We strive to empower connection with one another, reflect the communities we serve, and tackle meaningful projects that make a real impact.

Samba TV may collect personal information directly from you, as a job applicant, Samba TV may also receive personal information from third parties, for example, in connection with a background, employment or reference check, in accordance with the applicable law.¬†For further details, please see Samba's¬†Applicant Privacy Policy.¬†For residents of the EU, Samba Inc. is the data controller.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!

We are a Portuguese technology consulting company with a strong outward look to the rest of Europe. We have 10 years of experience in the market and reached the status of ‚Äúlarge company‚Äù in 2018. We now have more than 350 associates and we keep growing, with offices in Lisbon, Porto, and Leiria, as well as projects in more than 20 countries. Our company is part of the national top 10, with a growth of 250% in the last years.




Work-life balance is part of our DNA. We focus on win-win-win relationships, defining every moment of interaction as an experience with unique conditions. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
EXPERIS, a Global Leader in Talent Management Solutions, is currently recruiting for the position of Data Analyst (Continuous improvement department), for Gestamp.




Gestamp is a Spanish Industrial Company, Global Leader in the design, development, and manufacturing of metal components for the Automotive Industry.




Listed on the stock exchange since 2017, Gestamp operates in 24 Countries with a workforce of over 45,000 employees. It boasts a diverse, committed, and entrepreneurial team that drives its rapid and sustainable growth.




Currently, Gestamp is establishing a new Shared Services Center for Procurement Management to serve all of Europe, in Porto (Maia). This center will be a strategic pillar for optimizing procurement operations and supplier management, improving efficienc and ensuring the quality of procurement processes with an end-to-end vision.




We are looking for a profile to develop the position of Continuous Improvement Specialist.

Their main responsibilities will involve driving process optimization and operational efficiency.




Main Information:

Proficiency in English (Mandatory)
Proficiency in other Languages (plus)
Knowledge of process automation, with a focus on improving business operations
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SAP, Excel, and Power BI
Collaborating with technical teams, particularly IT and development




The overview of the role involves identifying and proposing improvements in processes, ensuring optimal efficiency. This involves analyzing areas for improvement, designing and delivering training on tools, leading implementation tests to ensure the effectiveness of new processes and tools.




Hibrid Work Model (2 days Homeoffice/Week)




This is a new project that the company undertakes with great enthusiasm, seeking resolute, flexible, optimistic, and entrepreneurial individuals who enjoy the challenges and rewards of new beginnings. Gestamp is building the future of mobility and is looking for people to join this exciting challenge with their talent.




Are you up for the challenge?

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Porto (Hybrid work model - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

‚Ä¢ BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;

‚Ä¢ Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation (mandatory);

‚Ä¢ Experience in Alteryx and VBA;

‚Ä¢ Power BI Experience;

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of SQL (mandatory);

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies;

‚Ä¢ Fluent English (mandatory);

‚Ä¢ The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ü§îWho are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 10 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto and Casablanca. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

‚û° Quantitative Finance

‚û° Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

‚û° Operations and Finance

‚û° Transformation and Organization

‚û° Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of ‚Ç¨74.6 million.




üîéWe are looking for a Data Analyst.




MAIN TASKS:




Design and define data loading and transformation processes for ODS, Data Warehouse, and Data Mart.
Conduct rigorous testing during the acceptance phase.
Analyze and resolve data quality issues across the data supply chain.
Model data in SSAS tabular cubes and Power BI semantic models.
Ensure data integrity and security from source to integration.




YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:




Proficiency in Business Intelligence modeling (ODS, DWH, DTM)
Expertise in Oracle and SQL language
Experience in data modeling and preparation using SSAS (Visual Studio Professional)
Proficiency in Power BI
Advanced knowledge of DAX
Fluent in English.
Hybrid role based in Porto.







üöÄIf you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - BI
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Business Intelligence Analyst - BI

Seniority: Mid (3-5 years)

Type of position: Hybrid model in Oporto. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!

The amazing you, will have:


Previous experience (2 to 5 years) with Power BI and its advanced features;
Solid knowledge of SQL for queries, data manipulation and modeling;
Experience in dimensional and relational data modeling;
DAX proficiency for creating KPIs and custom metrics;
Knowledge of ETL tools, preferably Power Query;
Understanding of data governance and security concepts in BI;
Ability to work with large volumes of data and performance optimization;
Analytical skills and ability to tell stories with data;
Good communication and ability to interact with stakeholders from different areas;
English level C1.




Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!


Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal and external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholder


Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs degree in Information Technology and Computer Science, or Mathematics and Statistics
Up to 2 years of professional experience in data analytics
Proficiency in Data Viz Blending Analytics (Tableau and Power BI) as well as Database Management Microsoft SQL Server
Fluent in English, oral and written
Good communication skills
Analytical
Capable of synthetize and simplify
Able to deliver and results driven


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst (HYBRID @Porto)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: +3 years

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week in Porto)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Statistics or Mathematics;
3+ years of experience as Data Analyst;
Proficiency with ETL, SQL, PowerBI and Alteryx;
Experience with Jaspersoft, VBA, API, Python and Tibco Spotfire are nice to have;
Ability to perform database queries;
Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking skills;
Strong attention to detail and accuracy;
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment;
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal);
Fluency in English is mandatory.







To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

Comfort speaking French.




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!




Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Analyst - Finance
Description:
About Us

Planet is a leading technology company transforming payments by putting customer experience first.

We offer integrated solutions that include payment processing, VAT refunds, dynamic currency conversion, and management services for merchants in the Retail and Hospitality sectors worldwide.

In recent years, we have experienced significant growth, expanding our services and global presence.

With strong private equity investors, Advent International and Eurazeo, we have the financial capital and expertise to grow our capabilities and reach through acquisitions.

Our mission is to create a world of connected commerce where payments are simple, secure, and seamless, enabling our partners to deliver exceptional experiences to their customers.

Function Overview

Join our dynamic team as a Data Analyst - Finance, where you'll play a critical role in ensuring accurate commission payouts for a high-performing sales organization. You'll manage everything from commission calculations and reporting to troubleshooting and process improvements, all while collaborating closely with our Sales, Finance and Data teams. This role requires a blend of technical expertise in data engineering and in-depth knowledge of commission structures, ensuring accurate, efficient, and scalable solutions.

If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, have a passion for data accuracy, and enjoy identifying efficiencies, this role is your opportunity to make a meaningful impact. Bring your Excel skills, analytical mindset, and enthusiasm for teamwork to help us deliver exceptional results!

Administration

What you'll do


Responsible for all aspects of day-to-day commission administration resulting in accurate and timely commission payments.
Create, validate and audit monthly reports to ensure accuracy and completeness of commissions crediting and payout results.
Respond to compensation related inquiries from the Sales Team in an effective and timely manner.
Perform configuration, testing and other support activities related to plan, quota, and policy changes
Manage Sales Promotion, bonus and SPIFF payments.
Prepare key monthly commission reconciliation reports including reporting of monthly commission and sales attainment metrics.


Data Engineering And Modelling


Design and implement scalable solutions for the commission‚Äôs calculator, ensuring accurate processing of complex commission structures.
Build and maintain robust data pipelines and workflows to support real-time and batch processing of commission data.
Integrate data from multiple sources, such as Salesforce, Snowflake, and legacy systems, to ensure seamless commission calculations.
Develop and maintain data models that support the commission engine‚Äôs requirements.


Testing And Validation


Develop rigorous testing frameworks to validate the accuracy of commissions calculations.
Troubleshoot and resolve calculation and/or data errors.
Perform QA and troubleshoot discrepancies in commission results, implementing fixes as needed.
Governance and Collaboration:
Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards in all processes.
Create comprehensive documentation for the commission‚Äôs calculator, including workflows, data models, and calculation logic.
Work closely with Finance, Sales, and Data teams to understand commission structures and business requirements.
Collaborate with BI teams to deliver reporting solutions that provide clear visibility into commissions calculations and outcomes.


Governance And Collaboration


Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards in all processes.
Create comprehensive documentation for the commission‚Äôs calculator, including workflows, data models, and calculation logic.
Work closely with Finance, Sales, and Data teams to understand commission structures and business requirements.
Collaborate with BI teams to deliver reporting solutions that provide clear visibility into commissions calculations and outcomes.


Who You Are


Education: University educated in Business, Accounting or related field or equivalent work experience.
Commissions: 3+ years' experience in commission processing or business/finance analyst function for a high growth sales team, preferably in the payments or financial services industry.
PowerBI: Advanced expertise in PowerBI is essential, including experience with DAX, building automated reports, and creating complex, data-driven dashboards.
SQL: Strong proficiency in SQL, with experience working with large datasets in a cloud-based environment (Snowflake).
Data Modelling: Experience with data modelling and data pipeline processes (using dbt or equivalent).
Cloud Platforms: Experience with cloud data platforms (Snowflake, Azure as a plus).
ETL: Basic knowledge of ETL processes and experience working with data engineers to contribute to scalable solutions. Familiarity with GitHub for managing code and version control.
Azure: Experience with Azure cloud services.
Python (or Java): Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or Java for building and automating workflows.
Data Governance: Understanding of data governance and security best practices.
Excel: Advanced skills are a requirement.


Nice To Have


Commissions Software: Commission software experience is a plus (ie. Spiff, Xactly, etc.).
Certifications: certification in data engineering or analytics (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Data Engineer, AWS Certified Data Analytics).


Why Planet

Planet is an equal opportunity employer where diversity is valued, and all employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.

Come and grow your career in the most exciting, fast paced technology market, with a business that delivers feel-good connected commerce. We would love to hear from you ‚Äì Apply now.

At Planet, we embrace a hybrid work model, with three days a week in the office.

Reasonable accommodations may be made in order to allow for an individual to perform the essential functions of this role successfully.

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx)
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

This project is part of the business investment banking and financial services area, and currently has its technological hub in Porto and is working on the development of innovative solutions and support for all operations related to the business.

We are looking for a Data Analyst (Alteryx) to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid).

Requirements

  • Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;
  • Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation;
  • Proven experience in Alteryx and VBA;
  • Good Knowledge of SQL;
  • +2 years of experience with Alteryx;
  • Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required;
  • Good level of English (mandatory).

We Offer

  • Health insurance;
  • A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;
  • Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;
  • Remote onboarding process;
  • Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;
  • Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Apply

If the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate to apply here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.

Title: MDM Analyst
Description:
Job Purpose:




The MDM Analyst role will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of Master Data that is required for finance processes and is leveraged by cross-functional teams under RTR, PTP, OTC, FPA.

The role requires working closely with both Finance process users and everyday system users to create and maintain data at the expected service and quality levels. This role interacts with a wide range of internal stakeholders including other internal and external finance & non-finance teams, senior accountants, and local business finance leads. The role will support the business by understanding and implementing improvements, will assist standardization efforts, while moving towards to standard Manpower Group processes and procedures, supporting MDM Supervisors on improvements. Additionally, the MDM Analyst will work collaboratively with internal and cross-functional Manpower Group teams at various levels to fulfill responsibilities. This role requires strong understanding of Master Data Management processes.




Core Responsabilities:




Responsible for the day-to-day Financial Planning, Accounting, Customer, Supplier & Vendor Master Data.
Collate and action requests for data creation and maintenance.
Maintain chart of accounts (including GL, cost centers and entities), other accounting master data objects, customer records and contracts data.
Apply subject matter knowledge to improve Master Data Management processes including, but not limited to, maintenance of chart of accounts, setting up new customers in system, enabling customers and vendors on invoicing and procurement portals.
Perform Master Data tasks with accuracy and completeness, for example, to always enter and maintain complete and comprehensive details in the systems.
Continually own and maintain required standard data documentation.
Apply a degree of independent decision-making in dealing with complex business and/or technical issues.
Collaborate with cross-functionals teams across various levels including the BPO.
Establish stable working relationships within Master Data team and with other departments/team members to ensure smooth ways of working and delivery of Master Data activities.
Collaborate with Finance process owners to adapt best practices and standards.




Technical Competencies:




Experience in roles specifically covering MDM processes.
A basic knowledge and understanding of the mechanics in the MDM process stream and how these fit into the end-to-end financial process environment.
Strong grasp of basic accounting concepts and how MDM processes impact MPG‚Äôs working capital targets and financial performance.

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx)
HTML:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!


We are a Portuguese technology consulting company with a strong outward look to the rest of Europe. We have 10 years of experience in the market and reached the status of ‚Äúlarge company‚Äù in 2018. We now have more than 350 associates and we keep growing, with offices in Lisbon, Porto, and Leiria, as well as projects in more than 20 countries. Our company is part of the national top 10, with a growth of 250% in the last years.


Work-life balance is part of our DNA. We focus on win-win-win relationships, defining every moment of interaction as an experience with unique conditions. Working with Affinity is a ‚ÄúLifetime Experience‚Äù where you will have the opportunity to demonstrate all your potential and to be successful on every level.


#welcometoyourfuture


What you need to have/know:


  • Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;
  • Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation
  • Proven experience in Alteryx and VBA
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience with Alteryx.
  • Good Knowledge of SQL
  • Good level of English - minimum B2 (mandatory)


What we expect from you:


  • Will to exceed expectations (your own and the ones defined by Affinity);
  • Exceptional skills and the will to acquire more;
  • Good people skills (not just in terms of technology, language, and platforms), team spirit, and pleasant disposition;
  • Autonomy, proactivity, and focus (even under pressure);
  • Obsession for doing things right, and ability to prioritize;
  • Versatility (you can be a fan of BYOD or not);
  • Ability to innovate and evolve in a market in constant mutation.


What will encourage you


  • Being part of a company that has a disruptive action in the technology market;
  • Being part of a technology focused on relationships, simplicity, and efficiency;
  • Accessing a generative career directly proportional to your performance and interest;
  • The real possibility of being part of our company staff.

Title: Business Intelligence (Bi)
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:

DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress. We are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst! Mission: We are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst with intermediate experience to work on data extraction, modeling, analysis and visualization using the Microsoft stack. The professional will be responsible for developing interactive dashboards, generating strategic insights and supporting decision-making through reliable and well-structured data.

Title: BI Senior Consultant
HTML:
Retail Consult is recruiting!


The impact of technology in retail is a game changer affecting every retailer from small, local shops to retail giants. Working at Retail Consult means being at the center of this industry in transformation. As specialists in technology solutions for retail, we provide solutions strategy, implementation, deployment, training, and support services for clients across a range of retail segments including fashion, grocery, pharmacy, do it yourself, telecommunications, and electronics. Work, train and learn with a growing team with over 300 people based in Portugal, the US, Germany, Brazil, Mexico, Chile, and China, who are transforming the business of retailers across the globe.


We are currently seeking for a BI Senior Consultant to join our growing Delivery team in Porto, Portugal.


What we are offering:


  • The opportunity to join a growing company with people passionate about their work in an international environment;
  • The opportunity to work with best-in-breed methodologies, tools, and techniques;
  • Training and Mentoring/Talent Development programs;
  • Full package of Salary, perks, and benefits (Health Insurance, mobile allowance, and others);
  • Career Evolution;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Extra days off;
  • Wellbeing program;
  • Partnerships with local businesses.


What you‚Äôll be doing:


  • Play the role of lead Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant in projects focused on implementing Oracle Retail Insights and other BI solutions;
  • Guide clients in best practices for BI/Analytics implementation, ensuring efficient data strategies and reporting structures;
  • Act as a System Integrator (SI), overseeing the successful deployment and integration of BI solutions with existing systems architecture;
  • Participate in business process analysis to understand end-user needs and define optimal BI architectures and workflows;
  • Provide leadership and training to end-users, ensuring clients maximize the value of BI tools;
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to define and document business requirements, technical specifications, and solution roadmaps;


What we are looking for:


  • Proven experience in BI and Analytics best practices;
  • Experience as a System Integrator (SI) in BI implementations;
  • Strong ability to guide and support clients in the use and adoption of BI platforms;
  • Exposure to and understanding of business processes supported by BI/Analytics solutions;
  • Availability to travel;
  • Excellent communication skills in English.


What would be a plus:


  • Degree in Business, Management, or Engineering-related fields;
  • Experience with Oracle Retail Insights;
  • Knowledge in Oracle BI Cloud stack;
  • Proficiency in Spanish, French or German.


If you think your profile matches our requirements and you are looking for an experience that offers opportunity, growth, balance, and a feeling of value, apply to this job submitting your CV at: www.retail-consult.com/en/work-with-us/ or jobs@retail-consult.com.

Retail Consult ‚Äì Transforming Retail with Passion

Title: Data Analyst (Engineer)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ‚ú®

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üöÄ

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Providing clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions


What You'll Need


5+ years of professional experience in an analytical role, creating impactful data-driven solutions
Excellent background/education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of exceptional mathematical and statistics knowledge


Nice to have


An advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Excellent experience with additional programming languages (Java, Scala, C++, etc.)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in Physics, Maths, Economics, or Programming


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
DESCRIPTION

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be a pivotal member of our data-driven team, responsible for transforming raw data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making across the organization. Collaborating closely with diverse departments such as Finance, Operations, Logistics, Marketing, and Product Engineering, you will gather requirements, develop analytical models, and deliver critical dashboards to monitor and enhance performance.

By leveraging your data handling capabilities, analytical acumen and data visualization skills, your insights will contribute directly to the company‚Äôs success and efficiency. This role is ideal for someone adaptable and eager to grow in a dynamic environment, bringing a strong business perspective and an innovative approach to problem-solving.




*Only applications submitted in English will be considered*.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Develop, implement, and maintain analytical models to support cross-functional reporting needs and daily monitoring of business KPIs.
Business Requirements: Collaborate with stakeholders from various departments to understand analytical requirements and translate them into actionable data insights.
Design, create, and optimize dashboards using data visualization tools such as Domo, Tableau, or Power BI for clear and impactful data presentation.
Interpret data trends and produce insights that inform and shape strategic and operational business decisions.
ETL Workflow Management: Build ETL workflows and data pipelines to ensure seamless integration and flow of data across systems.
Data Quality Assurance: Conduct data validation and quality assurance to maintain data integrity and reliability in all reports and dashboards.
Continuous Improvement in Data Practices: Stay informed on industry best practices and continually propose improvements to data practices and analytical approaches.
Ad-Hoc Reporting Support: Support ad-hoc reporting requests and contribute to ongoing projects with innovative analytical solutions.




REQUIREMENTS

Technical skills & qualifications

4+ years of experience in a similar role
Proficiency in SQL and solid experience with data modeling in BigQuery or similar database environments
Knowledge of ETL tools and data pipeline management
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as Domo, Tableau, Power BI, or others
Knowledge of Python or a similar programming language used for data analysis and automation
Familiarity with cloud data platforms like Google Cloud Platform and Snowflake is preferred
Knowledge of Spark for big data processing is an advantage
Educational background in Economics, Business Management, Math, or Statistics is valued

People skills & traits

Analytical and detail-oriented with a natural ability to interpret and present data insights effectively
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive, self-driven approach to tasks
Excellent communication skills with the ability to understand and articulate business needs and technical information across departments
Flexibility and willingness to learn, adapt, and grow within a fast-paced environment
Proficiency in English




WHAT WE OFFER

The chance to have a meaningful and positive impact on roads and cities‚Äô safety
Flexibility - in schedule, work location, benefits
Competitive compensation
A fast-paced work environment full of kind, smart, and highly driven people
Great professional and personal growth opportunities
Regular team-building events and well-being initiatives/facilities




WHO WE ARE

Nexar is a Vision AI company that is organising the physical world as digital information. We are a global, connected, and intelligent network of mobile cameras on the road that uses data to deliver valuable insights and build transformative products in vehicle autonomy and safety.

Our goal is to be the best car camera service in the world, with a vast network of smart, connected cameras across the planet. We are unlocking the power of connected driving to protect our users and build a lasting business, and this is where you come in!

We‚Äôre looking for passionate, forward-thinking people to help us execute this incredible opportunity and drive the future of connected driving technology. Join us in shaping a safer, smarter world.

Title: Finance Data Operations Analyst
Description:
GuestReady is a leading short-term rental and hospitality services management company, operating in the UK, France, Portugal, Spain, and the UAE. Since our founding in 2016, we‚Äôve aimed to revolutionize the short-term rental industry through innovative technology and a dedication to exceptional hospitality.

An excitingopportunity to join our high-performing team as a driven, ambitious, and adaptable finance data operations analyst, who takes a hands-onapproach to their daily responsibilities of key back-officeprocesses. We are looking for a superstar who can be integral to thefuture of the finance function.

The role will suit anindividual with great analytical skills who wants to gain valuableexperience and exposure in an exciting start-up. This could be youropportunity to join a high-growth company and compete with yourskills, knowledge, and exposure to build yourself and build thecompany simultaneously. This individual will form a core part of theGlobal Finance team, within the FinOps subteam and will beresponsible for the monitoring of our proprietary payment systemensuring a proper flow of the funds from guest to host. This rolewill be based in Portugal but will be working for all our Globalmarkets.




Key Responsibilities:

Daily reconciliation of incoming and outgoing transfers within the payment system (identifying misconfigurations and miscalculations)
Identification of flaws and improvements needed on the flow to ensure the minimum delay in the payouts
Partner with our product team to improve our proprietary payment system
Collaborate with other teams to drive operational efficiency and process improvements
Maintain and improve fin-ops reports
Assist in ad hoc analyses for Finance or other teams




What We‚Äôre Looking For:

Based in Porto area
Strong analytical and quantitative skills, particularly using Excel (super user); comfort working with large data sets and the ability to identify data inconsistencies and patterns
Studied advanced mathematics
Project Management skills
SQL knowledge
Comfortable navigating cloud applications
Fluent in English and Portuguese (C1/C2)
Analytical, problem-solving mind
Detail-oriented, with a strong focus on quality
Able to multitask, and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
A proactive hands-on attitude
The ability to work with the highest ethical and professional quality standards
Previous experience working in a startup environment would be an advantage




Why You'll Love Working with Us:

üè° Hybrid work flexibility (1-2 days/week in Porto).
üöÄ Join a fast-growing company in the booming travel industry.
üåç Work in a dynamic, multicultural team.
üìö Opportunities for learning and career development.
üè• Comprehensive health insurance.
üßò Focus on wellbeing with supportive activities.
üêæ Pet-friendly office!

We‚Äôre excited to hear from you and discover how you can contribute to our journey!

Don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt tick every box‚Äîif you‚Äôre a 70% fit, we still encourage you to apply. Many skills can be learned through experience, and together we can bridge the gaps.

Diversity and Inclusion
At GuestReady, we celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. Our global team thrives on mutual respect and inclusion, valuing unique talents and perspectives. We warmly welcome applicants from all backgrounds, regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, or culture

Title: Junior BI Consultant
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.

Create and enhance projects in Java, Pyhton, Angular, PHP, .NET and so much more while diving in the world of Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Security and Internet of Things.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

We are looking for a BI Consultant to join one of our teams at Celfocus.

As a part of your job, you will:


Estimate BI projects' effort;
Translate business requirements into BI/DWH solution design;
Ensure implementation of BI projects.



What are we looking for?


Knowledge of ETL using PL/SQL;
Knowledge of Reporting ‚Äì Microstrategy (preferable);
Knowledge of the definition and design of DWH solutions or data modeling (preferable);
Knowledge of functional analysis/requirement gathering (preferable).



Personal traits


Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams, and Clients;
Teamwork skills but also a sense of autonomy;
Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included;
Willingness to collaborate with other players;
Strong communication skills.



What are we looking for?


Interest in programming (also in brainstorming, creating, suggesting and building)
Less than 1 year of effective experience in IT - This is a Celfocus Academy Opportunity
Eagerness to learn
Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients
Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy!
Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included
Curiosity
Did we mention eagerness to learn?



What We Offer

We are dedicated to fostering talent and nurturing the next generation of professionals. As part of our commitment to supporting junior team members, we offer a comprehensive training and mentoring program - Celfocus Academy - to help you excel in your career.

This is a personalized growth Program where you will be given a defined path and have a senior colleague dedicated to guiding you through every step of the way, being your counselor and your career advisor.

Your goals will be set and discussed to promote professional and personal growth through training and collaboration. Follow-up meetings happen three times a year, to assess your progress and adjust your goals.

The program includes


Full-Time Permanent Contract: Enjoy the stability and security of a full-time position with Celfocus.
Training and Mentoring Program: Benefit from our specialized training and mentoring initiatives designed specifically for junior team members. Our experienced professionals will guide you through hands-on learning experiences, ensuring you have the skills and knowledge to succeed.
Career Growth Opportunities: We believe in promoting from within. As you develop your skills and contribute to our team, you'll have the chance to advance your career within our organization.
Collaborative Work Environment: Join a supportive and collaborative team where your ideas are valued, and your contributions make a difference.
Work-Life Balance: We understand the importance of work-life balance. Enjoy a hybrid regime and flexible working hours.



To discover more about Celfocus Academy, please visit academy - Celfocus.

At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services and other markets' strategic opportunities.

Serving Clients in 25+ countries, Celfocus delivers solutions such as accelerating digital network transformation in Autonomous Networks, elevating and monetising business services in B2B2x ecosystems, and providing highly relevant customer experiences through Hyper-personalisation solutions.

  • Knowledge of functional analysis/requirement gathering (preferable).


Personal traits

  • Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams, and Clients;
  • Teamwork skills but also a sense of autonomy;
  • Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included;
  • Willingness to collaborate with other players;
  • Strong communication skills.


What are we looking for?

  • Interest in programming (also in brainstorming, creating, suggesting and building)
  • Less than 1 year of effective experience in IT - This is a Celfocus Academy Opportunity
  • Eagerness to learn
  • Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients
  • Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy!
  • Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included
  • Curiosity
  • Did we mention eagerness to learn?


What We Offer

We are dedicated to fostering talent and nurturing the next generation of professionals. As part of our commitment to supporting junior team members, we offer a comprehensive training and mentoring program - Celfocus Academy - to help you excel in your career.

This is a personalized growth Program where you will be given a defined path and have a senior colleague dedicated to guiding you through every step of the way, being your counselor and your career advisor.

Your goals will be set and discussed to promote professional and personal growth through training and collaboration. Follow-up meetings happen three times a year, to assess your progress and adjust your goals.

The program includes

  • Full-Time Permanent Contract: Enjoy the stability and security of a full-time position with Celfocus.
  • Training and Mentoring Program: Benefit from our specialized training and mentoring initiatives designed specifically for junior team members. Our experienced professionals will guide you through hands-on learning experiences, ensuring you have the skills and knowledge to succeed.
  • Career Growth Opportunities: We believe in promoting from within. As you develop your skills and contribute to our team, you'll have the chance to advance your career within our organization.
  • Collaborative Work Environment: Join a supportive and collaborative team where your ideas are valued, and your contributions make a difference.
  • Work-Life Balance: We understand the importance of work-life balance. Enjoy a hybrid regime and flexible working hours.


To discover more about Celfocus Academy, please visit academy - Celfocus.

At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services and other markets' strategic opportunities.

Serving Clients in 25+ countries, Celfocus delivers solutions such as accelerating digital network transformation in Autonomous Networks, elevating and monetising business services in B2B2x ecosystems, and providing highly relevant customer experiences through Hyper-personalisation solutions.

Title: Data & Business Intelligence Officer
Description:
About The Job

Global Markets is BNP Paribas‚Äô capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutionals, corporates, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning‚Ä¶). We are growing fast with the ambition to become even more relevant for the worldwide activity, which presents many short and long term opportunities.

Your Main Activities Are

The purpose of the role is to Drive the Business Intelligence for FX+, including (but not limited to) reporting on the activity, tracking of the business case, management of the Revenue Sharing Agreements, pricing and booking models enhancements, business development and tracking of the operational quality.


Monitor the FX Payments activity and the revenue sharing
Monitor activity KPIs (volumes, revenues, pricing ‚Ä¶) for all geographies / clients
Manage revenue sharing with TB / DM / IRB partners
Track the FX+ platform performance and operational quality
Support the business development with accurate ad-hoc data analysis (pricing analysis, campaigns targeting and follow-up‚Ä¶)
Build a state of the art industrial ‚ÄúClient Intelligence‚Äù solutio
Establish key metrics, reports and alerts and requirements in terms of digital business performance, in close collaboration with the businesses, to measure activity and revenues
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs ‚Ä¶)


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas (preferential)
Experience in a similar Business Intelligence
An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
Strong appetite for Digital technologies, support and foster a culture of continuous improvement
Experienced in defining and sponsoring projects and project management: business case and scoping study, management of the delivery along with Business Lines / IT / Operations
Fluency in English (mandatory)
Excellent communication skills and client focus
Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
Strong Excel knowledge
Tableau, PowerBI and other IT coding Skills ‚Äì (Intermediate)
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs ‚Ä¶)


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Time Series Researcher | IS Team (Job Ref.: AICOS_Jobs_2025_01) | Porto, Portugal
Description:
Job Title: Time Series Researcher

Job Ref: AICOS_Jobs_2025_01

Job Type: Full-time contract.

Job Location: Porto, Portugal.

Job Description And Responsibilities

Fraunhofer Portugal AICOS is looking for an entry-level researcher to join the Intelligent Systems group and specialize in time series analysis, machine learning (ML), and causal AI applied to health data.

As a researcher at AICOS you will work at the forefront of AI innovation, creating purposeful technologies that positively transform industries, promoting social well-being and improving quality of life.

Your Role


Develop and implement advanced time series models to analyse temporal health data, including physiological signals, wearable sensor data, and electronic health records.
Research and develop cutting edge ML techniques to integrate tabular and time series data for health-related applications.
Investigate and apply the latest breakthroughs in causal AI to enhance understanding, prediction, and decision-making in health-related challenges.
Deliver clear and concise reports on developed models and provide proper software documentation.


Your Profile


Academic Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent academic qualifications in the area of Biomedical Engineering.
Excellent Python programming skills and experience with data science and ML frameworks (e.g., Pandas, Scikit-learn, SciPy, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, etc.).
Solid background in ML, deep learning and time series analysis.
Hands-on experience in integrating time series with tabular data to address health-related challenges.
Familiarity with causal AI techniques and their application.
Excellent communication skills in English (technical and business audiences).


We Value


In-depth knowledge of machine learning pipelines (data collection, data labelling, data preparation, model development, model evaluation, model optimization, model deployment and model monitoring).
Experience with time series and causal AI techniques applied to health data, and a willingness to deepen expertise is this emerging field.
Ability to work with cross-functional teams.
Autonomous, dependable, and enthusiast team-player.
Problem-solving, proactive, and critical-thinking attitude.


Why Should You Join Fraunhofer Portugal


People-centric work environment that encourages creativity and the development of new ideas, in which personal and career development go hand in hand.
Opportunity to contribute to stimulating national and international projects spanning through different innovation topics and application areas.
Boost your technical growth.
Make a difference in creating AI solutions that generate value and impact.
Flexible working hours and opportunities to work from home.
Excellent conditions of employment including attractive salary (depending on the academic degree and professional experience), private health insurance plan, access to entrepreneurship programmes.


Application Process

Applications are permanently open until the ideal candidate is selected.

The selected candidate is expected to start working in February 2025.

Applications must be made to the email jobs@fraunhofer.pt and contain:


CV ‚Äì mandatory;
Motivation Letter;
Recommendation Letters are optional but also welcome.


Observation

The research activities in the scope of this job opportunity are planned to be developed within the framework of projects:


CardioCausalAI - Exploring Causal AI to Improve Risk Management and Service Delivery in Cardiothoracic Surgery, under Notice No. 04/C05-i08/2024 (Artificial Intelligence, Data Science and Cybersecurity of relevance to Public Administration).
SmILE - Smart Implants for Life Enrichment, under Notice No. HORIZON-HLTH-2023-STAYHLTH-01-01.

Title: Data Analyst | Working Capital SME
HTML:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.

Create and enhance projects in Java, Pyhton, Angular, PHP, .NET and so much more while diving in the world of Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Security and Internet of Things.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst to focus on improving Working Capital reporting by designing a new data trail. This involves analyzing existing data in General Ledger and Sub-ledger systems, identifying and addressing data quality issues and manual preparation needs, and proposing solutions for automation and standardization. The role requires gathering requirements for improved data frequency and accuracy, analyzing data granularity, and recommending enhancements to upstream data interfaces.

As a part of your job, you will:

  • Design a to-be data trail for Working Capital reporting utilizing as-is data already available in our systems;
  • Address manual data preparation needs and data quality issue;
  • Analyse data availability in General Ledger and Sub ledger against data problem statements /requirements;
  • Identify data trails that can address current data issues and where as-is data is insufficient propose to-be data trails;
  • Gather requirements to enhance data frequency and accuracy of available data;
  • Analyse data granularity of upstream interface postings and make recommendations on how they should be enhanced;
  • Propose solutions of automation and standardization efforts.


What are we looking for?

  • Charted Accountant or equivalent professional qualification;
  • Experiences with SAP FI (e.g. the ability to run reports);
  • Good understanding of SAP FI data structure;
  • Strong understanding of working capital Accounting;
  • Experience in financial data analysis;
  • Ability to conduct data gap analysis between as-is and to be effective;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Familiarity with HFM can be advantageous;
  • Availability to travel within Europe.


Personal traits

  • Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams, and Clients;
  • Teamwork skills but also a sense of autonomy;
  • Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included;
  • Willingness to collaborate with other players;
  • Strong communication skills.


At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services and other markets' strategic opportunities.

Serving Clients in 25+ countries, Celfocus delivers solutions such as accelerating digital network transformation in Autonomous Networks, elevating and monetising business services in B2B2x ecosystems, and providing highly relevant customer experiences through Hyper-personalisation solutions.
