Title: Marketplace Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
What We Offer

Opportunity to accelerate the pace of digitalization & eCommerce growth through advanced technology, business intelligence, and analytics.
Driving high-impact insights enhancing decision-making across the entire organization.
Driving brand equity and digital sales through enhanced digital experiences.
Interaction with senior business and eCommerce leaders on regular basis to drive their business towards impactful change.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.
Work in a strategic partnership with a world-renowned industry leader.




What You Will Do

The Ecommerce analyst will be responsible for reporting and providing insights and recommendations from data to drive strategic decision making, optimize sales and improve the overall efficiency and profitability of the brand's presence in marketplaces.
Collect, organize, and analyse e-commerce data from various sources, including marketplace platforms, web analytics, and sales reports.
Maintain and improve the existing reports and dashboards to communicate performance metrics, trends, and the effectiveness of trading on marketplaces.
Report on marketplaces activity and P&L and identify potential gaps towards the targe.
Analyse the impact of pricing strategies, promotions, and marketing campaigns on sales performance .
Work closely with the commercial team to identify business needs and work as a pivot with the Data team to build new tolls and reports to support trading.
Utilize historical sales data and market trends to create sales forecasts and demand projections for various products and categories.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, content, and operations, to align e-commerce strategies with overall business objectives.
Present findings, reports, and actionable insights to stakeholders and management.




What You‚Äôll Bring

Minimum of 2-3 years of working experience in E-Commerce.
Completed a relevant degree in eCommerce, Computer Science/Engineering or Economics.
Deep experience in PowerBI Modelling, development and deployment.
Solid understanding and working experience of other BI tools.
Technical problem solving.
Microsoft Stack knowledge, mainly MS Fabric (or Databricks, Data Factory, synapse, other...).
Experience and knowledge in data modelling with Python/PySpark and SQL.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to deliver insights that drive solutions and strategies.
Proven ability to collaborate broadly with flexible, positive attitude and ability to get results.
Strong problem-solving skills. Capacity to use critical thinking and consider all the information that is provided to resolve issues that may arise.
A deep passion for E-Commerce and a thorough understanding of eCommerce websites and business models.
Experience in working with fashion marketplaces and platforms is a plus.
Ability to prioritize topics independently.
Ability to work in the English language with strong written and oral communication skills.
Fluency in other (European) languages besides English, such as French, Spanish, or German is a plus.
Experience within the retail and fashion industry.
Experience within international environments, consultancies, or a start-up environment.




In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

  • Experience and knowledge in data modelling with Python/PySpark and SQL.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to deliver insights that drive solutions and strategies.
  • Proven ability to collaborate broadly with flexible, positive attitude and ability to get results.
  • Strong problem-solving skills. Capacity to use critical thinking and consider all the information that is provided to resolve issues that may arise.
  • A deep passion for E-Commerce and a thorough understanding of eCommerce websites and business models.
  • Experience in working with fashion marketplaces and platforms is a plus.
  • Ability to prioritize topics independently.
  • Ability to work in the English language with strong written and oral communication skills.
  • Fluency in other (European) languages besides English, such as French, Spanish, or German is a plus.
  • Experience within the retail and fashion industry.
  • Experience within international environments, consultancies, or a start-up environment.


In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Fraud Prevention
Description:
Hello! We're Teya.



Teya is a payment and software service provider, headquartered in London serving small, local businesses across Europe. Founded in 2019, we build easy to use, integrated tools that enable our members to accept payments and boost business performance.



At Teya we believe small, local businesses are the lifeblood of our communities. We‚Äôre here because we don‚Äôt believe there‚Äôs a level playing field that gives small businesses with a fighting chance against the giants of the high street.We‚Äôre here because we see banks and legacy service providers making things harder for them. We don‚Äôt think the best technology or the best service should be reserved for those with the biggest headquarters.We‚Äôre here to fight for a future where small, local businesses can thrive, and to commit the same dedication they offer all of us.



Become a part of our story. We‚Äôre looking for exceptional talent to join our mission. We offer a chance to create impact in a high-energy and connected culture, while benefiting from continuous learning opportunities, a supportive community which is proud to serve our mission, and comprehensive benefits.





Job Description



Become a part of our story:



We‚Äôre looking for exceptional talent to join our mission. We offer a chance to create impact in a high-energy and connected culture, while benefiting from continuous learning opportunities, a supportive community which is proud to serve our mission, and comprehensive benefits.



The Team:



The Customer Risk Monitoring team, part of the Acceptance group, is responsible for implementing and maintaining the analytical intelligence that protects Teya and its customers from exposure to financial risks, including fraud and money laundering. Our goals are to minimise financial losses to Teya while maintaining customer trust and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements. This team aligns very closely with the Ops teams investigating suspicious activities.



As a senior data analyst in fraud, you will work collaboratively with the data scientists building our in-house fraud intelligence, the engineers integrating it, the Ops investigators using this intelligence in the real world, and the team leadership aligning this work with roadmap goals and strategic planning. A key expectation for this role is to help shape the short-, medium-, and long-term direction of fraud detection, automated intervention, and risk monitoring at Teya, and we expect the ideal candidate to understand and be excited about this opportunity.



The Role:



As a Senior Data Analyst in fraud, you will:



Deliver insights that lead to actionable and measurable outcomes such as improvement in the fraud detection rate, reduction in false positive rate, and decreased time to detect and investigate fraudulent activity



Be a key individual contributor to a diverse and innovative team, developing a deep understanding of data inputs and driving continuous improvement while addressing fast-moving risks and opportunities.



Work with senior product, business, and engineering leaders to analyse data, identify opportunities for building new models, develop and maintain real-time dashboards, and deliver insights through in-depth reports



Effectively manage business stakeholders and drive initiatives to promote actionable insights, identifying and prioritising requirements and owning a roadmap of deliverables



Build and maintain dashboards, documentation and reports in various environments, including Snowflake, Tableau and other visualisation tools



Build predictive models to forecast our fraud KPIs and evaluate against the budget and actuals



Collaborate with data engineering to build and maintain ETLs and data models relevant to the fraud and financial risk domain



Promote a data-driven culture across the business





Qualifications



Basic Requirements



3+ years of professional data analyst experience in a technical domain



Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills



Experience using a range of statistical methods, such as time series analysis, forecasting, hypothesis testing, A/B testing, ANOVA, regression analysis



Highly proficient in SQL and Tableau (or equivalent BI tool)



Experience working with large, unstructured and heterogeneous data sources, as well as the ability to write and understand complex SQL



Experience building ETL and/or using data transformation tools like DBT



Experience using Python for data analysis



Self-starter, comfortable in a fast-paced environment and able to adapt to changing circumstances quickly



Strong data storytelling skills, capable of translating complex data into understandable conclusions and recommendations



Ability to think creatively and insightfully about business problems



Excellent written and verbal communication skills



Nice to have



Experience with data analysis in the financial crime domain (fraud, AML, etc.)



Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, or relevant experience in a related field





Additional Information



The Perks



We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team;



Health Insurance;



Meal Allowance;



25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays);



Public Transportation Card;



Frequent team events & activities in the office and outside;



Office snacks every day;



Friendly, comfortable and informal office environment.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (French Speaker) | BPCE-SI
Description:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is a Centre of Expertise whose mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the business, operations and work culture of Groupe BPCE worldwide.

Natixis in Portugal is part of the Global Financial Services division, where it applies technology for the development of financial expertise in its two global business lines ‚Äì Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management ‚Äì and, transversally, for the entities of Groupe BPCE.

The Centre of Expertise, based in Porto, currently has more than 2,400 employees from over 30 nationalities, organised in three main departments: Information Technology, Banking Support Activities and Compliance. These teams work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting and creating value for all the business lines and platforms of the group. The project in Porto is one of the biggest investments in Human Resources ever made by Groupe BPCE worldwide.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

In 2024, Top Employers Institute has awarded Natixis in Portugal the Top Employer Portugal accreditation for the second time. This certification recognizes excellence in people practices, following the example of our head office, in France, who was certified Top Employer France for the eight year in a row.

Job Description

Within the IT department of Natixis BPCE-SI, in Distribution et Data, within the Data Team Context:

Natixis is the corporate bank, of management, insurance and financial services of the Group BPCE, the second bank player in France with 36 million customers through its two networks, Banque Populaire and Caisse d'Epargne.

With more than 16 000 employees, Natixis intervenes in three fields of activity within which she(it) has strong business expertises:the Bank of Big Customers, the Savings and the Insurance and Specialized financial services. Corporate functions.

It accompanies in a long-lasting way, all over the world, its own clientele of companies, financial institutions and institutional investors and the private individual clients, professionals and SME of both networks of the Group BPCE.

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to join our team. A strong background in data analysis, statistical methods, and data visualization is required. Work closely with various departments to gather data, analyze trends, and provide actionable insights to support business objectives.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Collection and Management:

Gather and clean data from various sources, including databases, spreadsheets, and external APIs.

Maintain and update databases to ensure data integrity and accessibility.

Data Analysis:

Analyze large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and correlations.

Use statistical techniques to interpret data and generate actionable insights.

Reporting:

Create comprehensive reports and dashboards to present findings to stakeholders.

Prepare visualizations using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Excel to communicate complex data in an understandable format.

Collaboration:

Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, finance, and operations, to understand their data needs and provide support.

Collaborate with data engineers and other IT staff to improve data collection and processing methods.

Business Insights:

Provide recommendations based on data analysis to drive business strategies and improve performance.

Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and report on progress towards goals.

Continuous Improvement:

Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and visualization.

Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement solutions.

Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL,
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with statistical methods and data modeling techniques is a plus.
Must be french-speaker, at least C1


Additional Information

At Natixis, we are committed to fostering a working environment where each and every one of our people is treated with dignity and respect and where every voice is heard. Our differences make us collectively stronger and are a source of fulfilment, innovation and performance.

In the framework of its Diversity, Equity & Inclusion policy, Natixis in Portugal has implemented a Blind CV Screening process, with the purpose of reducing hiring bias. A blind CV excludes any personal details which refer to the applicant‚Äôs gender, age or ethnicity. When applying for our positions, please submit a blind CV, that is, with no picture, name, gender, age, nationality, ethnicity and address. Your personal statement, work experience, courses and certifications, education, skills and contact information is what matters to us.

#MuchMoreThanJustAJob

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Start your day having breakfast with the Team and grab fresh fruit on the way to your seat, in one of Porto‚Äôs most typical neighborhoods. This Purple Day is going to be a busy one: daily meeting ensuring all team members are on the same page regarding work status, priorities and blockers, language class and, just after, a Talent Management meeting with your manager, discussing your career path.

Lunch break. Today, your Team is onboarding newcomers, but also welcoming French colleagues: the perfect excuse to walk downtown and bond over a francesinha. When returning, inhale nature and peace of mind in Natixis Urban Garden (look at the crops; ready to harvest!).

Back inside. Brainstorming session on a new, exciting project in our disruptive and immersive Manaus Village. The afternoon went flying (tasks, meetings, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: celebrating cultural diversity with a Diwali, the Indian festival of lights.

Tomorrow, you attend a conference led by influential speakers in your industry and, the day after, you will work from home, benefitting from some focus time to complete that report and soft skills course on LinkedIn Learning. Once you are done with your work for the day, strike the right note playing with Natixis band or be part of a board games session. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour.

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Title: Risk Support Analyst - Porto or LX
Description:
Job description:

The team in Portugal is focusing on the quality aspects of the data that feeds those systems: ensuring data quality issues are resolved, putting in place meaningful Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) about data quality, reviewing and improving existing processes and KPIs, and assisting on the preparation of material for committees where those KPIs are discussed.




The mission of Operations team is met by:

Ensuring clients and Senior management have a clear vision of the quality of the services provided by Operation teams, thanks to the production of meaningful KPIs about our main services
Resolution of incidents related to data availability/quality.
Regular calibration of market variables used for the calculation of risk metrics.
Streamlining, running, documenting existing processes that currently lack industrialization




We are looking for one analyst to join our team and work on managing the support activities for Risk Systems applications. They will be expected to provide technical and functional support to Risk Systems Portugal.




Main Tasks:

Work on Data quality aspects, putting in place Key Performance Indicators about the quality of the data in our systems (statistics on timeliness and quality of daily risk indicators) and maintaining these KPIs
Investigate issues detected by those KPIs and help to resolve them permanently
Provide training and guidance to new users of the system where required
Build close links with risk analysts and other internal RISK Systems clients

Technical Skills:

Unix/Linux Systems
Shell/Python Scripting
DB modeling, architecture, and SQL
Knowledge of Java

  • Knowledge of Java

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US üöÄ

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations ‚Äì all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.




LOCATIONüåç

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.




WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH üë®üèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèº

We have a matrixed structure here at Hostelworld; with Growth teams comprising of people across Technology, Product, Marketing and Analytics & Insights (A&I) ‚Äì all working towards one common goal with aligned objectives.

This role sits in the Mobile Analytics Team reporting to the Head of Growth Analytics. We are seeking a CRM Analyst to play a crucial role in enhancing our customer relationships through data-driven insights. You will be instrumental in analysing customer behaviours, segmenting audiences, and optimising our marketing efforts to improve customer engagement and retention. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and enhance the customer journey in the travel sector. You will be working with best in class technology and working within a wider motivated team of data analysts, engineers and scientists.

Our core data stack:

Front End Tracking: Google Analytics
CDP: Segment
CRM: Iterable
Data Storage: GCP & Snowflake
Data Visualisation and Usage: Tableau, Snowflake, Vertex AI
Orchestration: Airflow
Transformation: DBT
Synching data: Fivetran, Hightouch, Twilio Segment




WHAT YOU'LL DO üë©‚Äçüíª

Develop and maintain segments for personalised marketing campaigns based on customer behaviour, demographic data, and booking patterns.
Analyse CRM data to provide actionable insights on customer lifecycle, loyalty, and retention.
Collaborate with the mobile team to design, test, and optimize campaigns across multiple channels.
Monitor and report on the performance of CRM initiatives, providing regular updates to senior management on their impact on revenue and customer engagement.
Manage the integration of new data sources into the CRM system to ensure a holistic view of the customer.
Utilise advanced analytical techniques to predict customer behaviours and identify opportunities for growth and improvement.




WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR üëÄ

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in CRM analytics or a related field, preferably in the travel or tech industry.
Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Excel, and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Knowledge of statistical modeling and data mining techniques is a plus.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Knowledge of agile project management and familiarity with working alongside engineering teams to prioritize product enhancements.




WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

Competitive salary & benefits
Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
Support for your ongoing growth & development
Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days




We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don‚Äôt meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

  • Orchestration: Airflow
  • Transformation: DBT
  • Synching data: Fivetran, Hightouch, Twilio Segment


WHAT YOU'LL DO üë©‚Äçüíª

  • Develop and maintain segments for personalised marketing campaigns based on customer behaviour, demographic data, and booking patterns.
  • Analyse CRM data to provide actionable insights on customer lifecycle, loyalty, and retention.
  • Collaborate with the mobile team to design, test, and optimize campaigns across multiple channels.
  • Monitor and report on the performance of CRM initiatives, providing regular updates to senior management on their impact on revenue and customer engagement.
  • Manage the integration of new data sources into the CRM system to ensure a holistic view of the customer.
  • Utilise advanced analytical techniques to predict customer behaviours and identify opportunities for growth and improvement.


WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR üëÄ

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
  • 2+ years of experience in CRM analytics or a related field, preferably in the travel or tech industry.
  • Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Excel, and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
  • Knowledge of statistical modeling and data mining techniques is a plus.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
  • Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
  • Knowledge of agile project management and familiarity with working alongside engineering teams to prioritize product enhancements.


WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

  • Competitive salary & benefits
  • Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
  • Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
  • Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
  • Support for your ongoing growth & development
  • Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
  • A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days


We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don‚Äôt meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

Title: Data Analyst - EMEA, Multilingual region
Description:
Come and work with us.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Sales Support Team and drive the next phase of growth and innovation for Foundever‚Äôs Multilingual Region. As a Data Analyst, your role will be to work across multiple systems to locate, organize, and correlate unstructured data, ensuring it is maintained and presented accurately. You will analyze metrics, pipeline dynamics, and trends to deliver actionable insights and strengthen our commercial proposals. By working closely with various stakeholders across the region, the analyst will bridge the gap between raw data and impactful narratives, empowering the Sales Support Team and the organization to make informed decisions. This role requires a self-starter who can navigate ambiguity, structure data effectively, and deliver actionable insights that empower the Sales Support Team and the organization at large.

As a Data Analyst, Your Daily Responsibilities Will Include

Strategy (non-exhaustive)


Collect, clean, and organize data from multiple systems across 10 countries in the Multilingual Region.
Ensure data consistency and correlation across various dimensions such as but not limited to headcount, languages, verticals, channels, and various other KPIs and benchmarks.
Maintain a structured repository of accurate and up-to-date data for regular access and reporting.
Compare and contrast data from different setups (e.g., B&M vs. WFH) to provide insights into strategy.
Benchmark against industry standards and highlight areas of differentiation.
Analyze pipeline trends and detect discrepancies (e.g., Salesforce data vs. ongoing opportunities).
Perform Lost/Win analyses, deal duration assessments, and revenue impact evaluations.
Provide forecasts and recalculations to reflect pipeline variations and trends accurately.
Translate complex data into clear, compelling insights and narratives that support client proposals and internal strategies.
Create visualizations and summaries that drive understanding and action among diverse stakeholders.
Liaise with stakeholders across Sales, Solutions, Operations, and other support teams to collect and validate data.
Partner with team members to provide tailored insights and analytics for specific projects or opportunities.
Work closely with the sales and solutions team to ensure that the latest analytics methodologies, case studies, and thinking are being featured in new proposals.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.
Work closely with internal teams (Reporting, CI, Operations, etc.) to uncover insights and trends.
Provide regular updates and reports to senior leadership on the progress and performance of our analytics initiatives and their impact on the business.


To succeed in the role, you will need to have : ‚Äé


Native or proficient level of English (C2) - mandatory
Additional languages are valued
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel - mandatory
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Strong analytical and storytelling skills with the ability to derive actionable insights from data.
Exceptional organizational skills to manage diverse datasets and ensure consistency.
Ability to work proactively and independently across multiple systems to locate and understand data.
Strong cross-collaboration skills to work effectively with various teams and stakeholders.
Advanced Excel: pivot tables, complex formulas, macros, etc.- mandatory
Experience with CRM systems like Salesforce for pipeline analysis.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (Power BI or Tableau).
Familiarity with cloud-based collaboration tools (e.g., SharePoint; SharePoint Lists, etc.)
Knowledge of database query languages (e.g., SQL) is a plus.
Exposure to ETL tools/processes is desirable (advanced Excel or scripts like Python or R to mimic ETL processes is a plus).
Availability to work from our office in Porto; Hybrid model after 3 months (40% Work from Home / 60% onsite) - mandatory.
Availability to work 40h weekly - Monday to Friday - 9am to 6pm


Education And Experience


Minimum 2 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a sales, operations, or BPO environment.
Experience working with unstructured and multidimensional data sets across different systems
Familiarity with pipeline dynamics and CRM systems (Salesforce experience highly valued).


Other Information

This role may require more than one interview stage and an assessment may be requested during the process.

Benefits.


Competitive wages
Paid professional training
Employee discounts
Private healthcare & dental insurance (after six months of employment)
Growth opportunities through various development programs
Fun and engaging company-wide initiatives, including our EverBetter wellness program
Job stability
Life-long skills and experience
Excellent work culture


Go further with Foundever‚Ñ¢

We believe in memorable associate experiences. Here, you can improve your quality of life and grow your career.‚ÄØ

Apply today!

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Junior Data Engineer at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving data engineering, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like


Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards


What we are looking for in you?


Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges


What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

üè†Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

üìöPersonal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

üí∞Annual compensation review

üèÜRecognition rewards

üèù Annual holiday leave

üë∂Parental Leave

üßë‚ÄçüíºEmployee Assistance Programme

üß≥Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

‚úàÔ∏èPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Data Analytics Engineer
Description:
Farfetch is a leading global marketplace for the luxury fashion industry. The Farfetch Marketplace connects customers in over 190 countries and territories with items from more than 50 countries and over 1,400 of the world‚Äôs best brands, boutiques, and department stores, delivering a truly unique shopping experience and access to the most extensive selection of luxury on a global marketplace.

TECHNOLOGY
We're on a mission to build end-to-end products and technology that powers the an incredible e-commerce experience for luxury customers everywhere, understanding the motivations and needs of our customers and partners, to designing and testing hypotheses, to creating industry-leading experiences for luxury customers.

PORTO
Our office is near Porto, in the north of Portugal, and is located in a vibrant business hub. It offers a dynamic and welcoming environment where our employees can connect and network with a large community of tech professionals.

THE ROLE (Porto or Lisbon based)

We seek an experienced and innovative Analytics Engineer to join our Data Analytics & Experimentation team at Farfetch. This role will focus on the evolution of our award-winning in-house experimentation platform, with a special emphasis on advancing our custom statistical engine that processes test results and enables self-service, automated analytics for teams across the company. This is a unique opportunity to contribute to a cutting-edge platform that drives critical insights for one of the world‚Äôs largest luxury fashion platforms. As a Data Analytics Engineer, you will collaborate with data analysts, data engineers, and product managers to optimise our experimentation and Data infrastructure, ensuring robustness, scalability, and flexibility to meet the analytical needs of Farfetch teams globally.

What You'll Do


Experimentation Platform Development: Work closely with cross-functional teams to continuously enhance our in-house experimentation platform, including building and refining features within our custom statistical engine
Statistical Processing: Support and enhance the platform's ability to process large-scale statistical tests, including A/B and multivariate tests, with a focus on delivering accurate, actionable insights across teams
Data Engineering: Design and implement efficient, scalable data pipelines and ETL processes for experimentation data, ensuring reliable data flow from ingestion through to final analysis
Self-Service Analytics: Develop self-service capabilities, enabling non-technical users to perform automated deep dives and access critical insights independently
Quality and Testing: Implement robust testing frameworks to ensure the accuracy and reliability of experimentation results, and automate quality checks for all analytical outputs
Documentation and Training: Create clear documentation for new features, processes, and tools, and provide training sessions to educate end-users on best practices in experimentation and data analysis





Who You Are


Python Development: you have strong Python programming skills, with experience in libraries commonly used in data engineering and statistical analysis (e.g., pandas, NumPy, SciPy)
Data Engineering Expertise: proficient in SQL and experienced in data pipeline frameworks (e.g., Airflow, dbt), ETL processes, and big data technologies (e.g., Spark)
Analytical Mindset: able to understand statistical concepts relevant to experimentation (e.g., confidence intervals, p-values, hypothesis testing) and forecasting models with the capability to implement these concepts programmatically
Data Modelling: you develop and maintain robust, scalable, and efficient data models that support business intelligence, analytics, and operational workflows, ensuring alignment with business requirements and industry best practices
Collaboration & Communication: you have strong interpersonal and communication skills to work effectively across teams and support both technical and non-technical users





Rewards & Benefits


Health insurance for the whole family, flexible working environment and well-being support and tools
Extra days off, sabbatical program and days for you to give back for the community
Training opportunities and free access to Udemy
Flexible benefits program





EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT


Farfetch is an equal opportunities employer ensuring that all applicants are treated equally and fairly throughout our recruitment process. We are determined that no applicant experiences discrimination on the basis of sex, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, age, gender identity, ancestry, sexual orientation, veteran status, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.





SCAM DISCLAIMER


It has come to our attention that there may be fraudulent activities involving individuals or organizations falsely claiming to represent Farfetch in order to attract candidates to a SCAM. Please be aware that Farfetch does not conduct recruitment processes through messaging apps or any unofficial communication channels, other than our official careers website. Additionally, Farfetch will never ask candidates for any form of payment during the recruitment process





As a Data Analytics Engineer, you will collaborate with data analysts, data engineers, and product managers to optimise our experimentation and Data infrastructure, ensuring robustness, scalability, and flexibility to meet the analytical needs of Farfetch teams globally.

HTML:
Farfetch is a leading global marketplace for the luxury fashion industry. The Farfetch Marketplace connects customers in over 190 countries and territories with items from more than 50 countries and over 1,400 of the world‚Äôs best brands, boutiques, and department stores, delivering a truly unique shopping experience and access to the most extensive selection of luxury on a global marketplace.

TECHNOLOGY
We're on a mission to build end-to-end products and technology that powers the an incredible e-commerce experience for luxury customers everywhere, understanding the motivations and needs of our customers and partners, to designing and testing hypotheses, to creating industry-leading experiences for luxury customers.

PORTO
Our office is near Porto, in the north of Portugal, and is located in a vibrant business hub. It offers a dynamic and welcoming environment where our employees can connect and network with a large community of tech professionals.

THE ROLE (Porto or Lisbon based)

We seek an experienced and innovative Analytics Engineer to join our Data Analytics & Experimentation team at Farfetch. This role will focus on the evolution of our award-winning in-house experimentation platform, with a special emphasis on advancing our custom statistical engine that processes test results and enables self-service, automated analytics for teams across the company. This is a unique opportunity to contribute to a cutting-edge platform that drives critical insights for one of the world‚Äôs largest luxury fashion platforms. As a Data Analytics Engineer, you will collaborate with data analysts, data engineers, and product managers to optimise our experimentation and Data infrastructure, ensuring robustness, scalability, and flexibility to meet the analytical needs of Farfetch teams globally.

What You'll Do

  • Experimentation Platform Development: Work closely with cross-functional teams to continuously enhance our in-house experimentation platform, including building and refining features within our custom statistical engine
  • Statistical Processing: Support and enhance the platform's ability to process large-scale statistical tests, including A/B and multivariate tests, with a focus on delivering accurate, actionable insights across teams
  • Data Engineering: Design and implement efficient, scalable data pipelines and ETL processes for experimentation data, ensuring reliable data flow from ingestion through to final analysis
  • Self-Service Analytics: Develop self-service capabilities, enabling non-technical users to perform automated deep dives and access critical insights independently
  • Quality and Testing: Implement robust testing frameworks to ensure the accuracy and reliability of experimentation results, and automate quality checks for all analytical outputs
  • Documentation and Training: Create clear documentation for new features, processes, and tools, and provide training sessions to educate end-users on best practices in experimentation and data analysis




Who You Are

  • Python Development: you have strong Python programming skills, with experience in libraries commonly used in data engineering and statistical analysis (e.g., pandas, NumPy, SciPy)
  • Data Engineering Expertise: proficient in SQL and experienced in data pipeline frameworks (e.g., Airflow, dbt), ETL processes, and big data technologies (e.g., Spark)
  • Analytical Mindset: able to understand statistical concepts relevant to experimentation (e.g., confidence intervals, p-values, hypothesis testing) and forecasting models with the capability to implement these concepts programmatically
  • Data Modelling: you develop and maintain robust, scalable, and efficient data models that support business intelligence, analytics, and operational workflows, ensuring alignment with business requirements and industry best practices
  • Collaboration & Communication: you have strong interpersonal and communication skills to work effectively across teams and support both technical and non-technical users




Rewards & Benefits

  • Health insurance for the whole family, flexible working environment and well-being support and tools
  • Extra days off, sabbatical program and days for you to give back for the community
  • Training opportunities and free access to Udemy
  • Flexible benefits program




EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT

  • Farfetch is an equal opportunities employer ensuring that all applicants are treated equally and fairly throughout our recruitment process. We are determined that no applicant experiences discrimination on the basis of sex, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, age, gender identity, ancestry, sexual orientation, veteran status, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.




SCAM DISCLAIMER

  • It has come to our attention that there may be fraudulent activities involving individuals or organizations falsely claiming to represent Farfetch in order to attract candidates to a SCAM. Please be aware that Farfetch does not conduct recruitment processes through messaging apps or any unofficial communication channels, other than our official careers website. Additionally, Farfetch will never ask candidates for any form of payment during the recruitment process




As a Data Analytics Engineer, you will collaborate with data analysts, data engineers, and product managers to optimise our experimentation and Data infrastructure, ensuring robustness, scalability, and flexibility to meet the analytical needs of Farfetch teams globally.

Title: Data Analytics Specialist
Description:
The Zumtobel Group is an international lighting group and a leading supplier of innovative lighting solutions, lighting components and associated services. With its core brands, Zumtobel, Thorn and Tridonic, the Group offers its customers around the world a comprehensive portfolio of products and services.




Your job:




What it's all about: Industry in transition - better design of global business processes

LED, rental lighting solutions, Internet of Things: our industry and the Zumtobel Group are changing rapidly. We play a very central role in this process - we ensure the best processes in this turbulent environment. We develop existing business processes further and, where necessary, we also rethink things completely.




Our IT team: concentrated competence with a relaxed approach

We are currently about 160 colleagues in Corporate IT who are responsible for process management, IT applications and IT infrastructure. In specialized teams, we optimise the Zumtobel Group on the basis of modern SAP systems. Things are very relaxed here, we're on a first-name basis, but above all we never leave each other out in the rain. New colleagues particularly appreciate that. We work in bright open-plan offices in an architectural gem with a barbecue-tested roof terrace.




Your task: Digital transformation of business processes




You will be part of the IT Solutions Team - Data Analytics and responsible for the Analytics Platform in the Zumtobel Group, together with your colleagues in Dornbirn and Manila.
You will maintain a close and cooperative relationship with the specialist departments and advise them on all requirements in the area of data analytics.
You will be part of the Business Analytics Competence Centre consisting of IT and the specialist departments such as controlling, accounting, logistics
You do everything to ensure that your project brings maximum benefit in the end: you get the right people on board, including external specialists, bring together different points of view, fight for user-friendly solutions
Thanks to your intuition for current trends, you are able to see their opportunities and innovation potentials in the area of company-wide data strategy for our business.
With us, you can make a difference: Our IT landscape is in upheaval and you can drive digitalization with us. You will also actively shape and work in the IT planning process.




Your profile




You have several years of professional experience in the field of data management/data analyst
You have deep knowledge and practical experience in tools such as SAP BW Version 7.5, SAP BW S/4 Hana with experience in data modelling using Hana views for reporting, ABAP for BW, CDS views on S/4 Hana. Knowledge in SAP SAC or MS Power BI as front end tools. In addition, you have experience with SAP Datasphere or other Data Warehouses on the cloud (Microsoft Azure or similar).
You like to think in terms of numbers and processes, quickly see the connections in detail and thus understand the processes in the business. In addition, you already have project management experience in agile and classic project environments, ideally in change projects.
You have a high affinity for digitalization and are a solution-focused, hands-on personality with a strong results orientation. With your enthusiasm, good arguments and empathy, you engage your team members and stakeholders in the change process.
You are good at bringing people from different areas and cultures together and find it easy to communicate at all hierarchy levels.
Excellent English skills round off your profile.




The Zumtobel Group: a company with many benefits




Successful, international group with family DNA
Flexible working time and hybrid work model.
Numerous opportunities for further development in an innovative and empowering company.
Great team that will support you in any situation.
Individual options to ensure a healthy work-life balance




Learn more about our corporate company culture in our enlightening video - where we live light and thrive together!




We live light

Title: Data Governance & Supervision - ERM
Description:
Company Description

Natixis is a French multinational financial services firm specialized in asset & wealth management, corporate & investment banking, insurance and payments. A subsidiary of Groupe BPCE, the second-largest banking group in France through its two retail banking networks, Banque Populaire and Caisse d‚ÄôEpargne, Natixis counts nearly 16,000 employees across 38 countries.

As Natixis Innovation Hub, Natixis in Portugal mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the bank‚Äôs business, operations and work culture, being a key driver of the company‚Äôs culture of agility and innovation. Teams of IT and Banking Support Activities work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting all the business lines and country platforms.

Job Description

Team presentation and main goal:

Within the Risk Direction, in the "Enterprise Risk Management" (ERM) Department, the DG&S (Data Governance & Supervision) team is responsible for the overall coordination, supervision of governance, controls, and all BCBS 239 processes, as well as defining and implementing the Data strategy and managing the AI initiatives across all relevant applications and scopes. The team is also in charge of communication with the ECB, the BPCE Group, and senior management.

We are looking for a junior candidate to join our team as a Data Developer and Analyst, with knowledge and enthusiasm for new technologies within the AI and the broader IT area, banking risks, regulations, and the field of Data. The ideal candidate should also possess advanced programming skills, particularly in VBA and Python, and ideally have a solid experience in developing end-to-end applications (including visualizations, e.g., with Tableau)

Main tasks and goals:

Responsibilities:


Develop and maintain data analysis solutions that incorporate business and operational aspects.
Utilize new technologies to improve existing processes and solutions.
Program in Python/VBA/SQL for the creation of end-to-end applications.
Apply theoretical knowledge of banking risks and regulations in the context of data analysis.
Contribute to the implementation of Data solutions to meet the needs of business teams.
Research and analyse potential AI applications within the organization, identifying opportunities to leverage AI for enhanced data analysis and decision-making.
Facilitate Stakeholder Communication: Act as a liaison between technical teams and business stakeholders to ensure a clear understanding of AI initiatives and their implications.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement Data and AI-driven solutions, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Educate and Advocate for Data & AI: Share knowledge of Data & AI capabilities and benefits with team members and stakeholders, fostering a culture of innovation and data-driven decision-making.
Support Data Quality Initiatives: Work with teams to ensure high-quality data is available for AI models, contributing to data governance and management efforts.


Qualifications


Degree in Finance, Computer Science, Statistic (or relevant area)
Good knowledge of banking activities and products, as well as associated risks
Fluency in English (mandatory)
Excellent command of Excel and VBA, as well as Microsoft tools (particularly PowerPoint and Word)
Very good knowledge of SQL, as well as Python or other programming languages (is desired)
A first experience with BI tools would be highly appreciated (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik, etc.)
Good theoretical knowledge of banking risks and regulations
Basic knowledge of banking regulations and BCBS 239 principles
Strong analytical skills, rigor, excellent written and oral presentation abilities, and autonomy
Great interpersonal skills that facilitate communication and presentation of work results to decision-makers, along with strong listening abilities


We will only consider English Cv's.

Additional Information

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. After grabbing a cup of coffee and fresh fruit, pick up your laptop and choose your spot for the day. It's going to be a busy one: French class before lunch and, just after, quick medical appointment at Natixis doctor's office. Lunch break. Outside in the big terrace (look at your crops at the Urban Garden; ready to harvest!) or, if you feel like stretching your legs, walk downtown to grab lunch.

Back inside. Quick sprint review (working together anywhere means virtual happy birthday to that colleague in Paris that just turned 35). The afternoon went flying (tasks, reports, calls, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: just one PlayStation game or the final match for that ping-pong tournament.

Tomorrow, you complete that certified technical training and the day after, you will work from home, taking advantage to finally do that online course on Udemy. Once you are done with your tasks for the day, you can visit the office for a board games session or show up at the rehearsal of one of Natixis bands. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to surf some waves or join them in a football match.

Title: Power BI Application Owner
Description:
You‚Äôll be focused in


Providing training and support to users on Power BI best practices and usage
Monitoring and analyze the usage of Power BI to identify areas for improvement
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI features and updates
Supporting in developing and maintaining Power BI reports and dashboards
Creating and Manage On-Premises Gateway cluster
Collaborating with various departments to understand their data needs and support them with Power BI solutions being Power BI Single Point of Contact (SPOC)
Setting Governance Strategies for Power BI
Managing Power BI Capacity/ Fabrics Capacity
Building strong Power BI Community at MAN for collaboration between Power BI users



In order to succeed, you‚Äôll need


Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or comparable work experience
Proven experience (3+ years) with Power BI, including report and dashboard development within enterprise environment
Experience with Power BI administration and tenant settings
Experience with Power BI Capacities, e.g. Premium or Fabrics
Familiarity with Power BI integration with other applications and services
Strong understanding of data modeling, DAX, and Power Query
Experience with implementing and managing Row Level Security (RLS) and Object Level Security (OLS)
Strong communication and analytical skills
Great English skills, both written and spoken.



Company Benefits


1200‚Ç¨ to equip your home office
720‚Ç¨ gross/year home allowance
Performance bonus
Health insurance extendable to your household
Wellbeing program extendable to your household
Life insurance
Pension fund
Smartphone & Unlimited phone data plan
Discounts on VW Group cars and special financing conditions
Relocation package & Visa process sponsorship (if applicable)



Cool Things You‚Äôll Experience In Our Work Environment


Tailored remote-friendly setup for every team's vibe!
Flexible working hours
Multicultural reality with + 30 different nationalities
Pet friendly environment
Boost your career with our internal mobility program, focused on your personal & professional growth
Mix and mingle across teams for idea-sharing and bonding



About VWDS

Technology-driven trends such as diverse mobility, electrification and connectivity will revolutionize the mobility industry in the next decade. Volkswagen Group, as world leader in the automotive industry, is setting the pace for this revolution.

At Volkswagen Digital Solutions (VWDS) we are the go-to team to tackle complex systems and programming challenges. We make sure that our products flow smoothly in all stages of the digital value chain.

Our main areas of focus: vehicle software & operations, mobile online services, IT security, fleet management, sales & after sales, purchasing & logistics and product portfolio management.

Ready to #ExploreNewRoads? Join us! üöó

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
We're looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join an exciting and challenging project in Porto, working within the Quantitative Data Intelligence Team!


What You'll Do:


  • Leverage large volumes of data from internal sources;
  • Develop, maintain, and support data pipelines;
  • Understand and be the point of contact for the business and assess its needs;
  • Ensure architecture meets business requirements;
  • Recommend ways to efficiently provide quality data and added value;
  • Communicate technical information to non-technical stakeholders, including data analysts, product managers, and business leaders;
  • Prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines and delivering high-quality results.


What You Will Need To Bring:


  • University degree in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics, or related fields;
  • 3+ years of experience in data engineering, with a strong background in data architecture;
  • Proficiency in SQL and Python (Pandas);
  • Experience in data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI;
  • Ability to analyze, synthesize, and simplify complex data;
  • Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus;
  • Experience with Big Data technologies (Pyspark, Presto, Airflow) is a plus;
  • Familiarity with Power Query and DAX is a plus;
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills;
  • Strong organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines;
  • Fluency in English.


What Can We Offer You?


  • Integration into a leading organization with sustained growth;
  • Involvement in pioneering projects with innovative technological solutions;
  • Strong IT training plans;
  • Professional evolution with ambitious national and international projects.

You can also explore our content about the job market here.

Title: Senior Digital Insight Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.

Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences. Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work.

Senior Insight Analyst needed to join our team, here at VML Enterprise Solutions.

The Opportunity

Senior Insight Analyst required to joining our rapidly expanding Customer Insight and Activation team (CIA). As a Senior Insight Analyst you will have the opportunity to work on multiple projects with some of our largest projects. Reporting to the Insights Lead, you will be responsible for analysing digital behaviour in order to provide key, actionable insight and critical recommendations to our clients. This is more than just an insight role; it's an opportunity to help shape the digital and business strategies of some of the world's leading brands and retailers! We are tool agnostic and depending on client requirements you will use tools like Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics or Content Square for tracking data, GTM, Adobe Launch or Tealium for implementing tags and a mixture of Google Data studio, Power BI, Advanced Excel and PowerPoint for visualisation. Also you may be required to work with the wider GCP or Microsoft tool suite to leverage other type of data in your analysis.

Please note that this job is a full-time position in Portugal, but the selection process will be conducted in English.

Please send over your CV in English

What You'll Be Doing


Creating measurement plans that identify the customer behaviour to be tracked (you will work closely with our implementation analysts for this)
Establishing detailed reporting and visualisations that help our clients understand the performance of their digital channels.
Using measurement tools to analyse visitor behaviour in detail, across a wide range of digital properties (websites, mobile applications, instore devices)
Creating detailed insight reports that cover key findings and recommendations.
Presenting your findings to a senior-level client audience and helping them understand what it means for their business.
Working with our internal CX and Design teams to inform the creation of new websites and apps.
Answering client queries and running training sessions with them


What we want from you:


Extensive experience working as an analyst providing insight, ideally in an ecommerce setting (client or agency)
Must have Advanced practical knowledge of various Analytics tools and techniques.
Numerically adept in using Excel (or similar) to analyse data.
Previous experience supporting junior team members.
Highly proficient in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint.
Extensive experience working with senior client stakeholders.
Effective time and project management as well as multitasking abilities.
A proven track record of delivering large insight projects for leading B2B and B2C organisations.


What we can offer you:

Alongside the opportunity to work with some of the most exciting brands around the world, we'll also prioritise your career development and help you grow your skills. We'll empower you to make a difference, allow you to be yourself, and respect who you are.

We offer a great benefits package including social events, training opportunities, medical and dental insurance, life assurance, meal cards and much more.

Our personality and behaviours: We believe that we are what we do, not just what we say. Our shared values and behaviours show how to bring the VML Enterprise Solution's culture to life through the actions we all take every day:


Connect Meaningfully
Inspire Creatively
Include Purposefully
Approach Positively


Our brilliant, talented people are what makes VML Enterprise Solutions what we are. That's why we look for people who go beyond and always push our thinking to be better than yesterday.

AT VML Enterprise Solutions

Our Enterprise Solutions division houses strategic consultants, creative and technical architects and skilled developers and operators that together help some of the world's leading organisations to deliver outstanding digital experiences across all major routes to market worldwide: marketplaces, online retailers, D2C, B2B and social platforms. With over 4,200 experts in 55 operational centres across 34 countries, our capabilities span the entire buying journey from customer acquisition, through engagement, to conversion and loyalty, driving multi-channel growth for world-leading brands.

We work with some of the most exciting brands such as The Coca-Cola Company, EY, Bosch, Unilever, Ford, DFS, Mercedes-Benz, Johnson & Johnson, Nestl√©, Sainsbury's, Selfridges, Shell and Tiffany & Co. We've built over 500 platforms for brands and retailers and generate in excess of $29bn annually for our clients and work with over 50 strategic partners including Adobe, SAP, Salesforce, HCL, Shopify, Sitecore, BigCommerce, commerce tools and Acquia. Our reputation is based on our people, and we believe we have some of the best in the business.

As our business grows internationally, we're looking for new people to join us on our journey to inspire and take a key role in shaping some of the best commerce solutions, services, and websites in the world. Working as a team, no problem is insurmountable; we share in our client's successes and believe that anyone can show creative bravery no matter what their role is in the team.

In our Lisbon or Porto office, you'll join a team of other specialists who are always ready to help each other. The team is part of our Enterprise Solutions network and works in coordination with our Local and EMEA client leads.

Jo -

At VML, we are committed to fostering an all-inclusive work environment that is both rewarding and career-forward. Our Inclusion, Equity & Belonging initiatives, alongside the VML Foundation, reflect our dedication to giving back and making a positive impact in our communities and beyond. Our people are the heartbeat of our organization-creators, doers, innovators, makers, and thinkers-who drive not just marketing, but meaningful experiences that resonate in every action and interaction.

VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn, and X.

When you click "Submit Application", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
DESCRIPTION

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be a pivotal member of our data-driven team, responsible for transforming raw data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making across the organization. Collaborating closely with diverse departments such as Finance, Operations, Logistics, Marketing, and Product Engineering, you will gather requirements, develop analytical models, and deliver critical dashboards to monitor and enhance performance.

By leveraging your data handling capabilities, analytical acumen and data visualization skills, your insights will contribute directly to the company‚Äôs success and efficiency. This role is ideal for someone adaptable and eager to grow in a dynamic environment, bringing a strong business perspective and an innovative approach to problem-solving.




*Only applications submitted in English will be considered*.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Develop, implement, and maintain analytical models to support cross-functional reporting needs and daily monitoring of business KPIs.
Business Requirements: Collaborate with stakeholders from various departments to understand analytical requirements and translate them into actionable data insights.
Design, create, and optimize dashboards using data visualization tools such as Domo, Tableau, or Power BI for clear and impactful data presentation.
Interpret data trends and produce insights that inform and shape strategic and operational business decisions.
ETL Workflow Management: Build ETL workflows and data pipelines to ensure seamless integration and flow of data across systems.
Data Quality Assurance: Conduct data validation and quality assurance to maintain data integrity and reliability in all reports and dashboards.
Continuous Improvement in Data Practices: Stay informed on industry best practices and continually propose improvements to data practices and analytical approaches.
Ad-Hoc Reporting Support: Support ad-hoc reporting requests and contribute to ongoing projects with innovative analytical solutions.




REQUIREMENTS

Technical skills & qualifications

4+ years of experience in a similar role
Proficiency in SQL and solid experience with data modeling in BigQuery or similar database environments
Knowledge of ETL tools and data pipeline management
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as Domo, Tableau, Power BI, or others
Knowledge of Python or a similar programming language used for data analysis and automation
Familiarity with cloud data platforms like Google Cloud Platform and Snowflake is preferred
Knowledge of Spark for big data processing is an advantage
Educational background in Economics, Business Management, Math, or Statistics is valued

People skills & traits

Analytical and detail-oriented with a natural ability to interpret and present data insights effectively
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive, self-driven approach to tasks
Excellent communication skills with the ability to understand and articulate business needs and technical information across departments
Flexibility and willingness to learn, adapt, and grow within a fast-paced environment
Proficiency in English




WHAT WE OFFER

The chance to have a meaningful and positive impact on roads and cities‚Äô safety
Flexibility - in schedule, work location, benefits
Competitive compensation
A fast-paced work environment full of kind, smart, and highly driven people
Great professional and personal growth opportunities
Regular team-building events and well-being initiatives/facilities




WHO WE ARE

Nexar is a Vision AI company that is organising the physical world as digital information. We are a global, connected, and intelligent network of mobile cameras on the road that uses data to deliver valuable insights and build transformative products in vehicle autonomy and safety.

Our goal is to be the best car camera service in the world, with a vast network of smart, connected cameras across the planet. We are unlocking the power of connected driving to protect our users and build a lasting business, and this is where you come in!

We‚Äôre looking for passionate, forward-thinking people to help us execute this incredible opportunity and drive the future of connected driving technology. Join us in shaping a safer, smarter world.
